children.definition: he-goat, Ar. Eq. 661, Schwyzer 784a1 ( Tenos, iv B. C.), Theoc. Ep. 4.15, AP 6.190.10 ( Gaet.): a young he-goat, older than ἔριφος, Ar.Byz. ap. Eust. 1625.33; χ. ἐξ αἰγῶν kid, LXX Le. 4.23; χ. ἐρυθρός Berl.Sitzb. 1927.156 ( Cyrene).

children.label: II
children.definition: Theoc. 1.6, Epigr. 6.3, AP 6.157 ( Theodorid.), 9.403 ( Maec.). (Cogn. with χεῖμα, χειμών, lit. ‘one winter old’, cf. Lat. bīmus (fr. *bǐ-hǐmus, cf. Skt. himás ‘winterʼ).)
goat-slayer, λύκος AP 9.558 ( Eryc.).
Arist. Rh. 1412a31; v.l. in Dsc. 2.42.
have chilblains, Dsc. 1.37.
chilblain, mostly in pl., Hippon. 19.4, Ar. V. 1167, Nic. Th. 682, Lyc. 1290: sg., Poll. 2.198. (Cogn. with χεῖμα; misspelt χείμεθλον, χείμετλον in Gloss.)
of Chian growth, of wine, AP 11.44 ( Phld.).
in form of a X, Sor. 2.41 (cj.); ἐπίδεσμος Paul.Aeg. 6.66. Adv. -δῶς Sophon. in de An. 19.34.
a Chian wine-jar, Macho ap. Ath. 13.579e.

children.label: II
children.definition: PCair.Zen. 12.17, al. (iii B. C.).
snowy, snow-white, χιτῶνες Asius 13.3; σάρξ Bion 1.10; στήθεα Scol.Anon. 26 (Diehl Anthologia Lyrica (ed. 1) ii 188).
of or from snow, ὕδατα Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 37.12; νιφάδες AP 9.244 ( Apollonid.); κρύσταλλος ib. 753 ( Claudian.). [ ῐ by nature, but ῑ metri gr. in hexam.]

snow upon, cover with snow: impers., εἰ ἐχιόνιζε . . τὴν χώρην [sc. ὁ θεός] Hdt. 2.22: abs., εἰ ἐχιόνιζε if it snowed, ibid.:— Pass., to be covered with snow, D.S. 1.39, Sm. Ps. 67(68).15, Dsc. 4.61, D.L. 6.23 (v.l. κεχιονωμένους), Sch. A.R. 4.269.

children.label: II
children.definition: turn into snow, in Pass., PMag. 13.299 Preisendanz; make snow-white, Hsch.
of snow, σημεῖον Thphr. Sign. 42.

children.label: II
children.definition: crystalline, ἐδάφη I Enoch 14.10.
snow-white, τῇ χροιᾷ Ptol.Euerg. 10J.
eye-salve, Alex.Trall. 2.1.
snowing, Apollon. Lex. s.v. νιφάδεσσι, Hsch. s.v. νιφετός.

definition: χιονόβατος, ον, f.l. for -βλητος, ὄρεα Arr. Ind. 6.7.

children.definition: with eye of dazzling white, Ἀώς Mesom. Sol. 7.
snow-beaten, Ὀλύμπου κορυφαί Ar. Nu. 270 (anap.).
to be covered with snow, Str. 15.2.10, D.S. 5.39, 17.82, 18.25, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.2.6.
snowy, χ. ὥρα Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.182e.

children.label: II
children.definition: χιονόβολος, ον, snow-covered, ὄρη Str. 9.2.25; cf. χιονόβλητος.
nourished by snows, λειμών A. Supp. 559 (lyr.).

definition: χιονόεις, εσσα, εν, poet. for χιόνεος, Nic. Al. 512. [ ῑ metri gr.]

children.definition: fostering snow, snow-clad, σκοπιαί E. Hel. 1323 (lyr.).
snow-beaten, of a mountain, S. Aj. 696 (lyr.).
snow-honey, a cooling remedy, Gp. 8.28.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: become snow-white, LXX Ps. 67(68).15.
with snow-white feet, Nonn. D. 22.136. [ ῑ metri gr.]
E. Ph. 802 (hex.).
snow-white, μᾶζαι Philox. 2.6.
snow-white, of a swan, E. Hel. 215 (lyr.).
snowy, Hp. Epid. 3.2, E. Hec. 81 (anap.), A.R. 1.826, Nic. Al. 150, Call. Fr. 1.53P.; βόλβα AP 11.410 ( Luc.); αἶγες Orac. ap. D.S. 7.16.
snow-white, fair, Nonn. D. 17.43.
Chios, Od. 3.170, Hdt. 1.142, etc.: sts. with Art., Th. 8.15, 28, 38, 99, 101. [ Χῖον ἐς ἀμφιρύτην is dub. in Simon. [119]; but Χῖος is found IG 2.3412.]

definition: Χῖος, α, ον, ( contr. from Χίιος)

children.definition: of or from Chios, Χῖαι [κρηπῖδες] Hp. Art. 62, cf. Aristomen. 11, etc.; σύκινα PCair.Zen. 33.12 (iii B. C.); Χ. ἀοιδός, i.e. Homer, Theoc. 7.47; χ. ἄνθρωπος D. 35.52: prov., Χῖος δεσπότην ὠνήσατο ‘caught a Tartar’, Eup. 269.

children.label: b
children.definition: οἶνος Χ. Ar. Ec. 1139: freq. without οἶνος, Id. Fr. 216.3, etc.; ἐν ἀκρήτῳ Χίῳ AP 7.422 ( Leon.).
Subst., Χῖοι or οἱ Χῖοι the Chians; without Art., Hdt. 1.142, Th. 1.19, 3.32, etc.; with Art., Id. 8.15, 22, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ Χῖος (sc. βόλος), = κύων VI, the worst throw of the dice (cf. χιάς), i. e. the external face of the ἀστράγαλος ( Ruf. Oss. 38), with the ace-dot, opp. Κῷος (q. v.), Χῖος παραστὰς Κῷον οὐκ ἐᾷ λέγειν Stratt. 23, cf. Arist. Cael. 292a29, AP 7.422 ( Leon.), Poll. 7.204, 205, Zen. 4.74: hence prov., Χῖος πρὸς Κῷον ibid. (in Arist. HA 499b29 χῖα is cj. for ἰσχία, κῷα for κῶλα).

data.quote: Χῖος παραστὰς Κῷον οὐκ ἐᾷ λέγειν

children.definition: οὐ Χῖος ἀλλὰ Κεῖος, v. Κέως.

children.label: III
children.definition: Χία, ἡ, = μαστίχη, Gloss.
of Chian work, Critias 35; Χιουργές, τό (sc. ποτήριον), IG ΙΙ(2).110.27 ( Delos, iii B. C.): pl., ib. 111, 112.
mark with a χ or cross, Tz. H. 5.164.
write or mark crosswise, κύκλος ἐπʼ εὐθείας χιούμενος Lyd. Mens. 3.4: pf. inf. κεχιῶσθαι Eun. Hist. p.272D.
with chapped hands or feet, Hsch.

definition: χίραμα, ατος, τό, a disease in horses’ feet, Hippiatr. 52.

children.definition: Suid.

definition: χιτών, in Ion. Prose κῐθών, ῶνος, ὁ (also prob. in Sammelb. 4291), Dor. κῐτών (q. v.):—

children.definition: garment worn next the skin, tunic.

children.label: I
children.definition: a manʼs tunic (the womanʼs being πέπλος, Sch.BT Il. 2.42), χιτῶνα περὶ χροΐ δῦνεν Od. 15.60; κιθῶνας ὑποδύνειν τοῖσι εἵμασι Hdt. 1.155: sts. with a girdle, Od. 14.72; τερμιόεις 19.242, Hes. Op. 537; μαλακός, ἐΰννητος, Od. 1.437, Il. 24.580; [ χ.] λαμπρός . . ἠέλιος ὥς Od. 19.234; χλαῖνάν τε χιτῶνά τε 14.132, 154; οἱ δʼ ἀροτῆρες ἤρεικον χθόνα δῖαν ἐπιστολάδην δὲ χιτῶνας ἐστάλατʼ Hes. Sc. 287.

data.quote: οἱ δʼ ἀροτῆρες ἤρεικον χθόνα δῖαν ἐπιστολάδην δὲ χιτῶνας ἐστάλατʼ

children.definition: ἅμα κιθῶνι ἐκδυομένῳ συνεκδύεται καὶ τὴν αἰδῶ γυνή Hdt. 1.8; σύροισα χιτῶνα Theoc. 2.73; the Ionian sleeved χ. was distd. fr the Dorian, fastened with περόναι, μετέβαλον [αἱ τῶν Ἀθηναίων γυναῖκες] ἐς τὸν λίνεον κ. ἵνα δὴ περόνῃσι μὴ χρέωνται Hdt. 5.87; οἱ πρεσβύτεροι [τῶν Ἀθηναίων] οὐ πολὺς χρόνος ἐπειδὴ χιτῶνας λινοῦς ἐπαύσαντο φοροῦντες Th. 1.6, cf. Eust. 954.50; χ. ποδήρης, ὀρθοστάδιος, στατός (v. sub vocc.); κιθὼν ποδηνεκής, worn by Babylonians, Hdt. 1.195; κιθῶνες λίνεοι περὶ τὰ σκέλεα θυσανωτοί, worn by Egyptians, Id. 2.81; κιθῶνες εἰρίνεοι, worn by Cilicians, Id. 7.91; dub. in E. IT 288 (pl.).

data.quote: ἅμα κιθῶνι ἐκδυομένῳ συνεκδύεται καὶ τὴν αἰδῶ γυνή
περόναι, μετέβαλον [αἱ τῶν Ἀθηναίων γυναῖκες] ἐς τὸν λίνεον κ. ἵνα δὴ περόνῃσι μὴ χρέωνται
οἱ πρεσβύτεροι [τῶν Ἀθηναίων] οὐ πολὺς χρόνος ἐπειδὴ χιτῶνας λινοῦς ἐπαύσαντο φοροῦντες

children.label: II
children.definition: coat of mail, prob. of leather covered with scales or rings, στρεπτὸς χ. Il. 5.113; χ. χάλκεος 13.439; κιθῶνες χειριδωτοὶ λεπίδος σιδηρέης coats of iron scales with sleeves, Hdt. 7.61 (s. v.l.): but distd. fr. θώρηξ Id. 9.22, cf. X. Cyr. 6.4.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: part of a shoe that coats the foot, upper, ib. 8.2.5 (pl.), Arist. Rh. 1392a31.

children.label: IV
children.definition: any coat, case, or covering, λάϊνος χιτών (v. λάϊνος) τειχέων κιθῶνες, i. e. walls, Hdt. 7.139; in Anatomy, coat, membrane, τὸν ἀμφὶ τὴν ὄψιν χ. Hp. VM 19, cf. Aph. 7.45, Epicur. Nat. 2.993.1; ὁ . . χ. τῆς καρδίας Arist. Resp. 480a4; χ. ὑμενώδης, ἀραχνιώδης, Id. PA 679a1, HA 557b16; τοῦ ᾠοῦ οἱ χ. οἱ περιέχοντες ib. 561a14; of foetal membranes, Sor. 1.7, 58, al.; τριγλοφόροι χιτῶνες, of fishing-nets, AP 6.11 ( Satyr.); χιτῶνες ἀραχνίων spiders’ webs, Hp. Int. 3: pl., pods or coats of seeds, bulbous roots, etc., Thphr. HP 1.12.3, 8.4.1, CP 1.4.1, al.

vesture, [ φύσις] σαρκῶν ἀλλογνῶτι περιστέλλουσα (sc. ψυχάς) χιτῶνι Emp. 126; σῶμα χ. ψυχῆς IG 14.2241: pl., προσθέσει χιτώνων ἐνυλοτέρων, of the soul, Procl. Inst. 209. (Accad. kitinnu ‘linen garment’, Hebr. kètōnet ‘tunicʼ; χεθὼν γὰρ τὸ λίνον ἡμεῖς καλοῦμεν J. AJ 3.7.2.)

data.quote: χεθὼν γὰρ τὸ λίνον ἡμεῖς καλοῦμεν

children.definition: Dim. of χιτών, womanʼs frock, Men. 727, PCair.Zen. 469 (iii B. C.); of menʼs wear, AP 11.154 ( Lucill.), Arr. Epict. 1.25.21; of a babyʼs frock, Sor. 1.111.

definition: χιτώνη, ἡ, a name of Artemis, represented as a huntress in a short Dorian χιτών, Call. Jov. 77, Dian. 225; χιτωνέα Ἄ., at Syracuse, Epich. 127, Ath. 14.629e; κιθώνη, at Miletus, Milet. 1(7) No.202.

children.definition: dress, Melamp. Naev. p.508 Franz.

definition: χιτώνιον, τό, Dim. of χιτών, prop.

children.definition: womanʼs frock or shift, Ar. Ra. 414 (lyr.), Pl. 984, Lys. 48, 150, Fr. 325; τὸ γυναικεῖον τοδὶ χ. ib. 632, cf. IG 1(2).386.23, 387.34, 2(2).1514.51, 1517.125, al., PCair.Zen. 776.8 (iii B. C.); also of menʼs wear, Luc. Merc.Cond. 37: prov., [ οὐ πρέπει] γαλῇ χ. Stratt. 71.

definition: χιτωνισκάριον, τό, Dim. of χιτωνίσκος, Eust. 1166.51.
χιτωνίσκιον, τό, Dim. of sq., IG 2(2).1514.28.

children.definition: Dim. of χιτών, short frock ( ὑπὲρ γονάτων X. An. 5.4.13), worn by men, Ar. Av. 946, Lys. 10.10, Phld. Ir. p.39W., etc.; with a girdle, Pl. Hp.Mi. 368c; ὥστε με . . θοἰμάτιον προέσθαι καὶ μικροῦ γυμνὸν ἐν τῷ χ. γενέσθαι D. 21.216, cf. Pl. Hp.Mi. 368c: less freq. of women, shift, D. 19.197, IG 2(2).1514.12, al.; σχιστὸς χ. Apollod.Com. 12.

data.quote: ὥστε με . . θοἰμάτιον προέσθαι καὶ μικροῦ γυμνὸν ἐν τῷ χ. γενέσθαι

children.label: II
children.definition: coat of an abscess, Archig. ap. Aët. 8.76.
Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.285C.

snow, in Hom. mostly of fallen snow, Il. 10.7, 22.152; ὡς δὲ χ. κατατήκετʼ ἐν . . ὄρεσσιν Od. 19.205; ὕπερθε χ. γένετʼ ἠΰτε πάχνη 14.476; τὸν Νεῖλον ῥέειν ἀπὸ τηκομένης χιόνος Hdt. 2.22; ἐπὶ χιόνι πεσούσῃ ibid., cf. 4.50; Ἰδαία χ. A. Ag. 564; ἥλιος . . τήκει πετραίαν χιόνα Id. Fr. 300.5; καί νιν . . χιὼν οὐδαμὰ λείπει S. Ant. 830 (lyr.); also of falling snow, ὥς τε νιφάδες χιόνος πίπτωσι θαμειαί thick fall the snow-flakes, Il. 12.278; χ. πίπτουσα Hdt. 4.31; κατένειψε χιόνι τὴν Θρᾴκην Ar. Ach. 138; ὅταν βορέας χιόνα χέῃ E. Cyc. 329, cf. Ba. 662; ἐπιπίπτει χ. X. An. 4.4.11; χιόνες πολλαὶ γίνονται Thphr. Sign. 24: [ χ.] σφοδρὰ καὶ ἀθρόα καταφερομένη νιφετὸς ὠνόμασται Arist. Mu. 394a36.

data.quote: ὡς δὲ χ. κατατήκετʼ ἐν . . ὄρεσσιν
τὸν Νεῖλον ῥέειν ἀπὸ τηκομένης χιόνος
χ.] σφοδρὰ καὶ ἀθρόα καταφερομένη νιφετὸς ὠνόμασται

children.label: II
children.definition: snow-water, ice-cold water, Θρῄκην χιόνι . . κατάρρυτον E. Andr. 215; χ. ποταμία Id. Tr. 1067 (lyr.); used to cool wine, εἰ χιών ἐστʼ ὠνία Euthycl. 1; οἶνον πιεῖν . . χιόνι μεμιγμένον Stratt. 57; χιόνα πίνειν Alex. 141.10; τοῦ θέρους χιόνα . . ζητεῖς X. Mem. 2.1.30; ἡδὺ θέρους . . χιὼν ποτόν AP 5.168 ( Ascl.): rare in pl., Arist. Mu. 394a16. [ ῐ by nature, ῑ Ep. metri gr.] (Cf. Skt. himás ‘cold, winter’, Lat. hiems, Avest. zyam- ‘winter’, etc.)
well-fed, Hsch.; cf. χλαμυρός.

exult loudly, assumed as pres. of κέχλᾱδα, wh. occurs thrice in Pi., καλλίνικος . . κεχλαδώς, of a triumphal hymn, O. 9.2; κεχλάδοντας ἥβα, of two young heroes, P. 4.179; κέχλαδεν κρόταλα Dith.Oxy. 2.10; Hsch. has κεχληδέναι· ψοφεῖν.

upper-garment, cloak, wrapper, worn loose over the χιτών, Hom. (v. infr.), Alc. Supp. 9.3, Sapph. Supp. 22.9, etc.: in Hom. worn only by men, ἀνεμοσκεπής, ἀλεξάνεμος, Il. 16.224, Od. 14.529; πυκνὴ καὶ μεγάλη ib. 520; οὔλη 4.50, al.; ἀμφὶ δʼ ἄρα χλαῖναν περονήσατο φοινικόεσσαν διπλῆν ἐκταδίην Il. 10.133; ἀπʼ ὤμοιϊν χ. θέτο Od. 21.118; βῆ δὲ θέειν, ἀπὸ δὲ χ. βάλε Il. 2.183, cf. Od. 14.500; given as a prize, Hdt. 2.91; as ransom, Il. 24.230; αἱ Πελληνικαὶ χ. ἃς καὶ ἆθλα ἐτίθεσαν ἐν τοῖς ἀγῶσι Str. 8.7.5; also used as a blanket or covering in sleep, Od. 4.299, 20.4; δέμνια καὶ χλαῖναι καὶ ῥήγεα 11.189; χλαῖναι καὶ ῥήγεα . . ἐνεύδειν 3.349; of husband and wife, μίμνομεν μιᾶς ὑπὸ χλαίνης S. Tr. 540, cf. E. Fr. 603.4, Theoc. 18.19, AP 5.164 ( Mel.), 168 ( Ascl.): metaph., χθονὸς χλαῖνα, i. e. earth thrown over a body like a cloak or blanket, A. Ag. 872: porv., ᾗ μήτε χ. μήτε σισύρα συμφέρει content neither with cloak nor rug, i.e. never satisfied, Ar. Ra. 1459 (the σισύρα being coarser, cf. χλαῖναν μαλακήν, σισύραν Id. V. 738 (anap.)); but also χ. δέ σοι λαβὼν παχεῖαν ἐπιβαλῶ Λακωνικήν Theopomp.Com. 10; χ. πωλεῖν, when spring comes, Ar. Av. 715 (anap.), cf. χλαῖνα· χλανίς, ἢ ἱμάτιον χειμερινόν, Hsch.: prov., ἐν τῷ θέρει τὴν χ. κατατρίβων, of reckless improvidence, Metrod. Fr. 55: τράγου χ. μελέα, of a goatskin cloak, E. Cyc. 80 (lyr.).

data.quote: ἀμφὶ δʼ ἄρα χλαῖναν περονήσατο φοινικόεσσαν διπλῆν ἐκταδίην
βῆ δὲ θέειν, ἀπὸ δὲ χ. βάλε
αἱ Πελληνικαὶ χ. ἃς καὶ ἆθλα ἐτίθεσαν ἐν τοῖς ἀγῶσι
χ. δέ σοι λαβὼν παχεῖαν ἐπιβαλῶ Λακωνικήν

children.definition: wearing a χλαῖνα, Epic. in BKT 5(1).115.
clothe with a χλαῖνα, Hdn. Epim. 149.

definition: χλαινίον, τό, Dim. of χλαῖνα, AP 12.40.

children.definition: one who clothes with a χλαῖνα, Hdn. Epim. 149.
cover with a cloak, φάρεϊ AP 9.293 ( Phil.): generally, clothe, εἵμασι Nonn. D. 1.373.
clothing, χ. λέοντος the lionʼs skin cloak, APl. 16.104 ( Phil.).
one who wears a χλαμύς, epith. of ephebi, Theoc. 15.6, IGRom. 4.360.25 ( Pergam., ii A. D.).

senses.definition: Dim. of χλαμύς, [ short mantle,] Men. 442 (troch.), PCair.Zen. 609.4 (iii B. C.), D.S. 19.9, Plu. Rom. 8, etc.; worn by ἔφηβοι, πρὶν ἐγγραφῆναι καὶ λαβεῖν τὸ χ. Antid.2.2, cf. Teles p.42H.

children.definition: shabby cloak, Plu. Phoc. 29, Demetr. 9, etc.

definition: χλαμυδίσκη, ἡ, in Boeot. form χλᾰμουδίσκα, = foreg. [χλαμύδιον] I, Schwyzer 462 B 36 ( Tanagra, iii B. C.).

children.definition: like a χλαμύς in shape, Str. 2.5.9, 14.
making of χλαμύδες, Poll. 7.33, 159, v.l. in X. Mem. 2.7.6.
maker of χλαμύδες, Poll. 7.159.
wear a χλαμύς, = Θετταλίζειν, Poll. 7.46.
to be clad in a chlamys, μειράκιον . . κεχλαμυδωμένον Nicostr. 32.
Hsch.
luxurious, Hsch.; cf. χλαβός.

definition: χλαμύς [ῠ], ύδος, ἡ: acc. χλαμύδα, also χλάμυν Sapph. 674:—

children.definition: short mantle, worn prop. by horsemen, X. An. 7.4.4; borrowed with the πέτασος from Thessaly, Philem. 34, Poll. 10.124; but said to be Macedonian, Arist. Fr. 500, Phylarch. 62J.; worn by ἔφηβοι, Philem. l.c., cf. AP 6.282 ( Theod.); μάτηρ σε . . δῶρον ἐς Ἅιδαν ὀκτωκαιδεκέταν ἐστόλισεν χλαμύδι ib. 7.468 ( Mel.); χλαμύδεσσʼ ἀμφεμμένοι, of ephebi, IGRom. 4.360.35 ( Pergam., ii A. D.); ἐκ χλαμύδος, = ἐξ ἐφήβου, Plu. Amat. 2.752f, cf. 754f; ἐκ χλαμύδος . . ᾤχετʼ ἐς Ἅιδα IG 12(7).447.6 ( Amorgos); worn by Hermes, Luc. Tim. 30; also by Eros, Sapph. l.c. (v. Poll. 10.124), Philostr. Im. 1.6, cf. AP 12.78 ( Mel.).
military cloak, of foot-soldiers, Antiph. 16, Men. 331, Plu. Phil. 11, etc.; of heralds, Ar. Lys. 987.

the generalʼs cloak, Phld. Vit. p.27J., Plu. Per. 35, Lys. 13, etc.; worn by kings, Id. Demetr. 42, etc.; by tragic kings and heroes, Luc. JTr. 41; by Σειληνοί in a procession, Callix. 2: = Lat. paludamentum, D.C. 59.17, 60.17, al., Hdn. 4.7.3, Cod.Theod. 14.10.1.
mantle, PCair.Zen. 263.2, al. (iii B. C.), PLond. 2.402 ii 16 (ii B. C.), X.Eph. 1.8 cod., POxy. 1288.24 (iv A. D.). (For its shape cf. Plu. Alex. 26.)

Dim. of χλανίς, mostly of a womanʼs mantle, Hdt. 1.195, Chaerem. 14.9, Trag.Adesp. 7, E. Supp. 110, Ar. Lys. 1190 (lyr.): pl., of blankets, bedclothes, E. Or. 42: later, = Lat. paludamentum, Jul. ad Ath. 277a; contemptuously addressed to Cicero, τὰ λεπτά σου χ. D.C. 46.18:—also χλάνδιον, Michel 832.30 ( Samos, iv B. C.), GDI 5633.13 (near Teos).

definition: χλανιδίσκα, ἁ, Boeot., = foreg., Schwyzer 462 B 33 ( Tanagra, iii B. C.).

children.definition: Aristaenet. 1.11 (nisi leg. χλανισκίδιον).
trade of a χλανιδοποιός, X. Mem. 2.7.6.
maker of χλανίδες, Poll. 7.159.
Poll. 7.34.

upper-garment of wool, finer than χλαῖνα (but gloss on χλαῖνα, Hsch.), worn by women as well as men, Simon. 37.12, Hdt. 3.139, 140, Phld. Vit. p.21J., etc.; used by old people, Ar. Ec. 848, Antiph. 33.3; Μιλησία χ., i. e. of fine wool, Plu. Alc. 23, 2.583e; χλανίδα φορεῖν, as a mark of effeminacy, D. 36.45, cf. 21.133; παρθενικαὶ . . χλανίσιν μαλκαῖς κατάθρυπτοι Eub. 108 (hex.), cf. Com.Adesp. 338; σεμνὸς σεμνῶς χλανίδʼ ἕλκων Ephipp. 19 (anap.), cf. Anaxil. 18.2 (anap.); opp. the τρίβων of the philosophers, Teles p.40H., cf. p.53H.; worn on festive occasions, γαμικὴ χ. a wedding mantle, Ar. Av. 1693; χ. λευκή Id. Fr. 491; used as a blanket, AP 5.172 ( Mel.), Plu. Bruta anim. 2.989f.
paludamentum, Jul. ad Ath. 274c, 278d.
Dim. of foreg., Ar. Ach. 519, Aeschin. 1.131; ὑπὸ τοὐμὸν κοιμωμένη χ. Alciphr. 1.38.
necklaces, Hsch. χλάνος· τὸ περὶ τοὺς τραχήλους δάσος, Id.
Pi. P. 9.38 χλᾱρὸν (v.l. χλιαρόν) γελάσσαις to laugh exultingly, gaily (fort. χλοαρόν); but Hsch. has χλαρόν· κόχλαξ; also, = ῥυπαρόν, λεπτόν, τρυχαλέον, ὠχρόν, and = ἐλαιηρὸς κώθων, Id.
warm; and χλεμυρός, ά, όν, fresh-growing, Hsch.
IG 5(2).4.19 ( Tegea, iv B. C.).
jest, scoff, ἐπισκώπτων καὶ παίζων καὶ χ. Ar. Ra. 376 (lyr.); τοῖς καταγελῶσι καὶ χ. καὶ σκώπτουσι Arist. Rh. 1379a29, cf. Plb. 4.3.13, Cerc. 18 ii 5, Phld. Lib. p.29 O., etc.

data.quote: τοῖς καταγελῶσι καὶ χ. καὶ σκώπτουσι

children.definition: scoff, jeer at, treat scornfully, τινα Pl. Erx. 397d, D. 7.7, 19.23, 47.34, D.C. Fr. 109.16; ἐμαυτὴν . . λέληθα χλευάζουσʼ Men. Epit. 215; c. acc. rei, Plu. Rom. 10, etc.:— Med., Id. Brut. 45:— Pass., Epicr. 11.31 (anap.), Arist. Pr. 952b22, Plu. Sert. 13, 25, Garr. 2.504f.

definition: χλεῦαξ, ᾱκος, ὁ, Com. for χλευαστής, Poll. 9.149.

children.definition: mockery, scoffing, D. 24.16, Arist. Top. 144a6, D.C. 39.19, al.
mockery, LXX Jb. 12.4, Sch.B Il. 14.459.
D. 18.85, Plb. 18.6.5, Phld. Herc. 1457.9 (pl.), etc.; μετὰ χλευασμοῦ Plb. 8.6.5; ἐπὶ χλευασμῷ Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.277c; as a figure of speech, irony, Anon. Fig. p.213S.
mockery, χ. εἶναι τὸ χρῆμα ἡγούμενος Plu. Pomp. 36; piece of impertinence, Id. Arat. 39.
mocker, scoffer, Arist. Rh. 1380a29, Procl. Par.Ptol. 230, Poll. 9.149, etc.: c. gen., M. Ant. 6.47.
derisory, σκῶμμα Ph. 2.552. Adv. -κῶς Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39 xvii 9, Poll. 6.200.

joke, jest, h.Cer. 202 (pl.); χλεύην ποιεῖσθαί or τίθεσθαί τινα (or τι) make a jest of . . , Aeschrio 8, Ph. 2.111; πρᾶγμα χλεύης ἄξιον Luc. Par. 40, cf. Hdn. 7.8.4. (Cf. ONorse glý, OE. gléo ‘glee’.)
eunuch, Hsch.
slime, mud, the rubbish carried down by a flood or swept out of a house, A. Fr. 16, D. 55.22, 27: metaph., ἀργυρίου χλῆδον λαβών Crates Com. 28 (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.142; χλίδος Suid.).
warm, Sch. Nic. Al. 206.

definition: χλιαίνω, fut. -ᾰνῶ Ar. Lys. 386: pf. κεχλίαγκα Hsch.: Ion. aor. 1 ἐχλίηνα Hermesian. 7.89: inf. χλῑῆναι AP 9.244 ( Apollonid.):— Pass., aor. ἐχλιάνθην, Luc. Am. 40, etc.: ( χλίω):—

children.definition: warm, σεαυτόν Ar. l.c., cf. S. Eleg. 4; κατὰ μικρὸν χ. τινά Arist. Pr. 888b40; χ. ἵνʼ ἡ ὀδύνη ἔχῃ foment the painful place, Hp. Aff. 10; προοπτήσαντα χ. πάλιν warm up meat, Alex. 149.11; opp. ὀπτᾶν, Arist. Pr. 929b31:— Pass., warm oneself, grow warm, dub. in Ar. Ec. 64 (leg. ἐχραινόμην) ; κέρατα χλιαινόμενα τῷ κηρῷ smeared with hot wax, Arist. HA 595b12; οἶνος κεχλιασμένος Sor. 2.87; of persons affected by fever, Hp. Coac. 154; esp. to be warmed by contact, χρωτί AP 5.164, al. ( Mel.): also metaph. of passion, εἰδώλοις κάλλευς κωφὰ χ. ib. 12.125 ( Id.). [ ῑ in Ar. Lys., Alex., Hermesian., Apollonid.; ῐ in S. Eleg., Ar. Ec. l.c. (sed v. supr.), Mel.]

definition: χλιαρός, ά, όν, also ός, όν Nic. Al. 360; Ion. χλιερός (also in Alcm. 33.5, Sor. 1.52; misspelt χλιεριον in PHolm. 16.27), ή, όν: ( χλίω):—

children.definition: warm, Epich. [290]; ὕδωρ Hdt. 4.181, Diocl. Fr. 139, Sor. 1.82; of food, Magnes 1, Cratin. 125 (troch.), 143 (hex.), Ar. Ach. 975 (lyr.); τὸ σῶμα ἡμῶν ἀτμίδα τινὰ χ. ἀφίησιν Arist. Pr. 884b17; τὸ χ. τὸ ἐν γλώσσῃ Placit. 4.18.1. Adv. χλιηρῶς (v.l. -ρῷ) Hp. Fist. 9; καταπλάσσειν χλιηρόν ibid.

data.quote: τὸ σῶμα ἡμῶν ἀτμίδα τινὰ χ. ἀφίησιν

children.definition: lukewarm, Apoc. 3.16. [ ῑ in Com. ll. cc.; but ῐ in Epich. l.c., Alcm. l.c.]
warmth, Procl. Par.Ptol. 53.
tepid bath, Gloss.
fomentation, in pl., Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 33, Mul. 1.35, Sor. 2.28.

to be warm, in Ep. part., χλῐόωντι ποτῷ Nic. Al. 110 (v.l. χλιόεντι) κρίμνον χλιάον Id. Fr. 68.8 (sed leg. χλιαρόν) ; ἀτὰρ ἡγὸς ἀφάσσων στέρνα πόθῳ χλιάοι dub. sens. in Hesperia 5.95 ( Athens, iii A. D.).

definition: χλίβιον, τό, an Egyptian measure, σκόρδων, ταρίχου, Aegyptus 9.268 (ii A. D.).

children.definition: to be luxurious, ἁβρότητι χλιδαίνεσθαι revel in luxury, lead a voluptuous, sensual life, X. Smp. 8.8.

definition: χλιδανός, ή, όν, Aeol. χλίδᾰνος [ῐ], α, ον,

children.definition: luxurious, delicate, voluptuous, Sapph. Supp. 21.8; χλιδανῆς ἥβης τέρψιν A. Pers. 544 (anap.); ἑταίρα E. Cyc. 500 (lyr.); of Alcibiades, Plu. Alc. 23; cf. χλιδή sub fin.
with delicate ankles, Anacreont. 41.7.

to be soft or delicate, χλιδῶσα μολπά Pi. O. 10(11).84; χλιδῶν πλόκαμος A. Fr. 313: but mostly in bad sense, live delicately or luxuriously, Ar. Lys. 640 (troch.); rare in Prose, χ. κατὰ τὴν δίαιταν Arr. An. 5.4.4: c. dat., revel in, τοῖς παροῦσι πράγμασι A. Pr. 971; πλούτῳ E. Fr. 986; πώγωνι S. Ichn. 358; χ. ἐπί τινι to pride oneself upon a thing, δῶρʼ ἐφʼ οἷσι νῦν χλιδᾷς Id. El. 360: abs., show insolence, A. Supp. 833 (lyr., s. v. l.).

delicacy, luxury, effeminacy, ἐπὶ πλεῖστον χλιδῆς ἀπίκετο Hdt. 6.127; ἄγαλμα τῆς ὑπερπλούτου χ. A. Pr. 466; εὐνῆς παροψώνημα τῆς ἐμῆς χ. Id. Ag. 1447; οἶκος ὀγκωθεὶς χλιδῇ S. Fr. 942; τρυφή, ἁβρότης, χ. Pl. Smp. 197d; ἐν χλιδῇ τεθράμμεθα X. Cyr. 4.5.54.
wantonness, insolence, μή τοι χλιδῇ δοκεῖτε μηδʼ αὐθαδίᾳ σιγᾶν με A. Pr. 436; δυσπότμου χάριν χ. S. OT 888 (lyr.).

data.quote: μή τοι χλιδῇ δοκεῖτε μηδʼ αὐθαδίᾳ σιγᾶν με

children.definition: luxuries, fine raiment, costly ornaments, etc., E. Ion 26; μυρίων πέπλων χλιδή Id. Rh. 960: pl., χλιδὰς πόντος ἥρπασε Id. Hel. 424; of personal charms, παρθένων χλιδαῖσιν εὐμόρφοις A. Supp. 1003; καράτομοι χλιδαί luxuriant hair cut from the head, S. El. 52; ζῶμα . . οὐ χλιδαῖς ἠσκημένον luxuriously, richly, ib. 452; κόμας ἐμᾶς . . παρθένιον χλιδάν a maidenʼs pride, E. Ph. 224 (lyr.):—Mostly poet. [ ῑ only late, Ps.-Phoc. 212 (sed leg. χλιδαναῖς).] (Cf. χλοιδᾶν, ONorse glita, glitra, ‘glitter’, Goth. glitmunjan ‘shine bright’ (of clothes).)
E. IA 74.
wish to be luxurious, cj. Lobeck ( Path.El. 1.157) for κιχλιδιάω in Com.Adesp. 1038.
Ion Trag. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: χλιδός· σακκοπάθνιον, Hsch.

ornament, bracelet, or anklet, Asius Fr.Ep. 13.6K., Ar. Fr. 320.11, Polyzel. 11, IG 2(2).1388.85, 1417.9: pl., D.S. 18.27, Plu. Coniug. 2.145a (prob. l.), LXX Nu. 31.50, al. (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 2.729).

definition: χλιδώνιον, τό, Dim. of foreg., IG 2(2).1445.46.

children.definition: with ornaments on the feet, Hsch.
ornamentation, f. l. for χλίδωσι (cf. χλίδων), Plu. Coniug. 2.145a.
lukewarm, Philox. 2.40.

definition: χλιερός, ή, όν, Ion. for χλιαρός: also Adv. χλιηρῶς, Hp. Mul. 1.78; cf. χλιαρός.
χλίζω, only pf. part. κεχλιδότα· ἀνθοῦντα, Hsch.

children.definition: v.l. for χλιόωντι in Nic. Al. 110.
Hsch.
luxuriate, revel, ἐν τοῖσι σοῖς πόνοισι χλίουσιν μέγα A. Ch. 137; ὅμιλον . . πέπλοισι βαρβάροισι . . χλίοντα Id. Supp. 236.

data.quote: ἐν τοῖσι σοῖς πόνοισι χλίουσιν μέγα

children.definition: slightly hot, πυρετός Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 6.20.23.
to be bright green, Arist. Mir. 846b13: esp. of plants, Corn. ND 28, Plu. Curios. 2.517d, Gp. 11.18.8; τὸ χλοάζον πᾶν Ael. VH 3.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: sprout, bud, Nic. Th. 576; σπέρμα παρʼ ἀτραπιτοῖσι χλοάζον ib. 917.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., feed on grass, Hippiatr. 97.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἄρτι χλοαζούσας αὐλητρίδας budding, cj. for χνο- in Metag. 4.3 (hex.).
bud, sprout, Hsch.
budding, sprouting, πράσιον Nic. Th. 550.
pale, Philum. Ven. 16.5, Dsc. Ther. 17.
greenish, Lyd. Mens. 1.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
Pi. P. 9.38; cf. χλαρός.

definition: χλόασμα, ατος, τό, f.l. for χλώρασμα, Gal. 17(1).929.

children.definition: with a greenish lustre, Luc. Dom. 11.
Eup. 105, Nic. Th. 30, al., AP 5.291 ( Agath.); πρὶν χλοῆσαι τὴν γῆν Ph. 1.30, cf. Jul. Caes. 329d.

children.label: II
children.definition: grow pale, Nonn. D. 8.207, al.
verdant, ὄζος Hes. Sc. 393; χλοεραῖς λείμακος ἡδοναῖς E. Ba. 866 (lyr.); χ. στάδια, ῥέεθρα, Id. Ion 497 (lyr.), Ph. 660 (lyr.); χ. ὑλώδη πάγον S. Ichn. 215; χ. μέλεα Theocr.27.67.
producing green grass, πεδίον E. Ph. 826 (lyr.).

definition: χλόη, ἡ, Ion. χλοίη Hp. Acut. 64, cf. infr. II, also PTeb. 112.46 (ii B. C.), Babr. 181; Dor. χλόα, ας ( E. in lyr., Hipp. 1139, IA 1058, al.):—

children.definition: the first green shoot of plants in spring, ναὶ μὰ μήκωνος χλόην Archil. 108; esp. young green corn or grass, Hdt. 4.34, E. Hipp. l.c., IA 422, etc.; χλόην νέμεσθαι Id. Ba. 735; ποτὰ τὰ ἀπὸ χλοίης Hp. l.c.; opp. καρποί, Pl. Ti. 80d; χλόης γενομένης ἀπὸ τοῦ σπέρματος, of the corn when it first springs up, X. Oec. 17.10; ἐν τῇ χ., opp. ἐν τοῖς σπέρμασιν, Thphr. CP 4.4.7, cf. HP 8.2.4; πιαίνονται βόες χλόῃ κυάμων Arist. HA 595b7.
young verdure of trees, foliage, χ. ἀμπέλου E. Ba. 12, cf. Supp. 258, Ion 1435, Hel. 180 (lyr.), 1360 (lyr.).
juice of green shoots, χ. ἐλαίας IG 7.3073.162 (Lebad. ii B. C.): but σατυρίου χλόῃ is prob. f.l. for σαύρου χολῇ in Gp. 10.21.12.
vegetables, herbs, greens, Antiph. 1.5, Sotad.Com. 1.9, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Verdant, from the young corn, worshipped in Attica, IG 2(2).1356.16, Semus 19, Paus. 1.22.3; at Myconos, etc., SIG 1024.11 ( Myconos, iii/ii B. C.), Corn. ND 28; Δήμητρος Χλοίης ἱερόν IG 2(2).5006.4; also Χλόη alone, ib. 1358.49, Ar. Lys. 835. (Perh. cogn. with Lith. ẑélti ‘to be green, grow’, Lat. holus.)
dyed green, f.l. for χολήβαφος (q.v.).
have green shoots, AP 9.750 ( Arch.).
E. Ba. 107 (lyr.); χλοηρός, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.155.
producing young shoots, Luc. Trag. 45.
to be herbivorous, Ph. 2.340.
eating of grass, Ph. 2.289.
herbivorous, ζῷα Ph. 2.238.
put out young shoots, Thphr. HP 8.6.5, Ph. 1.358.
bearing green grass or leaves, γύαι, ἔονεα, E. Ph. 647 (lyr.), 653 (lyr.); γῆ Ph. 2.494, al.
festival of Demeter Χλόη and Κόρη at Eleusis, IG 22, 949.7, 35, cf. χλοιά (sic) · ἑορτὴ ἀπὸ τῶν καρπῶν ( κάλπων cod.), Hsch.

definition: χλοιδᾶν διέλκεσθαι καὶ τρυφᾶν, Hsch.; also χλοιδῶσι· θρύπτονται, Id., and χλοιδέσκουσαι· γαστρίζουσαι, Id. (Cf. χλιδή, χλιδάω.)

children.definition: producing green fruits, epith. of Demeter, Orph. H. 40.5.
like grass, greenish, Orph. H. 84.6.

greenish-yellow or light green colour: hence, pallor, χ. εἷλε παρειάς A.R. 2.1216, cf. 3.298, Nic. Al. 570, 579; δειελινὴν τὴν δʼ εἷλε κακὸς χ. Call. Aet. 3.1.12 [Fr. 75.12 Pf.]; contr. χλοῦς Hp. ap. Gal. 19.155.

data.quote: δειελινὴν τὴν δʼ εἷλε κακὸς χ.

definition: χλοσσός, ὁ, Ion. for ἰχθῦς, Hsch.

children.definition: maker of ovens or kilns, POxy. 1913.21 (vi A. D.).

definition: χλουία, ἡ, dub. sens. in PHarris 79 (iii A. D.).

children.definition: of the wild boar, Zonar.: neut. Χλούνειον, τό, place-name, Hdn.Gr. 2.459.
Ep. epith. of the wild boar, χ. σῦς ἄγριος Il. 9.539; χλοῦναι σύες Hes. Sc. 177; συῶν ἀγέλαι χλούνων ib. 168; χ. κάπρος Call. Dian. 150.

children.label: II
children.definition: χλούνης alone, as Subst., = κάπρος, wild boar, Opp. H. 1.12: hence ἤνυσε . . χλούνηνδε reached the wild boarʼs lair Nic. Fr. 74.6. The word was variously interpreted:
castrated (because larger and more vicious), Arist. HA 578b1, etc.: hence χ. τε καὶ γύνανδρος ἀνήρ, ὁ χ. τε καὶ γύννις, Ael. Fr. 10.
solitary, κατά τε χαλεπότητα καὶ ἀλκήν Ar.Byz. ap. Eust. 772.59.
foaming at the mouth, from Dor. χλούδειν, = ἀφρίζειν, Sch.B Il. 9.539.
couching in the grass or greenwood, Apollon. Lex., AB 1260, EM 812.46.

children.label: III
children.definition: robber, cf. χλοῦναι· λωποδύται οἱ τῇ χλόῃ εὐναζόμενοι, Hsch.; thus ἄνδρα δʼ ἑσπέρης καθεύδοντα ἀπʼ ὦν ἔδυσε . . χλούνης Hippon. 61; ἢ φῶρας ἀναιδέας ἥ τινα χλούνην Alex.Aet. 5.7; so perh. μακροσκελὴς μὲν ἆρα μὴ χ. τις ᾖ; A. Fr. 62.

data.quote: ἄνδρα δʼ ἑσπέρης καθεύδοντα ἀπʼ ὦν ἔδυσε . . χλούνης
ἢ φῶρας ἀναιδέας ἥ τινα χλούνην
μακροσκελὴς μὲν ἆρα μὴ χ. τις ᾖ;

children.definition: virility, σπέρματός τʼ ἀποφθοραὶ (Musgrave ἀποφθορᾷ) παίδων κακοῦται χ. A. Eu. 188.
Hsch.
grass-green, greenish-yellow, pale, Hp. Epid. 4.13, Pl. Ti. 83b, Thphr. HP 3.18.8, 7.9.2, Gp. 10.74.1.
sanium, Gloss. (dub.).
eat green provender, Gal. 17(1).929.

gleam green (formed on the analogy of λευκαθέω), cj. in Theoc. 25.158, IG 14.1389 ii 24 (v. θέω (B): but these poets may have meant χλωρὰ θεούσῃ ( -αν), misunderstanding λευκαθεόντων in Hes. Sc. 146).
become pale, aor. part. Pass. -ανθείς S. Fr. 1114; -αίνεσθαι as expl. of ( ἐκ-) χλοιοῦσθαι, Gal. 17(1).343:— Act. in Gloss.
green plaster for the relief of pain (cf. ἄκοπος II 2), Heras ap. Gal. 13.1046.
Hp. Epid. 6.2.6.
fresh-throated, of the nightingale, Simon. 73; with the bloom of youth on her neck, of Deïanira, B. 5.172.
f.l. in Jul. Caes. 329d.
bird, Arist. HA 609a7, Plin. HN 10.203, Ael. NA 5.48.

definition: χλωρηΐς, ίδος, pecul. poet. fem. of χλωρός,

children.definition: of the greenwood, or (less prob.) pale green, epith. of the nightingale, χλωρηΐς ἀηδών Od. 19.518.
a greenish colour, paleness, Hsch. s.v. χλόος.
to be greenish, to be pale, Hp. Epid. 4.35, Longus 4.31.
to be greenish or pale, LXX Le. 13.49, 14.37; λίθος -ίζων Herm. Trism. in Rev.Phil. 32.258, cf. Aët. 4.9.

definition: χλωρικός, ή, όν, perh. f.l. for χωρικός, ἀρτεμισία PMag.Par. 1.914.

children.definition: greenfinch, Fringilla chloris, Arist. HA 592b17, 615b32, Nic. Fr. 54, Ael. NA 4.47.

children.label: II
children.definition: grape, Gp. 5.2.4.
grass-green stone, Plin. HN 37.156.
golden oriole, Oriolus galbula, Arist. HA 616b11, 617a28, Plin. HN 10.87.
LXX 4 Ki. 19.26 cod. Alex.
of a greenish appearance, Thphr. Lap. 33 ( Comp.).
green-leaved, στέφανος δάφνας E. IA 759 (lyr.).
prawn ( καρίς), Hsch.
dark green, Gal. 17(2).66.
making green or pale, S.E. M. 6.49, Hsch. s.v. χλωρὸν δέος, etc.
with green feathers, πελειάδες Ael. NA 16.2.

greenish-yellow, pale green, χλωραὶ ῥῶπες Od. 16.47; ὄρος . . χλωρόν h.Ap. 223; χλωραὶ ἐλάται Pi. Fr. 167, E. Ba. 38; χλωραῖς ὑπὸ βάσσαις S. OC 673 (lyr.); χλωρὰν ἀνʼ ὕλην E. Hipp. 17; δόνακι χλωρὸν Εὐρώταν Id. Hel. 349 (lyr.), cf. S. Ant. 1132 (lyr.); also in Prose, σίτου ἔτι χ. ὄντος Th. 4.6; τὰ φυόμενα χ. τὸ πρῶτον εἶναι Thphr. Sens. 78; ἡ χ. the green plaster, Androm. ap. Gal. 13.470; χλωρὸς λίθος, = σμάραγδος, PHolm. 5.10; of sea-water, Poet. ap. Plu. Amat. 2.767f (cf. E. Fr. 1084); of other water, AP 9.669.3 ( Marian.): χλωρά, ἡ, green paint, as a stage-property to represent a river in scenery, Pap. in Eos. 32.30 (v/vi A. D.).

data.quote: τὰ φυόμενα χ. τὸ πρῶτον εἶναι

children.definition: yellow, μέλι χ. Il. 11.631, Od. 10.234; ἀμφὶ χλωρὰν ψάμαθον on the yellow sand, S. Aj. 1064; ᾠοῦ τὸ χ. yolk of egg, Zopyr. ap. Orib. 14.61.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: pale, pallid, χλωρὸς ἀδάμας Hes. Sc. 231: most freq.,

pale, χλωρὸς ὑπαὶ δείους Il. 10.376, 15.4; χ. Ἀχλύς (personified) Hes. Sc. 265; χλωροτέρα . . ποίας ἔμμι Sapph. 2.14; hence as an epith. of fear, χλωρὸν δέος Il. 7.479, Od. 11.43, etc.; χλωρῷ δείματι A. Supp. 566 (lyr.), cf. E. Supp. 599 (lyr.): in Medic. writers, yellow, bilious-looking, ὀφθαλμοὶ -ότεροι v.l. in Hp. VM 10; χρῶμα χ. ἴσχειν Id. Prog. 24; σῶμα . . οὔτε χ. ἀλλʼ ὑπέρυθρον Th. 2.49; also χ. πτύελος, οὖρον, Hp. Prog. 14, VM 10 ( Comp.).

children.label: III
children.definition: green, i.e. fresh, opp. dry, esp. of wood, ῥόπαλον . . χλωρὸν ἐλαΐνεον of green olive-wood, Od. 9.320, cf. 379; opp. αὖος, Hes. Op. 743; τὰ σφόδρα χ. ἄκαυστα Arist. Mete. 387a22; χ. ξύλα ib. 374a5, al.; of various things, χλωραὶ ἐέρσαι Pi. N. 8.40; τυρὸς χ. fresh cheese, Ar. Ra. 559, Lys. 23.6; of fish, fresh, not salted, Ath. 7.309b; of fruit, fresh picked, IG 2(2).1013.23, Dsc. 1.113.

fresh, blooming, χλωρόν τε καὶ βλέποντα Trag. ap. Hsch. (perh. to be read in A. Ag. 677 for καὶ ζῶντα καὶ β.) ; λειμὼν ἄνθεσι (sed fort. ἔρνεσι) θάλλων χλωροῖς E. IA 1297 (lyr.); χλωρὸν γόνυ Theoc. 14.70; χ. αἷαμα fresh, living, S. Tr. 1055, E. Hec. 127 (anap.); χ. δάκρυ fresh, bursting tear, E. Med. 906, cf. 922, Hel. 1189; χλωρὰ δακρύων ἄχνα S. Tr. 847 (lyr.); οἴνου χλωραὶ σταγόνες sparkling, E. Cyc. 67 (lyr.).
unripe, χ. καὶ ἄναιμα πράγματα Gorg. Fr. 16. (Not contr. fr. χλοερός but cogn. with it and χλόη.)
green lizard, Sch.rec. Theoc. 2.58, 7.22.
galucis, Gloss. (dub.).
greenness, ὕλης Plu. Flam. 3; yellowness, χρυσίου LXX Ps. 67(68).14; freshness, Sch. Opp. H. 2.495.

children.label: II
children.definition: pale colour, of gold mixed with silver, Plu. Frig. 2.952c; pallor, νοσώδης χ. ib. Pyth. 395c.
freshly cut, δάφνα Aristonous 1.10.
green cheese, dub. in Gloss.
eat green food, Hippiatr. 10.
eating green food, Hp. Vict. 2.49.
viridiarium, Gloss.

definition: χνάσμι, τό, given as instance of a neuter Subst. in Theognost. Can. 120.

children.definition: slice, tit-bit, Mnesim. 4.12 (anap., Meineke for χναύω), cf. Poll. 6.62, Hsch.; πᾶν χ. ‘every scrap’, = πᾶν πρᾶγμα, Zen. 5.73; χναυμάτιον, τό, Dim. of foreg., Ar. Fr. 224 (anap.), Telecl. 1.14 (anap.), Ath. 9.381b.
dainty, πλευρὰ δελφάκειʼ . . χναυρότατα Pherecr. 108.17.
one of a sweet tooth, Posidipp. 1.7.
nibble, c. acc., Epich. 164, E. Cyc. 358 (lyr.), Eub. 150.6, Ephipp. 8.4.

definition: χνιαρωτέρα χνοω<δες>τέρα, Hsch. χνίει· ψακάζει, θρύπτει, Id.

children.definition: get the first down, Him. Or. 7.3; also of girls, αὐλητρίδες ἄρτι χνοάζουσαι Metag. 4.3 (hex.); cf. χλοάζω Iv.

children.label: II
children.definition: χνοάζων ἄρτι λευκανθὲς κάρα just sprinkling his hair with white, S. OT 742.

μᾶλα τεὰ . . χνοάοντα Theoc. 27.50: more freq. of youths, τὴν παρειὰν χνοῶν Luc. Bacch. 2; c. acc. cogn., χνοάοντα ἰούλους A.R. 2.779, cf. Opp. C. 4.347; of the down itself, χνοάοντες ἴουλοι the bloom of the first down, A.R. 2.43; ἔτι χνοάοντος ἰούλου δευόμενος IG 14.1362.1 ( Rome); of fruit, σίκυον χνοάοντα a gourd with the bloom on it, v.l. for χλοάοντα (ap. Sch. Ar., Suid.) in AP 6.102 ( Phil.): metaph., fresh, χνοόωσαν χάριν ὄμβρου Tryph. 343.
axle-box, nave, ἄξων ἐν χνοίῃσιν Parm. 1.6; prob. in Emp. 46; ἔλακον ἀξόνων βριθομένων χνόαι A. Th. 153 (lyr); ἔθραυσε δʼ ἄξονος μέσας χνόας S. El. 745, cf. 717; ἀντύγων χνόας E. Rh. 118.
χνόαι ποδῶν the joints on which the feet play, as the wheels on the axle, A. Th. 371.
to be downy, νεογνὰ γενειάσι χρῶτα χνοΐζων Inscr.Cret. 1 xxii 59 ( Olus, ii A. D.):—also Pass., Gal. 14.778.
downy, παρειή Anacreont. 16.18.

definition: χνόος, ὁ ( ἡ E. Fr. 1106), Att. contr. χνοῦς, gen. χνοῦ: heterocl. gen. χνοός Choerob. in Theod. 1.234H.; dat. χνοΐ Thphr. CP 6.10.7, Gal. 13.850:—

children.definition: ἁλὸς χ. incrustation from salt water, ἔκ κεφαλῆς ἔσμηχεν ἁλὸς χνόον, Od. 6.226; wool pulled for stuffing cushions, flock, f.l. for μνοῦς in Hp. Mul. 1.61; used in applying a powder, Gal. l.c.; chaff, LXX Ps. 1.4: powder, prov., [ ὄνος] εἰς ἄχυρα καὶ χνοῦν Ar. Fr. 76; dust of the earth, LXX 2 Ki. 22.43, 2 Ch. 1.9; ὡς δοκεῖν τοῦ καλουμένου χνοῦ μεστοὺς εἶναι (sc. τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς) Gal. 16.552.

children.label: II
children.definition: fine down on a flower or in the seed-vessel, Thphr. HP 2.8.4, D.S. 2.59: bloom on fruit, ἐν Καρίᾳ φασὶν ἄπιόν τινʼ ἔχειν χνοῦν ἁλμώδη Thphr. CP 6.10.7; μάλων χνοῦς ἐπικαρπίδιος AP 9.226 ( Zon.); the first down on the chin or cheeks, χνοῦς ὥσπερ μήλοισιν ἐπήνθει Ar. Nu. 978 (anap.); κοῦρος ἔτʼ ἀρτιγένειον ἔχων χνόον AP 9.219 ( Diod.); θηλείαις οὐδʼ ὅσσον ἐπὶ χνόος ἦλθε παρειαῖς Call. Ap. 37; ἐντίκτει τι χνοῦ ἀνάπλεων Arist. HA 605b15: pl., D.H. Dem. 51.

data.quote: ἐν Καρίᾳ φασὶν ἄπιόν τινʼ ἔχειν χνοῦν ἁλμώδη
θηλείαις οὐδʼ ὅσσον ἐπὶ χνόος ἦλθε παρειαῖς

children.definition: bloom or film of archaism in writing, ὅ τε πίνος αὐτῇ (i.e. in Platoʼs style) [ καὶ χ.] ὁ τῆς ἀρχαιότητος . . ἐπιτρέχει interpol. in D.H. Dem. 5; ἐπανθεῖ τις . . χνοῦς ἀρχαιοπινής ib. 38, cf. Plu. Profect. 2.79d; οἱονεὶ τῆς γονίμου φύσεως χ., of χλόη, Porph. Abst. 2.5. (Cf. χνιαρωτέρα, χνίει.)

like fine powder, downy, Hp. Ulc. 17, Thphr. HP 1.10.3, Dsc. 4.68; μηλέαι prob. in Androt. Georg. ap. Ath. 3.82c ( χνοωδίας codd.); of salt, Sor. 1.82; of arsenic, Olymp.Alch. p.75B.: Comp., Dsc. 2.175, Anon. ap. Suid.: Sup., Gal. 6.283, Sch. E. Or. 115. Adv. -δῶς Gal. 11.405.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀὴρ χ., soft, ‘muggy’, opp. λαμπρός, v.l. for νοτώδης Hp. Aër. 15.
holding a χοῦς (A), σκύφος Hippoloch. ap. Ath. 4.129e; σταμνία Anon. ap. Suid. ( χοίδια codd.).

cast in a mould, χοανεύει Ar. Th. 57, cf. 62 (both anap.): c. acc., cast, form by casting, χωνεύσεις . . βάσεις χαλκᾶς LXX Ex. 26.37, cf. 2 Ch. 4.3, al.:— Med., διέχεαν χαλκὸν πρῶτοι καὶ ἀλάλματα ἐχωνεύσαντο Ῥοῖκος κτλ. Paus. 8.14.8.

data.quote: διέχεαν χαλκὸν πρῶτοι καὶ ἀλάλματα ἐχωνεύσαντο Ῥοῖκος κτλ.

children.label: II
children.definition: smelt or cast metal, LXX 2 Ch. 34.17:— Pass., χωνευθείς Plb. 34.9.11, D.S. 5.35; ὑπὸ τοῦ πυρὸς κεχωνευμένος Id. 16.45; κεχ. ἀργύριον Plu. Luc. 37.

children.label: III
children.definition: get together, ἀργύριον LXX 4 Ki. 22.9.

funnel, δίκην δὲ χοάνης (fort. ἀκοῇ δὲ χοάνην) ὦτα διετετρήνατο Ar. Th. 18, cf. Ph. 1.245; κύλικας ἀντλεῖν διὰ χώνης Pherecr. 108.31; καταχεῖν ὥσπερ διὰ χώνης Pl. R. 411a; as a name of the throat, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.3; as nickname of a great drinker, Ath. 10.436e.
funnel-shaped hollow in the brain, also called ληνός, πύελος, Herophil. ap. Theophil. Corp.Fabr. 4.5.5.
hollow behind the eye, cj. in Emp. 84.9 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: melting-pot, Posidon. 48J., Dsc. 5.75, AP 9.528 ( Pall.).—The form χοάνη is said by Moer. p.401P. to be Att. (cf. IG 12313.127, 314.144), χώνη Hellenic.

hollow in which metal was placed for melting, melting-pot, from which it was run into the mould, φῦσαι δʼ ἐν χοάνοισιν . . ἐφύσων Il. 18.470; κασσίτερος . . ἐν εὑτρήτοις χοάνοισιν θαλφθείς Hes. Th. 863, cf. Emp. 96.1, Hp. Cord. 8, A.R. 3.1299.
mould for casting metal in, Anacr. 116.

children.label: II
children.definition: funnel, Hp. Cord. 2 ( χῶνος, as in PLeid.X. 29B., Hsch.).

definition: χοάρβηνα τὰ γράμματα, Hsch. χοᾶσθαι· καυχᾶσθαι, Id.
Χοασπῖτις [ῑ], ιδος, ἡ (sc. λίθος), a precious stone

children.definition: found in the Choaspes, Plin. HN 37.156.
keeper of mummies, ecclesiastical title in Egypt, UPZ 157.34 (iii B. C.), PLond. 1.3.3 (ii B. C.).
Hsch. (cf. χέζω).
Sophr. in PSI 11.1214d. 5.
Suid.
IG 4.823.36 ( Troezen).

pouring out of liquid, drink-offering, esp. made to the dead or over their graves (opp. λοιβή, σπονδή made to the gods), χοὴν χεῖσθαι νεκύεσσιν (where it is mixed with milk), of honey, wine, and water, poured out in succession, Od. 10.518, cf. 11.26, Arist. Mu. 400b22: freq. in Trag., always in pl. (as also Hdt. 7.43), χέουσα κηδείους χοάς A. Ch. 87; χοὰς φέρειν τινί Id. Pers. 609, Ch. 15, etc.; χ. γῇ τε καὶ φθιτοῖς χέασθαι Id. Pers. 219 (troch.), cf. S. OC 477; κεχυμένων χοᾶν A. Ch. 156 (lyr.); σπεῖσαι, κατασπείσειν, ἐπισπένδειν, E. Or. 1322, 1187, A. Ch. 149; πέμπειν Id. Pers. 624 (anap.); δοῦναι S. Ant. 902, etc.; πατρὶ τυμβεῦσαι χ. Id. El. 406; αἴρειν, στάξαι, E. Hec. 529, Heracl. 1040; χοαῖσι στέφειν τὸν νέκυν S. Ant. 431; ἱλάσκεσθαι γῆν X. Cyr. 3.3.22.

data.quote: χ. γῇ τε καὶ φθιτοῖς χέασθαι

children.definition: libations in general, S. OC 469, 1599.

children.label: II
children.definition: stream, Ἀχέροντος ἄρσενας χοάς Id. Fr. 523.—Mostly poet.
fitted for the Pitcher-feast at Athens (v. χοῦς A. III), ἄγγος E. IT 960.
offering χοαί to the dead; Χοηφόροι, a Tragedy by A., in which the Chorus pours χοαί to the shade of Agamemnon.

definition: χοΐδιον, τό, f.l. in Suid.; cf. χοαῖος.

children.definition: holding one χοῦς, PCair.Zen. 61.3, PSI 5.535.15 (both iii B. C.).
of earth or clay, 1 Ep.Cor. 15.47; κόνις Ph. 2.673.

children.label: II
children.definition: of the age to take part in the festival of χόες, IG 3.1342.
Hsch. (s. v.l.; cf. χοινικίς I).
made from a choenix-measure of flour, πόπανον IG 2(2).1367.3, al.; ἐλατήρ ib. 1237.7.
Dim. (in form) of χοῖνιξ 1, Phld. Ind.Sto. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dim. of χοῖνιξ II, Them. Or. 21.248d.
nave of a wheel, Gal. 18(2).479, Sch. E. Hipp. 1234, Sch. Il. 2.104.

children.label: II
children.definition: trepan, Cels. 8.3.1 (acc. written -εικίδα), Gal. 10.448, 19.126.

children.label: III
children.definition: ring forming the stand for a crown, D. 22.72, 24.180.

children.label: IV
children.definition: App. BC 4.30.

children.label: V
children.definition: cave in a rocky shore, Str. 12.3.11.

children.label: VI
children.definition: box or socket for the hinge of a door, IG 2(2).1672.201, 11(2).165.11, 287 A 102, al. ( Delos, iii B. C.).

children.label: VII
children.definition: axle-box, Hero Aut. 11.2, Wilcken Chr. 176.8 (i A. D.), cf. Hsch. s.v. χνόαι.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: box or hub containing strands of gut, Ph. Bel. 63.7, 60.3, Hero Bel. 96.5.

children.label: IX
children.definition: Hippiatr. 96.2, 117.
one who measures with a χοῖνιξ, as a slaveʼs daily allowance, Ath. 6.272c.

choenix, a dry measure, esp. for corn, Hdt. 1.192, etc.; the choenix of corn was one manʼs daily allowance, Id. 7.187; ἡ γὰρ χ. ἡμερησία τροφή D.L. 8.18; given to slaves, Th. 4.16; hence, ὅς κεν ἐμῆς γε χοίνικος ἅπτηται, i. e. whoever eats of my bread, Od. 19.28: prov., ἐπὶ χοίνικος καθέζεσθαι, i. e. sit idle, live in idleness, Pythag. ap. Arist. Fr. 197, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.703f, Ath. 10.452e, Ael. VH 1.26; οὐδὲ τὴν χ. ἔτι λήψει (of gold) Luc. Nav. 27; χ. Ἀττική (1/48 of the μέδιμνος = 4 κοτύλαι) X. An. 1.5.6; in Pap. usu. abbreviated χ, as in PCair.Zen. 645.11 (iii B. C.), POxy. 1044.3 (ii A. D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: stocks for fastening the legs, Ar. Pl. 276, D. 18.129.

children.label: III
children.definition: PCair.Zen. 782 a.7 (iii B. C.), prob. in Supp.Epigr. 4.447.48 ( Didyma, ii B. C.).
Sophr. 98.
suffering from χοιράδες (II), Aët. 12.49.

children.label: II
children.definition: like χοιράδες (II), Hdn. Epim. 153.

children.label: III
children.definition: χοιραδικόν, τό, name of a remedy, Orib. Fr. 91 tit.
rocky, Str. 3.1.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: scrofulous, φύματα Plu. QConv. 2.664f.
like a hog or a hogʼs back, χ. πέτρα low rock rising just above the sea like a hogʼs back, Pi. P. 10.52, cf. AP 9.289 ( Bass.)

Subst., χ. ἀμυδρά sunken rock, Archil. 128, cf. Thgn. 576; opp. σκόπελοι ὀξέες, Hdt. 2.29; ἀκταὶ . . χοιράδες τε A. Pers. 421; χ. Δηλία the Delian rock, i.e. the rocky isle of Delos, Id. Eu. 9; Δήλιοι χ. E. Tr. 89; χ. Σηπιάς Id. Andr. 1265; χοιράδες, of the Symplegades, Theoc. 13.23; αἱ χ. νῆσοι, off Tarentum, Th. 7.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: scrofulous swellings in the glands of the neck, etc., Hp. Aph. 3.26, AP 11.333 ( Callicter), Plu. Cic. 9, 26.

children.label: III
children.definition: sow, PMag.Osl. 1.107.
farrow, PFlor. 148.4,7 (iii A. D.).

definition: χοίρειος, α, ον, Ep. χοίρεος, η, ον:—

children.definition: of a swine, κρέα χοίρεια Ar. Ra. 338, X. An. 4.5.31; κόπρος Arist. Fr. 277; κόπρον χυρίαν (sic) PHolm. 25.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: χοίρεα (sc. κρέα) pigʼs-flesh, Od. 14.81; χοίρειον φαγεῖν S.E. P. 3.223, cf. Hp. Epid. 6.4.4.
pig-dealer, Sardis 7(1).159 (iii A. D.), PGiss. 40 ii 18 (iii A. D.); restd. in PCair.Zen. 331.10 (iii B. C.).
pig-sty, Tz. H. 11.429.
pig-dealer, PFay. 108 (ii A. D.).
Dim. of χοῖρος, Ar. Ach. 521, 806, Pl. Euthd. 298d, PCair.Zen. 478 (iii B. C.), Plu. Phoc. 28, D.C. 78.25; without dimin. sense, γάλα χοιριδίου PMag. Leid.V. 13.16.

definition: χοιρίζω, ‘behave like a pig’, Sch. Pl. Tht. 166c.

children.definition: Hsch.

definition: χοιρικός, ή, όν, late form for χοίρειος, condemned by EM 775.33.

children.definition: cake, Philox. 3.14, latrocl. ap. Ath. 14.647b.
small sea-mussel, used by the Athenian dicasts in voting, Ar. Eq. 1332, V. 333, 349 (all anap.), Poll. 8.16; wrongly expld. by Suid., of hogʼs bristles.
of hogʼs skin, ἀσπίς Luc. Hist.Conscr. 23.
Dim. of χοῖρος, pigling, porker, Ar. Ach. 740.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dim. of χοῖρος I.2, Id. V. 1353.

definition: χοιρίσκος, ὁ, Dim. of χοῖρος, Luc. DMeretr. 7.3.

children.definition: swineherd, Sch.D Il. 21.282, Gloss.

= Hebr. shâphân, Hyrax syriacus, coney, LXX Le. 11.6, De. 14.7, Ps. 103(104).18, Pr. 24.61 ( 30.26); also χοιρό-γρυλλος, PMag.Leid.V. 12.28, Gloss.; wrongly expld. by Hsch. (who makes it neut.) and Suid. as ἀκανθόχοιρος, ὕστριξ, ἐχῖνος χερσαῖος.
very young pig, PCair.Zen. 274 (iii B. C.), Sammelb. 7469.5 (ii A. D.).
pen for keeping swine in, Ar. V. 844, Hsch., Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: bandage used by females, Ar. Lys. 1073.
porcinarium, Gloss.
slaying swine, Sch. Ar. Pax 373.

children.label: II
children.definition: καθαρμοί χοιρόκτονοι purification by the sacrifice of swine, A. Eu. 283; αἷμα χ. blood of a slain swine, Id. Fr. 327.
pork-butcher, PSI 3.202.3 (iv A. D.), PKlein.Form. 1052 (vi A. D.), etc.
ape with a hogʼs snout, perh. baboon, Arist. HA 503a19, IG 14.1302 ( Praeneste).
to be a prostitute, Suid. s.v. χοῖρος.
pig-dealer, Ar. Ach. 818, Fr. 578.

definition: χοῖρος, ὁ ( ἡ Hippon. 40, S. Fr. 230, Ar. Ach. 764):—

children.definition: young pig, porker (younger than δέλφαξ, Ar.Byz. ap. Ath 9.375. Cratin. 3a), Od. 14.73, Alc. Supp. 24.2, Hdt. 2.48, A. Fr. 309, Ar. Ach. 781, etc.; offered as one of the smaller sacrifices, Pl. R. 378a, X. An. 7.8.5, D. 54.39, Henioch. 2.

children.label: b
children.definition: swine, ἤδη δέλφακες, χοῖροι δὲ τοῖσιν ἄλλοις Cratin. l.c., cf. Mnesim. 4.47 (anap.), Plu. Cic. 7, Ev.Matt. 8.30.

data.quote: ἤδη δέλφακες, χοῖροι δὲ τοῖσιν ἄλλοις

children.definition: pudenda muliebria, freq. in Com. poets, who are always punning on the word and its compds., Ar. Ach. 773 sq., etc.; said to be a Corinthian usage, Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: Str. 17.2.4, Ath. 7.312a, Gp. 20.7.1, 13 tit. (Perh. for ĝhoryo- ‘grey’, cf. Norse griss ‘sucking-pig’, OHG. grīs ‘grey’, or cf. Alb. der̄ ‘pig’.)
Hsch.
Paul.Aeg. 7.17.
place where swine are slaughtered, Gloss.
slaughter of swine, Lyd. Mens. 4.158.
sacrificing swine, Hsch.
pig-sty, Eup. 453, Phryn.Com. 43.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
Il. 11.678, Suid.
carry a young pig, of the priests in the lustral processions at Athens, prob.l. in Ister 32.
young pig, Hsch.
Polem.Hist. 72.
swinish, Leonid. ap. Aët. 16.44, Hdn. Epim. 153.
swinishness, Sch. Ar. Eq. 980.

definition: χοιρώνια, τά, misspelling of χειρώνεια (sc. ἕλκη), Cyran. 34, cf. 9.
χοΐσκος, ὁ, Dim. of χοῦς, Inscr.Délos 1426 A i 15 (ii B. C.).

children.definition: carrying off bile, πόροι Gal. UP 5.3; φάρμακα Id. 17(2).658.
v.l. in Aesop. 184 (ii p.263 Chambry).
biliary, ἧπαρ Suid.
a member of the Attic deme Cholargos, Ar. Ach. 855, etc.

definition: χολάς, άδος, ἡ, commonly in pl. χολάδες,

children.definition: bowels, guts, Il. 4.526, h.Merc. 123, Antim. 45; made into strings for lyre, etc., AP 11.352.12 ( Agath.): in Com., also χολλάδες, Pherecr. 246, Men. 23.

children.label: II
children.definition: gut-cavity, common to the ὑποχόνδριον and λαγών, Arist. HA 493a21. (Cf. χόλ-ιξ, Slav. želadǔkǔ ‘stomachʼ; not cogn. with χολή as implied by Aret. SD 2.9.)
to be full of black bile, to be melancholy mad, ἀνδράσιν πείθει χολῶσιν Ar. Nu. 833, cf. Epicr. 5.7, Strato 1.7, Men. Epit. 176.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be angry, rage, Antiph. 334, D.L. 9.66, v.l. in Mosch. 1.10, LXX 3 Ma. 3.1; Ep. part. χολόων Nic. Th. 140.
groove, Eratosth. ap. Eutoc. in Archim. p.94 H. (pl.).
gutter, drain-pipe, Ph. Bel. 98.9, Apollod. Poliorc. 182.7, Horap. 1.21; written χολέρα, Hsch.

definition: χολεμεσία, χολ-εμετέω, worse forms for χολημ-, Gal. 8.179, 13.185.

children.definition: cholera, a disease in which the humours of the body ( χολή, χολαί) are violently discharged by vomiting and stool, Hp. Coac. 117, Acut. ( Sp.) 49, al., Aret. SA 2.5; but,
ξηρὴ χολέρη obstinate obstruction, Hp. Acut. (Sp.) 48. (Fr. χολή acc. to Cels. 4.18(11), but fr. χολάς, Alex.Trall. 8.1.)
nausea, ἔσται ὑμῖν εἰς χολέραν LXX Nu. 11.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
suffer from cholera, Dsc. 1.115, Plu. Sollert. 2.974b, Gal. 14.273.
of or like cholera, [ πάθεα] Hp. Epid. 7.82, cf. S.E. P. 1.131.
suffering from cholera, Dsc. 4.4, Gal. 6.564, Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.831b.
χολερικῇ ληφθῆναι to be attacked by cholera, D.L. 6.76.
liable to produce cholera, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.84.
of the nature of cholera, τρόπος Hp. Coac. 524.
liable to cause cholera, of pork, Id. Acut. (Sp.) 18 [was: 50], cf. Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.79.

gall, bile, Archil. 131, A. Ch. 184, E. Fr. 682, Th. 2.49, etc.; χ. μέλαινα black, i. e. diseased, bile, Hp. Aph. 4.23, Pl. Ti. 83c (but, = μελαγχολία, Men. Epit. 459); ξανθὴ χ. Hp. VM 19; πυρρά Gal. 15.658; χολὴν ἐμεῖν, βῆξαι, Nicopho 12, Herod. 3.70 (prob. l.): prov., πικρῷ πικρὰν κλύζουσι φαρμάκῳ χολήν S. Fr. 854; πικρότερʼ αὐτῆς τῆς χ. Alex. 16.12; χολῇ ἀλείφειν, prov. of giving one a disgust for a thing, from the custom of mothers putting gall to the nipple when the child was to be weaned, Diph. 74.
χολαί, gall-bladder, S. Ant. 1010; called δοχαὶ χολῆς, E. El. 828; also in sg., A. Pr. 495; χολὴν τῶν ζῴων τὰ μὲν ἔχει τὰ δʼ οὐκ ἔχει Arist. HA 506a20, cf. PA 677b11.

data.quote: χολὴν τῶν ζῴων τὰ μὲν ἔχει τὰ δʼ οὐκ ἔχει

children.definition: bile, gall, i.e. bitter anger, wrath, Ar. Pax 66; ἢ γυναιξὶν οὐκ οἴει χολὴν ἐνεῖναι; Id. Lys. 465; οὐδεὶς χολὴν οὐδʼ ὀργὴν ἔχων φανήσεται D. 25.27; πάνυ ἐστʼ ἤδη χ. stirs my bile, makes me sick, Ar. Ra. 4; ἐπιζεῖ χ. the bile boils over, Id. Th. 468; χολὴν κινεῖν Id. V. 403, cf. Pherecr. 69.

data.quote: ἢ γυναιξὶν οὐκ οἴει χολὴν ἐνεῖναι;
οὐδεὶς χολὴν οὐδʼ ὀργὴν ἔχων φανήσεται

children.label: II
children.definition: ink of the cuttle-fish, Nic. Al. 473, Th. 561.

children.label: III
children.definition: LXX = Hebr. rôsh, a poisonous plant, variously called hemlock or poppy, LXX Ps.68(69).22, Je. 8.14.

children.label: IV
children.definition: venom, χ. ἀσπίδος ib. Jb. 20.14; of the hydraʼs venom, Apollod. 2.5.2, D.S. 4.11.

children.label: V
children.definition: bitter drink, Ev.Matt. 27.34. (With χολή, χόλος, cf. Lat. fel, ONorse gall, etc., ‘bile, gallʼ:—prob. the name is derived from the colour of bile, and is cogn. with Lat. (h)olus, helvus, Germ. gelb ‘yellow’, perh. also χλόη.)
bile-coloured, of persons, Aret. SD 1.13 (vulg. χλοήβαφος).
carrying off bile, φάρμακον Hp. Loc.Hom. 27, 28 ( χοληγαγικός and -ηγαγός codd.).
containing bile, κύστις χ. gall-bladder, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.40; ἡ χ. (without κύστις) Gal. UP 4.12; τὸ χ. ἀγγεῖον ib. 5.2.
vomiting of bile, Poll. 2.214, Plu. QConv. 2.692f; cf. χολεμεσία.
vomit bile, Orib. 5.31.4; cf. χολεμετέω.

definition: χολίκιον, το, Dim. of χόλιξ, Thphr. Char. 9.4, Poll. 6.52.

children.definition: bilious, Plu. Virt. et vit. 2.101c, Gloss.

definition: χόλιξ, ῐκος, ἡ, later ὁ ( Phryn. 283, Id. PS p.125 B.):—mostly in pl. χόλικες,

children.definition: guts or bowels of oxen, χόλικες βοός Pherecr. 108.15, Eub. 63.4 (anap.); without βοός, Ar. Ra. 576, Fr. 82 (anap.); χόλικες ἑφθαί Id. Pax 717:sg., Id. Eq. 1179, Milet. 6.21 (V B.C.); Com. κρόκης χόλιξ wool- sausages, cf. κρόκη 1.3. (Cf. χολάς.)

definition: χόλιον, τό, Dim. of χολή, M.Ant. 6.57.

children.definition: angry, c. dat., AP 9.165 ( Pall.).
a member of the deme Cholleidae in Attica, Ar. Ach. 406, Lys. 13.58, IG 2(2).2382.14 (iv B. C.), etc.: also written χολ-ηΐδης ib. 1742.39, χολ-ήδης ib. 159 (iv B. C.).

definition: χολοβαφής, ές, = sq., Marcellin. in Sch.Hermog. Rh. 4.148W.

children.definition: dyed bile-colour, yellow-coloured, Arist. SE 164b24, Poll. 2.214.
irascibilis, Gloss.
Nic. Th. 435; αἷμα Aret. SD 1.15.
of bile or gall, full thereof, Nic. Th. 253; ἀκόνιτον, ποτόν, Id. Al. 12, 17, cf. Opp. C. 1.381.

definition: χολοίβαφος, ον, poet. for χολοβαφής, Nic. Th. 444.

children.definition: eating like bile, ἰός Nic. Th. 593.
producing bile, θέρος Hp. Hum. 14, cf. S.E. M. 9.96, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: χ., τό, = ἀβρότονον, Ps.- Dsc. 3.24.

definition: χόλος, ὁ, rarely in physical sense (= later χολή),

children.definition: gall, bile, χόλῳ ἄρα σʼ ἔτρεφε μήτηρ Il. 16.203.

children.label: II
children.definition: gall, bitter anger, wrath, οὐκ Ἀχιλῆϊ χ. φρεσίν Il. 2.241; φρενῶν χ. E. Med. 1266 (lyr.); χ. καὶ μῆνις Il. 15.122; χ. λάβε τινά 1.387, etc.; χ. ἔδυ τινά 9.553; χ. δάμασσέ τινα 18.119; χ. ᾕρει τινά 4.23; χ. ἔμπεσε θυμῷ 9.436, etc.; χ. ἔχει θυμόν ib. 675; ὅτε χ. ἵκοι τινά ib. 525; οἰδάνεται κραδίη χόλῳ ib. 646; χόλον πέσσειν, καταπέσσειν (v. sub vocc.); σβέσσαι χ. ib. 678; παῦσαι 1.192, etc.; ἐᾶν 9.260; μεθέμεν 1.283; ἐξακέσασθαι 4.36, Od. 3.145; ἐκ χόλου μεταστρέψαι ἦτορ Il. 10.107; χόλοιο μεταλήγειν (v. sub voc.); λήγειν Hes. Th. 221; χόλου παύθη ib. 533; ἐκ δὲ χόλω τῶδε λαθοίμεθα Alc. Supp. 23.9; λωφῆσαι A. Pr. 378; πόσει πάρες χόλον E. IA 1609; opp. ἐν θυμῷ βάλλεσθαί τινι χόλον Il. 14.50; χ. ἔνθεο θυμῷ 6.326; χ. ἐνέχειν τινί Hdt. 1.118, 6.119, 8.27; ἔχειν τινί E. Hec. 1118; ὄρσαι Pi. P. 11.23; κινεῖν E. Med. 99 (anap.); Τυφὼς ἐξαναζέσει χ. A. Pr. 372; χόλου ἄρξασθαι ib. 201: c. gen. subj., a personʼs rage, χ. Ἥρης, Ἀθηναίης, Il. 18.119 (v. supr.), Od. 3.145 (v. supr.): also c. gen. obj., anger towards or because of a person, Il. 6.335, 15.138; or anger for, because of a thing, τίνος χόλον κατʼ αὐτῶν ἐγκαλῶν ἐλήλυθας; S. Ph. 328; ὧν ἔχων χ. Id. Tr. 269: also ὄφρα ἑ . . χόλου . . ἀθανάτοις παύσειεν h.Cer. 350, cf. 410, E. HF 840.

data.quote: τίνος χόλον κατʼ αὐτῶν ἐγκαλῶν ἐλήλυθας;

children.definition: bitterness, ἔριδος χ. Sol. 4.39.
cause of anger, AP 11.381 ( Pall.) —In Prose used only by Hdt. and late writers, as Luc. Am. 2. (On the Root, v. χολή.)

definition: χολόω, inf. fut. χολωσέμεν Il. 1.78: aor.1 ἐχόλωσα 18.111, Od. 8.205, 18.20, S. Tr. 1035 (hex.):—

children.definition: anger, provoke, c. acc. pers., Hom. ll. cc.; ἐχόλωσε δέ μιν φίλον ἦ τορ Hes. Th. 568; χ. τινά τινι to anger one by a thing, S. l.c.

data.quote: ἐχόλωσε δέ μιν φίλον ἦ τορ

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. and Pass. χολόομαι ( contr. χολοῦμαι even in Hom. Il. 8.407); 3 sg. opt. χολῷτο Thgn. 325 (s.v. l.): fut. χολώσομαι E. Tr. 735; but in Hom. mostly κεχολώσομαι Il. 5.421, al.: aor. Med. and Pass. ἐχολωσάμην ( χολώσεαι in Il. 14.310 may be either fut. ind. or aor. subj.), ἐχολώθην; Ep. χολώθην Hom. (v. infr.), etc.: pf. κεχόλωμαι, mostly in part. κεχολωμένος, v. infr.: plpf. 2 and 3 sg. κεχόλωσο, -ωτο, Il. 16.585, 21.146; Ep. 3 pl. κεχολώατο Od. 14.282, 16.425:— to be angered or provoked to anger, κεχολῶσθαι ἐνὶ φρεσίν Il. 16.61; θυμῷ κεχολωμένος 1.217, etc.; θυμὸν . . χολώθη 4.494; περὶ κῆρι . . ἐχολώθη 13.206; κεχόλωσο κῆρ 16.585; χολώσατο κηρόθι μᾶλλον 21.136, Od. 9.480: c. dat. pers., Ἥρῃ δʼ οὔτι τόσον νεμεσίζομαι οὐδὲ χολοῦμαι Il. 8.407, cf. 421; βασιλῆϊ χολωθείς I.9, etc.: but also c. gen., to be angry for or because of a person or thing, 11.703, 13.660, Od. 1.69, al.; ὅπλων χολωθείς Pi. N. 7.25: with a Prep., κεχολωμένη εἵνεκα νίκης Od. 11.544; ἀμφʼ ἀστραγάλοισι, ἀμφὶ βουσίν, Il. 23.88, Pi. N. 10.60; ἐξ ἀρέων Il. 9.566; ἐπὶ παιδί Batr. 109: rare in Trag., χολώσεται E. Tr. 735; χολωθείς S. Ph. 374; αὑτῷ χ. Id. Ant. 1235; οὗ δὴ χ. E. Alc. 5 (also in later Prose, D.S. 3.67); κεχολωμένος Hdt. 8.31, Plu. Fab. 22, al., SIG 1241 ( Lyttus, iii A. D.).

data.quote: Ἥρῃ δʼ οὔτι τόσον νεμεσίζομαι οὐδὲ χολοῦμαι

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be turned into bile, τὸ οὖρον . . οὐ χολοῦται Steph. in Hp. 1.163D.

like bile or gall, bilious, ἐκκρίσιες, ἔμες μα, Hp. Aph. 2.15, Epid. 6.4.4.; χυμοί Pl. Ti. 86e; ὑγρότης Arist. HA 506b3; χλωραὶ γλῶσσαι χολώδεες caused by biliousness, Hp. Epid. 6.5.8; χολώδεις bilious persons, Arist. Metaph. 981a12, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.12, Gal. 15.568.
bile-coloured, χρώματα Pl. Ti. 71b, 83b; οἷς ἂν ἐπὶ τὸ χολωδέστερον ἡ χρόα μεταβάλῃ Gal. 17(2).270.

data.quote: οἷς ἂν ἐπὶ τὸ χολωδέστερον ἡ χρόα μεταβάλῃ

children.label: II
children.definition: bilious, angry, χ. τι ὑποβλέπειν Luc. Vit. Auct. 7, cf. Philostr. Im. 2.12.
Nonn. D. 5.447, part. χολωόμενος ib. 437, APl. 16.128.
angry, wrathful, χολωτοῖσιν ἐπέεσσιν Il. 4.241, Od. 22.26, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: bilious, Luc. Lex. 20 (sed leg. χολώντων).
with cartilaginous skeleton, epith. of the σελάχη, Arist. HA 516b15, PA 655a23.
make groats, Hsch.:— corrupt in Anaxipp. 1.26.
swell with clots of milk, Dsc. 2.107.

gum succory, Chondrilla juncea, Dsc. 2.133, Gal. 6.622, al., Hsch. ( χονδρίλλη v.l. in Dsc. l.c.; χόνδρυλλα cj. in Thphr. HP 7.7.1, 7.11.4, cf. Plin. HN 21.105); ἕτερον εἶδος χονδρίλης, Chondrilla ramosissima, Dsc. l.c.
Archestr. Fr. 4.13.

definition: χονδρίον, τό, Dim. of χόνδρος, Hp. Art. 45 (pl.); expld. by πίναξ, κέραμος, Hsch.

children.definition: made of groats or coarse meal, ἄρτος Trypho ap. Ath. 3.109c, Philistio ap. Ath. 3.115d, LXX Ge. 40.16.

definition: χονδριωτός, ή, όν, epith. of κάναστρον, dub. in Supp.Epigr. 1.414.6 (cf. p.139) ( Gort., v/iv B. C.).

children.definition: tessellated work, χονδροβολίας ἔδαφος Gloss.
mill for making groats or coarse meal, Poll. 3.78, 7.19; χονδροκόπια (sic): μυλὼν ὅπου ὁ χόνδρος κόπτεται, Hsch.
neuro-cartilaginous, of a substance between cartilage and sinew, δεσμός Hp. Mochl. 1.
of making cartilage, δύναμις Gal. Nat.Fac. 1.6.
gruel of groats as a drink for sick persons, Paul.Aeg. 1.72.

granule or lump of salt, ἁλὸς χόνδρους Hp. Ulc. 17, cf. Sophr. in PSI 11.1214 a.3: pl., PLit.Lond. 167.18 (ii/iii A. D.); ἁλὸς τρύφεα κατὰ χόνδρους μεγάλους Hdt. 4.181; οἰκία ἐκ τῶν ἁλίνων χ. οἰκοδομέαται ib. 185:— χόνδρος abs., salt, χ. ἐποψίδιος AP 7.736 ( Leon.); also of the gum of frankincense, Thphr. HP 9.4.10; λιβανωτοῦ χ. Luc. Sat. 16, cf. Asin. 12; χ. λιβάνου Dsc. 1.68.7.

groats of wheat or spelt (esp. the latter, Dsc. 2.96, Gp. 3.7); σασαμίδας χόνδρον τε καὶ ἐγκρίδας Stesich. 2; χόνδρον ἕψων Ar. Fr. 203, cf. 412 (anap.); χ. γάλακι κατανενιμμένος Pherecr. 108.18; ἐκ δʼ Ἰταλίας χ. καὶ πλευρὰ βόεια Hermipp. 63.6 (hex.); χ. Μεγαρικός, Θετταλικός, Antiph. 34.2, 3, Alex. 191; ὁ χ. πλεῖον ὕδωρ δέχεται ἢ οἱ πυροὶ ἐξ ὧν ὁ τοιοῦτος ἐγένετο χ. Arist. Pr. 929b1, cf. Thphr. CP 4.16.2, Plb. 12.2.5; χόνδρου πτισάνη Gal. 6.496: hence, gruel, porridge, Thphr. HP 4.4.9, Orac. ap. Hierocl. in CA 1p.421M.: prov., of an old man, χόνδρον λείχειν Ar. V. 737 (anap.).

data.quote: ἐκ δʼ Ἰταλίας χ. καὶ πλευρὰ βόεια
ὁ χ. πλεῖον ὕδωρ δέχεται ἢ οἱ πυροὶ ἐξ ὧν ὁ τοιοῦτος ἐγένετο χ.

children.label: II
children.definition: gristle, cartilage, Hp. Aph. 6.19, Arist. HA 516b31, PA 655a37: esp. the cartilage of the breast, which unites the false ribs at the termination of the breast-bone, Hp. Epid. 7.3, cf. Prorrh. 2.7, Nic. Al. 123; and v. ξιφοειδής; also, the cartilage of the ear, Arist. HA 492a16; of the nose, Poll. 2.79; of the windpipe ( i.e. uvula), ib. 99; ὠλενίτης χ. the shoulder- blade, Lyc. 155; also of the young horns of deer, Ael. NA 6.5.

granular, coarse, ἄλευρα χονδρότερα Hp. Mul. 2.193; ἄλφιτον ἀραιὸν καὶ χονδρόν Arist. Pr. 927b35: mostly of coarse salt, ἅλες οὐ χονδροί, ἀλλὰ χαῦνοι καὶ λεπτοὶ ὥσπερ χιών Id. Mete. 359a32; χἄλα λήψεται χονδρόν Phoen. 2.5; χονδροὺς ἅλας (cod.Rav. χονδρὰς ἅλας) is prob. in Ar. Ach. 521 (v.l. χόνδρους ἁλός) χονδρός Adj., χόνδρος Subst. are distd. by Hdn.Gr. 1.203, 2.716; Comp. and Sup. -ότερος, -ότατος, Choerob. in Theod. 2.76H.

data.quote: ἅλες οὐ χονδροί, ἀλλὰ χαῦνοι καὶ λεπτοὶ ὥσπερ χιών

children.label: II
children.definition: coarse, τρίχες Ps.-Callisth. 2.33; οὐηλάρια μικρὰ χοντρὰ (sic) δύο Sammelb. 7033.39 (v A. D.); χονδρός, = grossus, Gloss. ( χόνδρος and χονδρός dissim. fr. *χρονδ-ρο-, cogn. with Engl. grind.)
cartilaginous connexion, Gal. 1.569.
formed of cartilage, Arist. HA 617b2.
cartilaginous, Matro Conv. 27.
like groats, granular, f.l. in Hp. Nat.Mul. 105 (leg. χονδροτέρα).

children.label: II
children.definition: like gristle, cartilaginous, Id. Mochl. 1, Arist. HA 493a7, 524b27 ( Comp.), PA 654b25, Aret. SD 1.9, al.; opp. νευρώδης, ὀστώδης, Arist. HA 500b20; χονδρώδη, τά, the swimmerets of crayfish, ib. 549a25.

definition: χόνδρωσις, εως, ἡ, an affection of the breasts, Sor. 1.76.

children.definition: a copper cup, Hermonax ap. Ath. 11.502b, Eust. 1153.42 ( χόνος Hsch.): pl., perh. name of a festival (cf. χόες, χύτροι,), Supp.Epigr. 1.414.11 ( Gort., v/iv B. C.).
one who forms of earth, PMag.Par. 1.3047.
treatment by fusion, Anon.Alch. in Gött.Nachr.1919.25; written χοωποίησις, Zos.Alch. p.210B.
one who drinks whole χόες, of Dionysus, Possis 1.
earthy nature (cf. χοϊκός 1), Anon.Alch. in Gött. Nachr.1919.16.
carry earth, CPHerm. 127 Fr. 12 B 8 (iii A. D.).
carriage of earth, CPHerm. 127 Fr. 3 B 3; cf. χωφορέω, -ία.

definition: χοραγεῖον, χορᾱγ-ιον, χορᾱγ-ός, Dor. for χορηγ-.
χοραγέτας, α, ὁ, Dor. for χορηγέτης.

children.definition: accompany the chorus on the flute, Str. 17.1.11.

senses.definition: one who accompanies a chorus on the flute, AP 11.11 ( Lucill.), Plu. Ant. 24: freq. in Inscrr., as IG 7.1773 ( Thespiae), CIG 1719 (Delph.), etc.

definition: χορδάριον [ᾰ], τό, Dim. of χορδή, Alex. 132 (lyr.).
χορδαψός, ὁ (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.227),

children.definition: a disease in the great guts, the same as εἰλεός in the small ones, Hp. Coac. 502; but the meanings are reversed by Diocl. ( Fr. 73) ap. Cels. 4.20.1; an aggravated form of εἰλεός acc. to Aret. SA 2.6, but not distd. fr. it by Gal. 8.388 (fr. χορδή, ἕψω, acc. to Aret. l.c.).
sausage, black-pudding, Ar. Eq. 315.
make into sausages: metaph., χ. τὰ πράγματα make mince-meat of state-affairs, Ar. Eq. 214.
guts, tripe, Batr. 222, Pherecr. 130.9 (anap.), Ar. Fr. 687 (anap.), 461 (sg).

children.label: II
children.definition: that which is made from guts:

string of gut, τὰ ὑποχόνδρια τελαμῶσι καὶ χορδαῖς διασφίγγει Sor. 2.29; in a loom, Arist. GA 787b23: esp. string of a lyre or harp (not in A. or S., once in E., v. infr.), Od. 21.407, h.Merc. 51, etc.; ἐν Αἰολίδεσσι χ. Pi. P. 2.69, cf. E. Hipp. 1135 (lyr.); χορδὰς ἐπιτείνειν, opp. ἀνιέναι, Pl. Ly. 209b; ἐν τῇ ἐπιτάσει καὶ ἀνέσει τῶν χ. Id. R. 349e; ὀξυτάτην καὶ βαρυτάτην χορδὴν ποιεῖν Id. Phdr. 268e; τὰς χ. ἀλλήλαις συνιστάντα Id. R. 412a: metaph., κινοῦσα χ. τὰς ἀκινήτους φρενῶν Trag.Adesp. 361.

data.quote: τὰ ὑποχόνδρια τελαμῶσι καὶ χορδαῖς διασφίγγει
ἐν τῇ ἐπιτάσει καὶ ἀνέσει τῶν χ.

children.label: b
children.definition: note, Pl. Phlb. 56a.

sausage or black-pudding, χορδῆς τόμος Cratin. 192, cf. Ar. Ach. 1119, Nu. 455 (anap.): he puns on the two senses in Ra. 339. (Cf. Skt. hirá̄ ‘vein’, hiras ‘strip, band, fillet’, Albanian zor̄e ‘entrails’, Lat. haru-spex, ONorse gǫrn ‘entrails’, garn ‘yarn’.)

definition: χορδίον, τό, = foreg. [χορδή] I, SIG 1002.10 ( Milet., v/iv B. C.).

children.definition: touch the strings before playing, Plu. Util. 2.87f.
maker of strings for musical instruments, Poll. 7.154, who also has χορδο-ποιία, ἡ, the art or trade of such a person, Adj. χορδο-ποιικός, ή, όν, fit for such work, and Adv. -κῶς ibid.
dealer in musical strings, Critias 67D.
twisting of strings for a musical instrument, Ael. NA 17.6 (pl.).
twister of strings, D.Chr. 8.4, Ptol. Tetr. 180 (misprinted χονδρο-, cf. Procl. Par.Ptol. 250).
tail-piece for keeping the strings taut, Arist. Aud. 803a41, Poll. 4.62, Nicom. Harm. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. proparox. χορδότονος, ον, Pass., stretched with strings, λύρα S. Fr. 244 (lyr.).

dance, esp. choral dance with music, E. Ph. 1265 (pl., nowhere else in Trag., exc. Chaerem. 14.3), Ar. Ra. 336 (lyr.); ῥυθμὸν χορείας ὕπαγε Id. Th. 956 (lyr.); εὔκυκλος χ. ib. 968 (troch.); χ . . . ὄρχησίς τε καὶ ᾠδὴ τὸ σύνολόν ἐστιν Pl. Lg. 654b; ὅλη . . χ. ὅλη παίδευσις ἦν ἡμῖν ib. 672e; μιμήματα τρόπων ἐστὶ τὰ περὶ τὰς χ. ib. 655d; θυσίαι τε καὶ χ. ib. 772b; ἐπάρχεσθαι . . τοὺς χοροὺς χορείας τῷ Διονύσῳ dub. in IG 12(9).192.11 ( Eretria).

data.quote: χ . . . ὄρχησίς τε καὶ ᾠδὴ τὸ σύνολόν ἐστιν

children.definition: circling motion, as of the stars, χ. καλλίστην χορεύοντα Pl. Epin. 982e, cf. Arist. Fr. 11 (pl.), Luc. Salt. 17; πλανήτων τε καὶ ἀπλανῶν χορείαις Ph. 1.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: dance-tune, ἄκουε τὰν ἐμὰν Δώριον χ. Pratin.Lyr. 1.17, cf. Ar. Ra. 247 (lyr.).
dancing-place, Zonar.; = βωμός τις, Hsch.: of a place of torture, LXX 4 Ma. 15.20.
Hsch.; = διδασκαλεῖον, Id. (sed. leg. χορ<ηγ>εῖον).
of or belonging to a chorus or dance, ἀοιδή A.R. 2.714, cf. Ael. NA 2.11; epith. of Dionysus, Plu. QConv. 2.680b; of Antinous, IG 2(2).1105 Ab 10, Ac 3; χορεῖοι (sc. ἀγῶνες) CIG 5328 ( Teuchira).

children.label: II
children.definition: χορεῖος, ὁ, = τροχαῖος, Cic. de Or. 3.50.193, Plu. Mus. 2.1141b.
D.H. Comp. 17, 18, Aristid.Quint. 1.22.

children.label: III
children.definition: χορεῖα, τά, thank-offerings for victory of a chorus, IG 11(2).161 B 13 ( Delos, iii B. C.), BCH 35.260 (ibid.), Inscr.Délos 442 A 189 (ii B. C.).
fee for right of attendance at rites of ὑμνῳδοί, IGRom. 4.353 D21 ( Pergam., ii A. D.).
choral dance, Pratin.Lyr. 1.1 (pl.), E. Ph. 655 (lyr.), Ion 1474 (lyr., pl.), El. 875 (lyr.); τὰ τῆς κακίας χ. dances representing . . , Pl. Lg. 655c.
dancing, Pi. Pae. 6.9, Suid. s.v. χορεῖον.
one must dance, E. Ba. 324.

choral dancer, Pi. P. 12.27, Ar. Ach. 443, Pl. R. 373b, etc.; τῶν χ. ἐξάγειν τινά And. 4.20; τὰ ἐπινίκια ἔθυεν αὐτός τε καὶ οἱ χ. Pl. Smp. 173a: metaph., [θεοῦ] χ. the devoted follower of a god, Id. Phdr. 252d; of a philosopher, οἱ Πυθαγόρου καὶ Πλάτωνος καὶ Ἀριστοτέλους χ. Jul. Or. 6.197d: generally, pupil, Lib. Or. 54.38.

data.quote: τὰ ἐπινίκια ἔθυεν αὐτός τε καὶ οἱ χ.
οἱ Πυθαγόρου καὶ Πλάτωνος καὶ Ἀριστοτέλους χ.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pi. Fr. 99; of Dionysus, Orph. Εὐχή 9.
Anacreont. 55.24; of cicadae, Ael. NA 1.20.
of or for the dance, Ael. NA 2.11, Luc. Salt. 10.

definition: χορεύω, fut. -σω E. Ba. 195, etc.: aor. ἐχόρευσα Id. Cyc. 156, etc.: pf. κεχόρευκα Pl. Lg. 654b:— Med., in same sense, E. Ion 1084 (lyr.): fut. -εύσομαι A. Ag. 31: aor. ἐχορευσάμην Ar. Th. 103 (lyr.), ( ἐξ-) E. Hel. 381 (lyr.):— Pass., aor. ἐχορεύθην, pf. κεχόρευμαι, v. infr. II:—

children.definition: dance a round or choral dance, Pi. Fr. 116, Epich. 109, S. Aj. 701 (lyr.), etc.; esp. of the Dionysiac chorus or dance, E. Cyc. 156, Ba. 21, 184, 207, etc.: hence, take part in the chorus, regarded as a matter of religion, εἰ γὰρ αἱ τοιαίδε πράξεις τίμιαι, τί δεῖ με χορεύειν; S. OT 896 (lyr.); to be one of a chorus, Ar. Ra. 390 (lyr.), interpol. in D. 18.265; considered as a high honour by Athenian citizens, Id. 39.16,23; τὸ παλαιὸν οἱ ἐλεύθεροι ἐχόρευον Arist. Pr. 918b21; not allowed to foreigners, Plu. Phoc. 30: c. dat. pers., dance to him, in his honour, Βακχίῳ E. Ba. 195, cf. X. Eq.Mag. 3.2; περί τινα Pl. Euthd. 277e; ἀμφὶ σὰν κιθάραν E. Alc. 582 (lyr.); ἐπὶ Κυρβάντεσι perh. in their train, S. Fr. 862 (lyr.).

data.quote: εἰ γὰρ αἱ τοιαίδε πράξεις τίμιαι, τί δεῖ με χορεύειν;

children.definition: dance, esp. from joy, χ. ὑφʼ ἡδονῆς Ar. Pl. 288, cf. 761; αὐτὼ τὼ σκέλει χορεύετον Id. Pax 325 (troch.); ἁνὴρ χορεύει, καὶ τὰ τοῦ θεοῦ καλά Phryn.Com. 9: χ. καὶ ἐν εὐπαθείῃσι εἶναι Hdt. 1.191.

data.quote: ἁνὴρ χορεύει, καὶ τὰ τοῦ θεοῦ καλά

children.definition: Practise dancing in the chorus, hence practise a thing, be versed in it, ἔν τινι Pl. Tht. 173c, cf. Lg. 654b.
circling motion, as of the heavenly bodies, ἀνεχόρευσεν αἰθήρ, χορεύει δὲ Σελάνα E. Ion 1080 (lyr.), cf. Ba. 114 (lyr.); so of a cup, δέπας μεστόν, κύκλῳ χορεῦον Antiph. 237.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: χορείας χ. Pl. Lg. 942d, Epin. 982e; φροίμιον χορεύσομαι I will dance a prelude, A. Ag. 31; χ. γάμους to celebrate them, E. IA 1057 (lyr.); ὄργια Μουσῶν Ar. Ra. 356 (anap.); ἀγῶνας Plb. 4.20.9:— Pass., κεχόρευται ἡμῖν (sings the Chorus) our part is played, Ar. Nu. 1510 (anap.); τὰ χορευθέντα things represented in mimic dance, Pl. Lg. 655d.

celebrate in choral dance, Φοῖβον Pi. I. 1.7, cf. S. Ant. 1153 (lyr.), E. HF 871 (troch.); so Med., Id. Ion 1084 (lyr.):— Pass., to be celebrated in choral dance, πρὸς ἡμῶν S. OT 1093 (lyr.), cf. E. Ion 463 (lyr.).
Pass., also, to be filled with dances in honour of, c. dat., ἄστεα διφρηλάτᾳ πάντα διʼ ἀνακτόρων Ἴσιδι χορεύεται Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 36.19.

data.quote: ἄστεα διφρηλάτᾳ πάντα διʼ ἀνακτόρων Ἴσιδι χορεύεται

children.label: III
children.definition: set one dancing, rouse to the dance, τινα E. HF 686 (lyr.); πόδα χορεύσας, of spreading ivy, AP 11.33 ( Phil.); ὁ δʼ αὐλὸς ὕστερον χορευέτω Pratin.Lyr. 1.7:—metaph. in Pass., μανίαισιν Λύσσας χορευθέντʼ ἀναύλοις E. HF 879 (lyr.).
the school in which a chorus was trained for public performance, Phryn. PS p.126 B.
school, Epich. 13, 104.

children.label: II
children.definition: treasury, revenue, τὸ Διονυσίου χ. Aristox. Fr.Hist. 15.
Iamb. VP 30.186: Dor. χορᾱγέτας IG 42(1).133.7 (Epid., hymn).

definition: χορηγέω, Boeot. and Dor. χορ-ᾱγέω, IG 7.3210 (Orchom.), 12(1).383 ( Rhodes), etc.:—

children.definition: lead a chorus, χορῷ Simon. 147, Pl. Grg. 482b (cf. signf. II): c. gen., χ. ἡμῶν Id. Lg. 654a: hence metaph., take the lead in a matter, c. gen., τούτου τοῦ λόγου Id. Tht. 179d.

children.label: II
children.definition: χορηγός, defray the cost of bringing out a chorus at the public festivals, abs., χορηγεῖν, τριηραρχεῖν, εἰσφέρειν D. 18.257; ἐχόρευες, ἐγὼ δʼ ἐχορήγουν interpol. ib. 265; χ. λαμπρῶς Antipho 2.2.12, etc.; κάλλιον Isoc. 19.36: freq. in Inscrr., Θεμιστοκλῆς ἐχορήγει· Φρύνιχος ἐδίδασκεν· Ἀδείμαντος ἦρχεν ap. Plu. Them. 5, cf. IG 1(2).770, etc.; also ὁ δῆμος ἐχορήγει IG 2(2).3079, al.: c. acc. cogn., χορηγίας χ. Antipho 5.77, Lys. 12.20; [τῇ φυλῇ] Luc. Dem.Enc. 45; χ. Ἀθηναίων Plu. QConv. 2.724b: freq. with a word to denote the occasion, Λήναια χορηγῶν Ar. Ach. 1155 (lyr.); χ. παισὶν Διονύσια D. 21.64; εἰς Ἀπολλώνια IG ΙΙ(2).106.1 ( Delos, iii B. C.); ἀνδράσι χ. ἐς Διονύσια Lys. 21.2; χ. κωμῳδοῖς, πυρριχισταῖς, ib. 4; τραγῳδοῖς Is. 6.60; κωμῳδοῖς IG 2(2).3090 (less freq. with the Art. added, χ. τὰ Διονύσια τοῖς τραγῳδοῖς Arist. Fr. 630); also Παναθηναίοις χ. D. 21.156:— Pass., to have choragi found for one, χορηγοῦσιν μὲν οἱ πλούσιοι, χορηγεῖται δὲ ὁ δῆμος X. Ath. 1.13; ἄριστα χορηγοῦνται οἱ παῖδες are well found by their choragus, Antipho 6.13.

data.quote: χορηγοῦσιν μὲν οἱ πλούσιοι, χορηγεῖται δὲ ὁ δῆμος

children.definition: minister to, χ. ταῖς σεαυτοῦ ἡδοναῖς Aeschin. 3.240; ταῖς ἐπιθυμίαις Luc. Par. 12; πρὸς ἐπαινον Lib. Or. 18.7; πρὸς μῆκος λόγου ib. 13.26.

children.label: a
children.definition: furnish abundantly with a thing, esp. with supplies for war, χ. τὸ στρατόπεδον τοῖς ἐπιτηδείοις Plb. 3.68.8, cf. 49.11, 52.7, etc.; χρήμασι πρός τι Id. 5.42.7:— Pass., to be well supplied, τοῖς ἐκτὸς ἀγαθοῖς κεχορηγημένος Arist. EN 1101a15, cf. 1179a11: abs., κάλλιστα κεχορηγημένος best furnished, Id. Pol. 1288b14; κεχ. ἐπὶ τοσοῦτον ὥστε . . ib. 1323b41; ἀρετὴ κεχορηγημένη ib. 1289a33: generally, ἐμβαμματίοις κεχ., of fish, Anaxipp. 1.35; πολλαῖς ἀφορμαῖς κεχ. πρός τι Plb. 4.77.2; διαφόρῳ φύσει, συνέσει, D.S. 1.15, 2.6, D.H. Vett.Cens. 5.6; κεχ. ὑπὸ τὴς φύσεως ἀγχινοίᾳ D.S. 26.2

children.label: b
children.definition: supply, furnish, τοὺς Ἴβηρας οὓς χορηγεῖς μοι, i. e. the archers, Ar. Fr. 551; χρήματα ἡμῖν D. 11.6; τὰς τροφάς D.S. 2.35; σπόρον 2 Ep.Cor. 9.10; ἐξ ἰσχύος ἧς χ. ὁ θεός 1 Ep.Pet. 4.11; πάθη τὰ χορηγοῦντα βοήθειαν affording, i. e. admitting, a cure, Ptol. Tetr. 13: c. dat. pers. only, τῷ βασιλεῖ LXX 3 Ki. 4.7:— Med. in act. sense, χορηγούμενός σοιτὸν φόρον BGU 920.29 (ii A. D.):— Pass., τῶν ἐκ μιᾶς δαπάνης χορηγηθέντων (sc. δείπνων) Arist. Pol. 1281b3.

data.quote: ἐξ ἰσχύος ἧς χ. ὁ θεός

children.definition: expenditure on χοροί, Inscr.Délos 399 A 51 al. (pl., ii B. C.).
means of providing for, τινος Plu. Oth. 9.
expenditure, BGU 1208.18 (i B. C.); supply, ξύλων Stud.Pal. 22.177.19 (ii A. D.).

office or λῃτουργία of a χορηγός, defraying of the cost of the public choruses, Antipho 2.3.8 (pl.), 5.77 (pl.), Th. 6.16 (pl.), etc.: used generally of λῃτουργίαι other than the τριηραρχία, Lys. 19.57 (pl.), D. 20.19 (pl.), Lex ap. eund. 18.106.
expense, Democr. 282.

children.label: II
children.definition: abundance of external means, fortune, ἡ ἐκτὸς χ. Arist. EN 1178a24, cf. Pol. 1255a14, al.; πολιτικὴ χ. things necessary to furnish or constitute a state, ib. 1326a5: pl., βασιλικαὶ χ. Jul. Ep. 89b; πρόγονοι καὶ χ. καὶ δόξα great fortunes, Lib. Or. 33.20.
supplies for war, τῶν ἀναγκαίων, τῶν ἐπιτηδείων, Plb. 1.18.9, 4.71.10, etc.: pl., Id. 1.16.6, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: supplies for a banquet, Plu. QConv. 2.692b.

children.label: c
children.definition: extraneous, adventitious aids, Arist. Po. 1453b8.

children.label: d
children.definition: abundance, τῶν εὐτυχημάτων Id. Pol. 1333b17; ὕλης Luc. Anach. 35; ὕδατος Hdn. 8.2.6; τῶν πηγῶν Lib. Or. 61.18; πᾶσα χ. τῆς νόσου all that feeds the disease, Philostr. Im. 2.23.

children.label: e
children.definition: subvention, assistance, Ph. Bel. 50.39.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pl. Euthd. 277d.

of or for a χορηγός, χ. ἀγῶνες rivalry in bringing out choruses, X. Hier. 9.11; χ. τρίποδες tripods dedicated to a god by victorious choruses, Plu. Arist. 1, Nic. 3; χ. ἀργύριον IG ΙΙ(2).161 A 27, 39 ( Delos, iii B. C. ); τὸ χ. alone, Inscr.Délos 453 A 24 (ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: supplies for an army, Plb. 1.17.5, al.: generally, maintenance, PRyl. 181.7 (iii A.D).

children.label: III
children.definition: Dor. form χοράγιον) stage-building in a theatre, BGU 1028.21 (ii A. D.).
woman-choragus, title of a Comedy by Alexis.

definition: χορηγός, ὁ (also ἡ), Dor. χορᾱγός Alcm. 23.44, Ar. Lys. 1315 (lyr.): ( χορός, ἡγέομαι):—

children.definition: chorus-leader, like the later κορυφαῖος, θεοὺς συγχορευτάς τε καὶ χορηγοὺς ἡμῖν δεδωκέναι τόν τε Ἀπόλλωνα καὶ τὰς Μούσας Pl. Lg. 665a: generally, leader of a train or band, πῦρ πνεόντων χ. ἄστρων, of Dionysus, S. Ant. 1147 (lyr.); χ. δελφίνων E. Hel. 1454 (lyr.).

data.quote: κορυφαῖος, θεοὺς συγχορευτάς τε καὶ χορηγοὺς ἡμῖν δεδωκέναι τόν τε Ἀπόλλωνα καὶ τὰς Μούσας

children.label: II
children.definition: one who defrays the costs for producing a chorus, χορηγῶν ἀποδεικνυμένων ἑκατέρῃ τῶν δαιμόνων δέκα ἀνδρῶν Hdt. 5.83; χορηγὸν καταστῆσαί τινα IG 2(2).141.34; χ. κατεστάθην εἰς Θαργήλια Antipho 6.11; καταστὰς χ. τραγῳδοῖς Lys. 21.1, cf. 3; supplied by the φυλαί in turn, D. 20.130, cf. Aeschin. 1.11; χ. αἱρεθείς, ἱμάτια χρυσᾶ παρασχὼν τῷ χορῷ, ῥάκος φορεῖ Antiph. 204.5 (troch.); used of a woman, Milet. 1(7). No.265: generally, of liturgies other than the trierarchy, εἰσποιεῖ χορηγοὺς εἰς ἐκείνας τὰς λῃτουργίας D. 20.19.

data.quote: χορηγῶν ἀποδεικνυμένων ἑκατέρῃ τῶν δαιμόνων δέκα ἀνδρῶν
χ. αἱρεθείς, ἱμάτια χρυσᾶ παρασχὼν τῷ χορῷ, ῥάκος φορεῖ
εἰσποιεῖ χορηγοὺς εἰς ἐκείνας τὰς λῃτουργίας

children.definition: one who defrays the costs for any purpose, χ. ἔχοντες Φίλιππον Id. 9.60; Φιλίππῳ χ. χρώμενος Id. 19.216; χ. τὸν πατέρα ἔχειν εἴς τι Id. 40.51; λήψεται χ. τῇ ἑαυτοῦ βδελυρίᾳ Aeschin. 1.54, cf. 2.79; οἱονεὶ χ. καὶ μισθοδότης Plb. 2.44.3, cf. 8.7.2; τῆς φύσεως αὐτῶν ὁ θεὸς χ. Iamb.Bab. p.51 Hinck.

data.quote: χ. τὸν πατέρα ἔχειν εἴς τι
τῆς φύσεως αὐτῶν ὁ θεὸς χ.

children.definition: patron of a profession or trade, Paul.Al. P. 2.
supply-veins, Orib. 45.18.23.
choriambic, μέτρον Heph. 9.1, cf. Aristid. Quint. 1.26, etc.
choriambus, i.e. foot of four syllables (-⏑⏑-), consisting of a chorius (-⏑) and iambus (⏑-), Heph. 3.3, Aristid. Quint. 1.22.

of or for a choral dance, ἡ χ. μοῦσα Pl. Lg. 670a; αἱ ᾠδαὶ αἱ χ. the choral songs in Tragedy and Comedy, Arist. Pr. 918b14; χ. μέλη Id. Po. 1452b21; χορικά (sc. μέλη) Ar. Eq. 589 (lyr.); χορικόν, τό, choral part of a drama, Arist. Po. 1452b22; οἱ χ. (sc. αὐλοί) Poll. 4.81. Adv. -κῶς Ael. NA 2.11.
like the afterbirth, ὑμήν Arist. HA 561b32, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: χ. χιτών choroid coat of the eye, Ruf. Onom. 153, Gal. UP 10.2; χ. μῆνιγξ, of the brain, the pia mater, ib. 8.9, Herophil. ap. Ruf. Onom. 149; so of the ventricles of the brain, ibid.; χ. πλέγματα (called συστρέμματα by Herophil.) in the brain, Gal. 2.719.—Sts. wrongly written χοροειδής in codd., as in Arist. GA 753b22, etc. Adv. -δῶς Steph. in Hp. 2.373D.

membrane that encloses the foetus in the womb, afterbirth, Hp. Nat.Puer. 16, Arist. HA 562a6, Dsc. 3.150, Gal. UP 15.4, Ruf. Onom. 230, Porph. Marc. 32, etc.; certain animals are said to eat it, Arist. HA 611a18, Thphr. Fr. 175; cf. ἀμνίον I.2.
membrane round the inside of the egg, Arist. GA 754a1.

children.label: II
children.definition: any intestinal membrane: hence in pl. χόρια, τά, a dish made by stuffing it with honey and milk, haggis, Cratin. 326, Ar. Fr. 569.4, Alex. 172.17, Theoc. 9.19, ubi v. Sch.—It is uncertain to which of these senses is to be referred the prov. χαλεπὸν χορίω κύνα γεῦσαι ‘donʼt let a dog taste blood’, Theoc. 10.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐξελιγμός, Ael. Tact. 27.1, 28.3, Arr. Tact. 23.1, 24.3.
IG 5(1).1390.73 ( Andania, i B. C.).
dancing-girl, Call. Dian. 13, Del. 306, Nonn. D. 1.504, 46.158, etc.; χορίττιδες (sic) ἐννέα Μοῦσαι Dioscorus in PLit.Lond. 100 D 4.
dance in a chorus, Suid.:— χοροβᾰτία, ἡ, dancing in a chorus, Hdn. Epim. 152.
Dsc. 3.76 (nisi leg. χοιρ-).
office of χοροδιδάσκαλος, Pl. Alc. 1.125e.
of or for the χοροδιδάσκαλος, [ ἀρετή] Pl. Alc. 1.125e.
trainer of the chorus, Ar. Ec. 809, Pl. Lg. 812e, 655a, SIG 450.5 ( Delph., iii B. C.), etc.
accustomed to the choral dance, νύμφαι h.Pan. 3.
flourishing in the dance, κοῦραι AP 6.287 (Antip.).

definition: χοροιμανής, ές, Ep. for χορομανής, Orph. H. 52.7, Fr. 282, Max. 496.

children.definition: furious dancing, APl. 16.289.
beat the ground in the dance, Opp. H. 1.472, C. 4.342.
choral dancing, χοροιτυπίῃσιν ἄριστοι Il. 24.261; later in sg., AP 7.448 ( Leon.), 9.82 ( Antip.Thess.): metaph., ib. 12.253 ( Strat.).
beating the ground in the choral dance, generally, dancing, Pi. Fr. 156, Opp. H. 3.250, Nonn. D. 9.202, al.; cj. for χειροκτύπῳ in Telest. 1.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: χοροίτυπος, ον, Pass., played for or to the choral dance, χέλυς h.Merc. 31.
danced over, ἄλσος Nonn. D. 13.95.

definition: χοροκάλη, ἡ, prob. an error for χορῷ κ. ( Il. 16.180), Hsch.

children.definition: one who plays the cithara to a chorus, CIG 2758 f, al. ( Aphrodisias); dat. sg. written χοροκιθαρι (sic) IG 14.611 ( Sardinia).
play the cithara to a chorus, Macr. Exc. p.600 K.
Suet. Dom. 4.
choir-destroying, Strattis 15 [Kin. 9.1].
conductor of a chorus, Hecat.Abd. ap. Ael. NA 11.1, cf. 15.5, Poll. 4.106.
mad after dancing, τρόπος Ar. Th. 961 (lyr.); cf. χοροιμανής.
to the festive dance, Il. 3.393.
victorious with the chorus, Alex. 19 (perh. a pr. n.).
sporting in the choral dance, dancing merrily, Orph. H. 24.2.

definition: χοροπαίκτης, ου, ὁ, = foreg., AP 6.108 ( Myrin.).

children.definition: weaving, i.e. mixing in the dance, Nonn. D. 6.49, 14.33, al.
institution, arrangement of a chorus, Poll. 4.106.
instituting or arranging a chorus, X. Ages. 2.17, IG 14.82* (prob. a forgery).

children.label: II
children.definition: leading the dance, ὦ θεῶν χοροποίʼ ἄναξ, of Pan, S. Aj. 698 (lyr.); Χάριτες E. Ph. 788 (lyr.); ἥβα Ar. Ra. 353 (lyr.); θυσίαι E. Hec. 917 (lyr.); χαροποιός is found in codd. of E. Ph. l.c. and v.l. in E. Hec. l.c.

dance, αἰεὶ δʼ ἡμῖν δαίς τε φίλη κίθαρίς τε χοροί τε Od. 8.248; μετὰ μελπομένῃσιν ἐν χορῷ Ἀρτέμιδος Il. 16.183; τοὶ δʼ ἄνδρες ἐν ἀγλαΐῃς τε χοροῖς τε τέρψιν ἔχον Hes. Sc. 272, cf. 277; εἰς χ. ἐλθέμεν Il. 15.508, cf. Od. 18.194; οὐδέ κε φαίης ἀνδρὶ μαχεσσάμενον τόν γʼ ἐλθεῖν, ἀλλὰ χορόνδε ἔρχεσθʼ ἠὲ χοροῖο νέον λήγοντα καθίζειν Il. 3.393, 394; χορῷ καλὴ Πολυμήλη 16.180: later of the dance as a public religious ceremony, Διόνυσον τιμώσας χοροῖς E. Ba. 220; φυλῆς Ἀκαμαντίδος ἐν χοροῖσιν Simon. 148, cf. Hdt. 2.48, Isoc. 9.1; χοροὺς ἀνῆγον αἱ πόλεις (sc. εἰς τὴν Δῆλον) Th. 3.104; πεντήκοντʼ ἀνδρῶν χ. Simon. 147, cf. Sch. Aeschin. 1.10; κύκλιος χ. (v. κύκλιος) ; θυσίῃσί σφεα (sc. Δαμίην καὶ Αὐξησίην) καὶ χοροῖσι γυναικηΐοισι κερτόμοισι ἱλάσκοντο Hdt. 5.83; ἵστασαν χοροὺς παρθένων τε καὶ ἠϊθέων Id. 3.48; παιδικὸς χ. Is. 7.40, etc.; χ. ἀνδρικός X. HG 6.4.16, cf. Pl. Lg. 665b; τραγικοὶ χοροί, at Sicyon, Hdt. 5.67: hence of the chorus in the Attic drama, οἱ χ. τῶν τραγῳδῶν Ar. Av. 787, cf. Pax 807 (lyr.); χ. τραγικός, κωμικός, Arist. Pol. 1276b4; also χ. τρυγικός, τρυγῳδικός, Ar. Ach. 628 (anap.), 886; arranged in six rows, Cratin. 173; ὃς οὐκ ἔδωκʼ αἰτοῦντι Σοφοκλέει χορόν (of the archon to whom the poet applied) Id. 15; χ. αἰτεῖν Ar. Eq. 513 (anap.); διδόναι Pl.
