need, want, lack, Thgn. 389, 394, al., dub. cj. in Trag.Adesp. 509 (lyr.).

definition: χρήννυμι and χρηννύω, v. χράω (B) B.

children.definition: to be useful or serviceable, τοῖς ἐπιλήπτοις Thphr. Fr. 175, cf. Phld. Rh. 1.221, al., Luc. DMort. 20[10].9; τῇ πατρίδι IGRom. 4.1228 ( Thyatira); πρός τι D.S. 1.81, Dsc. 2.149; εἴς τι Epicur. Fr. 458, Gal. 19.396, Iamb. in Nic. p.12P.: abs., LXX Wi. 4.3, Muson. Fr. 18Ap.95 H., Alex.Aphr. in Top. 430.2: sens.obsc., D.L. 6.91:— rejected by the Atticists, cf. Phryn. 367.
speak for edification, prob. in Phld. Po. 5.13.
edification, Phld. Po. 5.13.

definition: χρήσιμος, η, ον, also ος, ον X. Mem. 3.8.8, Pl. Grg. 480b, R. 333b: ( χράομαι):—

children.definition: useful, serviceable, first in Thgn. 406; εἰς ἀνάγκαν, ἔνθʼ οὐ ποδὶ χρησίμῳ χρῆται S. OT 878 (lyr.); τὸ χ. φρενῶν the excellence of . . , E. Ph. 1740 (lyr.); τὸ αὐτίκα χ. Th. 3.56; ἡ διὰ τὸ χ. φιλία Arist. EN 1159b13; τὰ χ. Men. Mon. 579; χ. εἴς τι useful for something, Hdt. 4.109, Ar. Pl. 493 (anap.), Pl. R. l.c.; ἐπί τι Id. Grg. l.c.; πρός τι E. Hipp. 482 ( Comp.); ἰδίᾳ ἑκάστῳ χ. καὶ ὑπὲρ τοῦ κοινοῦ ὠφέλιμα X. Cyr. 6.2.34; τοῦτʼ οὖν τί ἐστι χρήσιμον; Ar. Nu. 202; χρήσιμόν ἐστι, c. inf., Id. Av. 382 (troch.).

data.quote: εἰς ἀνάγκαν, ἔνθʼ οὐ ποδὶ χρησίμῳ χρῆται
ἰδίᾳ ἑκάστῳ χ. καὶ ὑπὲρ τοῦ κοινοῦ ὠφέλιμα

children.definition: serviceable, useful, S. Aj. 410, D. 20.7, etc.; Comp. -ώτερος Pl. Lg. 819c: esp., like χρηστός, a good and useful citizen, χ. πόλει E. Or. 910; χ. πολίτης Eup. 118; χ. τινι Is. Fr. 16.1; ἐπί τι D. 25.31; τοὺς εὐπόρους δεῖ χ. αὑτοὺς παρέχειν τοῖς πολίταις to show themselves useful, serviceable to the state, Id. 42.22, cf. E. Supp. 887, Is. Fr. 10.1 ( Comp.); τοῖς σώμασι -ώτεροι more able-bodied, X. Lac. 5.9; opp. ἀργαλέος τὴν ὄψιν, Aeschin. 1.61.
used, made use of, τέμενος -ώτατον a much-frequented sanctuary, dub. in Hdt. 2.178.
χρησίμη διαθήκη an available ( i.e. authentic) will, Is. 6.30.
νομίσματα οὐ χρήσιμα ἔξω money that will not pass abroad, X. Vect. 3.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv., -μως ἔχειν to be serviceable, Th. 3.44, X. Cyr. 8.5.9; χ. τινὶ σωθῆναι with advantage to him, Th. 5.91, cf. J. BJ 6.2.9; τὰ -μως λεγόμενα Plu. Aud.poet. 2.36d.
usefulness, Gloss.

children.label: I
children.definition: employment, use made of a thing, ἀνέμων Pi. O. 11(10).2; χρημάτων Democr. 282; οἰκίας Pl. Erx. 394d, cf. SIG 987.33 ( Chios, iv B. C.); τὴν κατʼ ἀξίαν χ. ποιοῦνται ἑκάστῳ (fort. leg. ἑκάστου) Iamb. Protr. 5; use, practice, Hp. VM 4; in pl., uses, advantages, Pi. N. 1.30; αἱ ἐς τὰ πολεμικὰ χ. the uses of war, X. Cyr. 8.5.7; αἱ πολιτικαὶ χ. Arist. Pol. 1267a23; opp. κτῆσις, Pl. Mx. 238b, Arist. EN 1098b32, Cic. Fam. 7.29.1; opp. πώλησις, X. Oec. 3.9.
usefulness, Th. 7.5; opp. ἀχρηστία, Pl. R. 333d; ἐς χρῆσιν κρατύνεσθαι so as to become useful, Hp. Art. 27; ἔχειν χρῆσιν to be useful, D. 11.8.

intimacy, acquaintance, ἡ οἰκειότης καὶ ἡ χ. [τῆς πόλεως] Isoc. Ep. 2.14; ἡ χ. ἡ πρὸς ἀλλήλους Arist. Pol. 1280a36; αἱ οἴκοι χρήσεις Isoc. 19.11; ἡ τῶν ἀφροδισίων χ. Pl. Lg. 841a, Arist. HA 581b13, cf. Pol. 1262a34 (pl.), Ep.Rom. 1.26; τὰ ἐν χρήσει familiar objects, Plot. 4.4.37.

usage, of words, ἡ ἐξαλλαγὴ τῆς συνήθους χ. D.H. Amm. 2.3; ἀναστρέφων τὰς χ. ib. 2, cf. A.D. Synt. 119.24, al.; ἡ Πλάτωνος χ. Id. Pron. 72.18; in concrete sense, example of a word or use, πυκνῶς αἱ χ. παρὰ Αἰολεῦσιν ib. 66.3; passage cited, f. l. for κρίσει in D.H. Rh. 4.3; indicated by the symbol [ΧΡ ligature], Anon. Oxy. 1611.56 (iii A. D.); [ΧΡ ligature] Ἀριστοφάνους (referring to Av. 1181) An.Ox. 2.452.

children.label: II
children.definition: χράω (B) A), oracular response, ἀπὸ κείνου χρήσιος at his bidding, Pi. O. 13.76.

children.label: III
children.definition: χράω (B) B), lending, loan, Arist. EN 1131a4, Plb. 31.23.4, Ps.-Phoc. 106.
utterer of oracles, of Apollo, AP 9.525.23.
utter oracles. Luc. Syr.D. 10.
uttering oracles, ἄδυτον Rev.Phil. 46.114 (Yazili Kaya); Σίβυλλα IGRom. 4.1540 ( Erythrae).
office where oracles are recorded, Rev. Phil. 44.249, 251 ( Didyma, ii B. C.).
a giving of oracles, Vett.Val. 184.6 (pl.).
give oracles, Poll. 1.17:— Pass., receive an oracular response, CIG 4539 ( Palestine); aor. inf. written -ισθῆναι (as if from -ίζω) Ps.-Callisth. 3.17 cod.Leid.
oracular response, Suid.
one who gives oracles, prophet, soothsayer, Poll. 1.14, Vett.Val. 112.10.
App.Anth. 6.82.10.
utter oracles, Ar. Av. 964, 991, D.S. 16.26; εἰρήνην χ. to prophesy peace, LXX Je. 45(38).4.
an uttering of oracles, D.S. 16.26, Poll. 1.18.
the art of divination, Poll. 1.19.
divination, Poll. 1.18.
uttering oracles, χ. ἀνήρ soothsayer, diviner, Hdt. 1.62, 8.96; of Musaeus, S. Fr. 1116.

children.label: II
children.definition: expounder of oracles, Hdt. 7.142, 143; and in 7.6, of Onomacritus, collector of oracles, oracle-monger, cf. Ar. Av. 960, Pax 1047, Th. 2.8, 21.
expounder of oracles, Tz. ad Lyc. 494.
consult an oracle, An.Bachm. 1.418 (ubi male -πνευστοῦντι).
making oracles in verse, Luc. Alex. 23.

oracular response, oracle, Pi. P. 4.60, SIG 1044.49 ( Halic., iv/iii B. C.), etc.; χ. ἀσήμους δυσκρίτως τʼ εἰρημένους A. Pr. 662; ἔχρησʼ Ἀδράστῳ Λοξίας χρησμόν E. Ph. 409; σφι χρησμὸν ἔφαινε delivered an oracle to them, Hdt. 1.159; ᾄδειν Th. 2.21 (cf. χρησμῳδός) ; εὔτεκνοι χ. promising happy progeny, E. Ion 424; χ. ἔμμετρος Plu. Pyth. 2.396c; καταλογάδην τοὺς χ. λέγειν ib. 397d; χρησμὸς . . περαίνεται is fulfilled, E. Ph. 1703; χρησμοῦ ὄντος . . τὴν πόλιν διαφθαρῆναι Pl. R. 415c; ὥσπερ χρησμοὺς γράψαντες, i. e. with all solemnity, Lycurg. 92, cf. Isoc. 4.171.
need, want, poverty, Tyrt. 10.8, A.R. 2.473, Plot. 1.8.5.
κόρος and corresponding to διακόσμησις, Heraclit. 65, cf. Ph. 1.89, 2.242, Plu. E apud Delph. 2.389c.

children.label: II
children.definition: importunity, τῆς χ. μετίεσαν Hdt. 9.33.

children.label: III
children.definition: service, A.R. 1.837.
bringing oracles, Paus. 4.9.3.
keeper of oracles, Luc. Alex. 23.

deliver oracles, prophesy, Hdt. 7.6, Ar. Eq. 818 (anap.), Pl. Cra. 396d; τι X. Ap. 30; τισι Pl. Ap. 39c; τὰ συμφέροντα Epicur. Sent.Vat. 29; χ. ἐμμέτρως Plu. QConv. 2.623c:— Pass., κεχρησμῳδήσθω Pl. Lg. 712a; τὰ κεχρησμῳδημένα Id. Ep. 323c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be inspired, receive a divine revelation, Ph. 2.384.
oracular response, Hsch., Eust. 1426.62.
oracular, Philostr. Her. 10.4; σοφία Id. VA 6.11.
answer of an oracle, prophecy, prop. chanted or in verse, A. Pr. 775, Plu. Pyth. 2.402d: pl., Pl. Prt. 316d.
oracular, Luc. Alex. 22. Adv. -κῶς Eust. 45.39.
oracular nonsense, cj. for χρηισμοδέληρος in Pl.Com. 13D.
chanting oracles, or delivering them in verse; then, generally, prophesying, prophetic, χ. παρθένος, of the Sphinx, S. OT 1200 (lyr.); epith. of Apollo, Epigr.Gr. 1023.2 ( Nubia).
oracular, φάτις S. Fr. 573.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., soothsayer, oracle-monger, Pl. Ap. 22c, Ion 534d, al.

definition: χρἤσται, χρῆ ʼσται, or χρὴ ʼσται, v. χρή.

children.definition: one must use, c. dat. rei, Hp. Art. 77, Pl. Sph. 267e; ὅπῃ καὶ ὅπως χ. τινί X. Mem. 3.1.11; πῶς χ. εἴη περί τινος D.S. 18.64; πῶς χ. προτρέποντα = πῶς δεῖ τινα χρῆσθαι, Arist. Rh. 1375a26 cf. Plb. 5.98.9, Phld. Mort. 19, Porph. Abst. 2.44, etc.
to be kind or merciful, 1 Ep.Cor. 13.4.
Choerob. in Theod. 1.262H., al.
give oracles, prophesy, τισι Ephor. 31 (b) J.; χ. τάδε πρὸς τὴν ἐρώτησιν SIG 557.6 ( Magn.Mae., iii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. ( fut. -άσομαι Theopomp.Hist. 314), consult an oracle, Hdt. 1.55; χρηστηριάζεσθαι ἐν Δελφοῖσι ἐπί τινι ib. 66; χ. θεῷ consult a god, Id. 7.178; ἱροῖσι χ. by means of victims, Id. 8.134; αἰξὶ μάλιστα χ. D.S. 16.26; περί τινος respecting something, Hdt. 2.52; χ. εἰ . . to as the oracle whether . . , Id. 5.67; εἰς ἥντινα παρέσονται χώραν Ant.Lib. 8.2:— aor. Pass., τῶν βουλομένων -ασθῆναι IG 9(2).1109.34 ( Thessaly, ii/i B. C.).
an oracle, i. e.,

children.label: I
children.definition: the seat of an oracle, such as Delphi, h.Ap. 81, 214, Hes. Fr. 134.6, Hdt. 1.47, al., E. Med. 667, etc.; τὸ ἐν Δελφοῖσι χ. Hdt. 1.13, cf. X. Cyr. 7.2.15; χρᾶσθαι χρηστηρίοισι Hdt. 1.47, 53, al.: distd. fr. the νηός, Id. 6.19: sts. in pl. for sg., A. Th. 748, Eu. 194.
oracular response, Hdt. 1.63, 69, al., Th. 1.25, 2.54: pl., A. Ag. 964, S. OC 604, 1331, E. Ion 532 (troch.).

children.label: II
children.definition: an offering for the oracle, made by those consulting it: generally, sacrificial victim, χ. θέσθαι Pi. O. 6.70; χ. παρέχειν IG 2(2).1126.33; χρηστήρια θεοῖσιν ἔρδειν A. Th. 230, cf. Supp. 450; χ. πέπτωκε E. Ion 419: metaph., victim, sacrifice, σφάγια . . κείνου χρηστήρια τἀνδρός S. Aj. 220 (anap.).

definition: χρηστήριος, α, ον, also ος, ον A. Eu. 241: ( χράω (B) A):

children.definition: oracular, prophetic, ἐφετμαί l.c.; ὄρνιθες Id. Th. 26; χρηστηρίαν ἐσθῆτα Id. Ag. 1270; τρίπους χ. E. Ion 1320; τοὔνομα Id. Hel. 822; also Ἄπολλον χρηστήριε author of oracles, Hdt. 6.80, cf. OGI 312 ( Aegae, ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: χράομαι) = χρηστικός, fitted or designed for use, useful, χρηστήρια σκεύη household utensils or furniture, Pl.Com. 27 ( τὰ πρὸς θεωρίαν ἢ θυσίαν σ. Poll. 10.11); without σκεύη, Mnemos. 57.208 ( Argos, vi B. C.), OGI 326.30 ( Teos, ii B. C.); ὅσα σκύτινα τῶν ὅπλων καὶ τῶν χ. Str. 13.1.48, cf. 15.2.6, Nic.Dam. 106J.; τὸν περίβολον καὶ τὰ ἐν αὐτῷ χ. Explor.Arch. de Délos 11.291, cf. 120, Durrbach Choix d’ inscr. de Délos 119 (ii B. C.); τὰ δώματα καὶ τὰ χ. τῶν ὑδάτων Supp.Epigr. 8.170 ( Palestine), cf. PCair.Zen. 764.37 (iii B. C.).

data.quote: τὰ πρὸς θεωρίαν ἢ θυσίαν σ.
ὅσα σκύτινα τῶν ὅπλων καὶ τῶν χ.
τὸν περίβολον καὶ τὰ ἐν αὐτῷ χ.
τὰ δώματα καὶ τὰ χ. τῶν ὑδάτων

children.definition: oracular, divine, μαντικὴ χ., opp. ἀνθρωπίνη, Philostr. VS 1 Prooem.

definition: χρήστης (written χρείστης SIG 364.40 ( Ephes., iii B. C.)), ου, ὁ: gen. pl. χρήστων (not χρηστῶν, to distinguish it from the gen. pl. of χρηστός, Hdn.Gr. 1.425): ( χράω (B) A):—

children.definition: one who gives or expounds oracles, prophet, soothsayer, Hsch., prob. in Milet. 7p.50 ( Didyma, i B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: κίχρημι) creditor, usurer, Ps.-Phoc. 83, Ar. Nu. 240, 434 (anap.), Lys. 32.29, Lycurg. 22, etc.
χράομαι, κίχραμαι) debtor, Phoc. 16, D. 30.12, 32.12, IPE 12.32 B84 ( Olbia, iii B. C.), cf. Harp. s.v.: c. gen., κακοῦ ἀνδρός Phoc. l.c.; χρημάτων D. 36.6.

definition: χρηστικός, ή, όν, ( χράομαι) of persons,

children.definition: knowing how to use, understanding the use of a thing, τῶν ὑπαρχόντων Arist. Oec. 1344b26; δεσποτικὴ ἐπιστήμη ἡ χ. δούλων Id. Pol. 1255b31: abs., δύναμις χ., opp. ὑπηρετική, Procl. in Prm. p.735 S.: also c. dat. (like the Verb), M.Ant. 7.55.
useful, serviceable, σώματος ἕξις Plu. Cat.Ma. 1: Sup., μέλι -ώτατον Id. Aud.poet. 2.32e. Adv. -κῶς ib. Profect. 80b: Comp. -ώτερον Arr. Epict. 2.9.19.
good or beautiful painting, Plu. Arat. 13.
goodness of heart, LXX Si. 37.11, Demetr. Eloc. 244.
good-natured, well-disposed, Arist. Rh. 1395b17, Ptol. Tetr. 163, al.
produce good wine, Str. 14.1.15.
the bearing of good fruits, Str. 6.4.1.
having, bearing good fruits, Str. 6.3.6.
to be used in a favourable sense, Eust. 766.29.
fair speaking, in bad sense, Ep.Rom. 16.18.
giving fair words, speaking plausibly, Hist.Aug.Pertinax 13.5.
desire of learning, Longin. 44.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: book containing a summary of useful knowledge or select passages, e.g. the χ. γραμματική of Procl. and the χρηστομάθειαι of Hellad., cf. Sor. 1.2, al.; so in pl. of the epitome of Strabo; also περὶ -μαθίας (sic) EM 227.53, Orus in EM 685.57.
to be desirous of learning, Longin. 2.3.
an adept in polite learning, Cic. Att. 1.6.2. Adv. -θῶς, εἴρηται Phld. Mus. p.83K.
to be devoted to good music, Ath. 14.633b.

definition: χρηστός, ή, όν, ( χράομαι) of things,

children.definition: useful, good of its kind, serviceable, [τόξα] χρηστὰ οὐδέν Hdt. 3.78; [ ἀτραπὸς] οὐδὲν χ. τισι Id. 7.215; χ. ἐπίπλοα Id. 1.94; [ γῆ] E. Hec. 594; οἰκία, opp. μοχθηρά, Pl. Grg. 504a; ἡ χ. μέλιττα, opp. οἱ κηφῆνες, Arist. HA 624b23: freq. of wholesome food, μελίτωμα Batr. 39; ποτόν, σῖτος, Pl. R. 438a; περὶ τὸ σῶμα Pl. Prt. 313d: c. gen., for a thing, νεύρων for the sinews, Ael. NA 14.21; ῥάφανος Alex. 15.8; ὄψον Antiph. 242, etc. (but pleasant to taste, nice, Thphr. Char. 2.10): generally, πολιτεία Isoc. 12.135; βίος Aeschin. 1.179; of victims and omens, auspicious, ἱρά, σφάγια, Hdt. 5.44, 9.61, 62; τελευτὴ χ. a happy end or issue, Id. 7.157; εἰ . . τοῦτό γε δοκέει ὑμῖν εἶναι χρηστόν Id. 5.92.αʹ: pl., τὰ χ., as Subst., benefits, kindnesses, Id. 1.41, 42; χρηστὰ φέρειν Id. 4.139; χρηστόν τι συμβουλεύειν, χρηστὰ ἐπιτηδεύειν, Ar. Nu. 793, Antipho 3.3.9; χρηστὰ λέγειν, πράττειν, etc., Men. 725, 787, etc.: but τὰ χ. also, happy event, ἐκτελοῖτο δὴ τὰ χ. A. Pers. 228 (troch.); prosperity, success, τὰ χ. δʼ αὔθʼ ἕκαστʼ ἔχει φίλους E. Hec. 1227.

data.quote: εἰ . . τοῦτό γε δοκέει ὑμῖν εἶναι χρηστόν
τὰ χ. δʼ αὔθʼ ἕκαστʼ ἔχει φίλους

children.definition: κακός, Eup. in PSI 11.1213.2; opp. πονηρός, Pl. Prt. 313d; τὸ χ., opp. τὸ αἰσχρόν, S. Ph. 476; χρηστός, opp. λυπρός, E. Med. 601: but λῦπαι χρησταί if working for good, Pl. Grg. 499e.
good for its purpose, effective (even for evil), τραῦμα, δῆγμα, Luc. Symp. 44, Alex. 55.
in use, current, ποιηταῖς χρηστά Eust. 215.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: good, esp. in war, valiant, true, Hdt. 5.109, 6.13, S. Ph. 437, etc.: generally, good, honest, worthy, Id. OT 610; οἰκέται X. Oec. 9.5; of women, ἐρεῖ τις ὡς Κλυταιμνήστρα κακή· Ἄλκηστιν ἀντέθηκα χρηστήν Eub. 117.11, cf. Men. Mon. 634; of good citizens, useful, deserving, D. 20.7: c. acc. cogn., ἃ χρηστοὶ ἐγένεσθε Th. 3.64; χ. περὶ τὴν πόλιν γεγενημένος Lys. 14.31; χ. καὶ φιλόπολις Ar. Pl. 900; collectively, ὀλίγον τὸ χ. Id. Ra. 783; but also ironically, ὁ χ. οὑτοσί Id. Nu. 8; οἱ χ. πρέσβεις οὗτοι D. 18.30, cf. 89; ἐκλελάκτικεν ὁ χ. ἡμῖν μοιχός Men. 16.

data.quote: ἐρεῖ τις ὡς Κλυταιμνήστρα κακή· Ἄλκηστιν ἀντέθηκα χρηστήν

children.label: c
children.definition: inf., ὅσοι προβατεύειν χ. Him. Or. 14.32.
οἱ χρηστοί, like οἱ ἀγαθοί, those of good family, X. Ath. 1.4, 6.
propitious, merciful, bestowing health or wealth, θεῶν χρηστῶν ἥκειν εὖ Hdt. 8.111, cf. M.Ant. 9.11.

good, kindly, δούλῳ . . χ. γενόμενός ἐστι δεσπότης πατρίς Antiph. 265; ὡς ἡδὺ δούλῳ δεσπότου χρηστοῦ τυχεῖν Men. Mon. 556, cf. Philem. 227; ὁ χ., ὡς ἔοικε, καὶ χρηστοὺς ποιεῖ Men. 203b, cf. Plu. Phoc. 10; χ. περί τινα D. 59.2; ἐπί τινας Ev.Luc. 6.35; εἰς ἀλλήλους Ep.Eph. 4.32.

data.quote: δούλῳ . . χ. γενόμενός ἐστι δεσπότης πατρίς
ὡς ἡδὺ δούλῳ δεσπότου χρηστοῦ τυχεῖν
ὁ χ., ὡς ἔοικε, καὶ χρηστοὺς ποιεῖ

children.label: b
children.definition: simple, silly, like εὐήθης, χρηστὸς εἶ ὅτι ἡγῇ . . , youʼre a nice fellow, to think that . . , Pl. Phdr. 264b, cf. Tht. 161a; ὦ χρηστέ D. 18.318.
strong, able in body for sexual intercourse, = γυναικὶ χρῆσθαι δυνάμενος, Hp. Genit. 2.
dead, whence χρηστὸν ποιεῖν = ἀποκτιννύναι, in a treaty between the Spartans and Tegea, Arist. Fr. 592.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τῶς well, properly, Hdt. 4.117, Hp. Art. 32; χ. ἔχειν Ar. Ec. 219; σκευάσαι χ. τοὖψον Alex. 149.6.: ironically, χ. τὴν πατρίδα ἐπετρόπευσας Hdt. 3.36.

goodness, honesty, uprightness, χρηστότητα ἀσκεῖν E. Supp. 872; μέγιστον ἀγαθόν ἐστι μετὰ νοῦ χ. Men. 788, cf. 472.1; χρηστότητος εἵνεκα as a reward for honesty, Aristopho 14.4 (troch.), Timocl. 8.17; ποιεῖν χ. LXX Ps. 13(14).3; ἀκολουθεῖ τῇ ἀρετῇ χ.) Arist. VV 1251b33; ἡ σὴ χ., as a honorific address, PGiss. 7.15 (ii A. D.), PLond. 2.411.6 (iv A. D.), etc.

data.quote: μέγιστον ἀγαθόν ἐστι μετὰ νοῦ χ.

children.label: II
children.definition: goodness of heart, kindness, Is. 2.7 (but in depreciatory sense, soft-heartedness, Men. 579); εὔνοιαν καὶ χ. παρέσχητο Hdn. 2.9.9; χ. καὶ φιλοστοργία, φιλανθρωπία καὶ χ., Plu. Agis 17, Comp.Dem.Cic. 3, cf. Luc. Tim. 8, D.C. 73.5; ἡ χ. καὶ ἡ φιλανθρωπία τοῦ θεοῦ Ep.Tit. 3.4, cf. Ep.Rom. 11.22, al.; χ. ἐθʼ ἡμᾶς Ep.Eph. 2.7; ποιεῖν χρηστότητα to show kindness, LXX Ps. 118(119).65; πολλὰ τῇ χ. . . κτῶνται Phld. Rh. 1.262S.

data.quote: ἡ χ. καὶ ἡ φιλανθρωπία τοῦ θεοῦ

children.definition: simplicity, silly good nature, ἤθους ἀπλαστία μετʼ ἀλογιστίας, Pl. Def. 412e.
good deed, service, Iamb(?).ap. Suid. ( Berl.Sitz. 1875p.4).
the friendship of good men, Arist. Rh. 1361b35.
possessed of good friends, Arist. Rh. 1361b38.

children.label: II
children.definition: trusty friend, opp. κακόφιλος, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).146.
goodness of voice, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.10.7.
Hsch.
PGrenf. 1.21.10 ( ii B. C., pl.).

definition: χρῖ χρίει, Hsch. χρία· μυρμήκων κοίτη, Id.

children.definition: unguent, oil, Xenoph. 3.6 (pl.), A. Ag. 94 (anap.), Achae. 5.2, X. An. 4.4.13 ( χρίσμα vel χρῆμα codd.), Call. Lav. Pall. 16 (pl.), Iamb. 1.241, 272, POxy. 529.4 (ii A. D.).

bring near; Act. in Hom. only in compd. ἐγχρίμπτω (q. v.); πόδας χρίμπτουσα ῥαχίαισι keeping oneʼs steps close along the shore, A. Pr. 713; ὑπʼ ἐσχάτην στήλην ἔχριμπτʼ ἀεὶ σύριγγα kept the axle close to the post, S. El. 721:— Med., πόδα χριμπτόμενος εἰναλίῳ κώπᾳ E. Hel. 526 (lyr.); χρίμψασθαι ποτὶ πλευρὰ κάρη Theoc. 25.144:—more freq. in Pass., touch the surface of a body, graze, scratch, χριμφθεὶς πέλας grazing near, close even to touching, Od. 10.516; ἐκ γενύων χριμφθεὶς γόος the wail or cry forcing its way to the ear from the clenched jaws, Pi. P. 12.21: generally, draw near, approach, c. dat., δόμοισι τοῖσδε χρίμπτεσθαι A. Eu. 185; τείχεσι χριμπτομένα E. Ph. 809 (lyr.); δόμοις ib. 99; ἐχριμπτόμην Κύκλωπι Id. Cyc. 406: τόπους εἰς τούσδε Critias 16.4 D.: also in aor. 1 Med., ἀμάθοισιν ἐχρίμψατο νηῦς h.Ap. 439; ὅτεῳ χριμψαίατο λύθρον Euph. 50: c. gen., νεκροθήκης οὐ χριμπτόμενος E. Fr. 472.18 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., αὐδῶ μὴ χρίμπτειν θριγκοῖς Id. Ion 156 (lyr.); λίσσου, γούνασι δεσπότου χρίμπτων Id. Andr. 530 (lyr.): abs., χρίμψε κιών A.R. 3.1286.
used for anointing, Sch. Ar. Pl. 529.
smearing, ἡ τοῦ ἐλαιου εἰς ἱμάτιον χ. Arist. Pr. 966b35; τῶν ἀγγείων Dsc. 1.58 ( χρῆσιν codd.); [ τῆς κεφαλῆς], = ἄλειψις, Diocl. Fr. 141.

data.quote: ἡ τοῦ ἐλαιου εἰς ἱμάτιον χ.

children.definition: anointing, PPetr. 2p.72 (iii B. C.), LXX Ex. 29.21, al.; φαρμάκων J. AJ 2.14.3 (pl.)

children.label: II
children.definition: colouring, varnish, wash, Muson. Fr. 19p.108H.(pl.), Ael. NA 6.41; colour-washing, τῶν σκαναμάτων IG 42(1).109 i 128 ( Epid., iii B. C.), cf. Supp.Epigr. 4.270 (Panamara, i(?) B.C.).

definition: χρῖσμα ατος, τό, ( χρίω) later form for χρῖμα (q.v.), found in codd. of X. Smp. 2.4, An. 4.4.13, Thphr. Od. 8, 15, Sor. 1.4, Gal. 6.402, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: anointing, unction, LXX Ex. 29.7, 35.15, Gal. 10.892.
NT of spiritual grace, χρῖσμα ἔχετε ἀπὸ τοῦ ἁγίου 1 Ep.Jo. 2.20, cf. 27.

children.label: III
children.definition: coating of wall, plaster, D.S. 2.9, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 62. (The usual accent χρίσμα is wrong, cf. χρῖμα.)
one must anoint, smear, Orib. Fr. 74, Syn. 1.20, Gp. 16.4.1.
unguent, a bottle of ointments, Suid.
white-washer, Hsch. s.v. κονιαταί.

children.label: II
children.definition: stucco-maker, Steph. in Hp. 2.397 D.
Christian, Porph. Chr. 88.
Christian, Act. Ap. 11.26, 26.28, 1 Ep.Pet. 4.16, etc. Adv. -νῶς, ζῆν Porph. ap. Eus. PE 6.19.
to be rubbed on, used as ointment or salve, opp. πιστός, A. Pr. 480, cf. E. Hipp. 516, Triclin. ad Theoc. 11.1; τὸ ἔλαιον τὸ χ. anointing oil, LXX Le. 21.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: anointed, ὁ ἱερεύς ὁ χ. ib. 4.5, 16, 6.22: pl., ib. 2 Ma. 1.10.
ὁ χ. Κυρίου ib. 1 Ki. 24.7, cf. Ps. 17 ( 18). 51; also τῷ χ. μου Κύρῳ Is. 45.1; pl., of the patriarchs, Ps. 104 ( 105). 15.
NT, ὁ χ. the Messiah, Ev.Matt. 2.4, etc.; ὁ χ. Κυρίου Ev.Luc. 2.26; then used as pr. n. of Jesus, Ἰησοῦς Χ. Ev.Matt. 1.1, etc.; Ἰησοῦς ὁ λεγόμενος Χ. ib. 16.

definition: χρίω, Ep. impf. χρῖον Od. 4.252, also χρίεσκε A.R. 4.871: fut. χρίσω E. Med. 789: aor. ἔχρῑσα Od. 10.364, etc., Ep. χρῖσα Il. 16.680, Od. 4.49: pf. κέχρῑκα LXX 1 Ki. 10.1, al.:— Med., fut. χρίσομαι Od. 6.220: aor. part. χρῑσάμενος ib. 96, Hes. Op. 523, etc.:— Pass., fut. χρισθήσομαι LXX Ex. 30.32: aor. ἐχρίσθην A. Pr. 675, Achae. 10: pf. κέχρῑμαι Hdt. 4.189, 195, Magnes 3, etc., later κέχρισμαι LXX 2 Ki. 5.17: plpf. ἐκέχριστο f. l. in X. Cyr. 7.1.2; 3 pl. ἐκέχριντο Callix. 2. [Even in pres. and impf. ι is long, Od. 21.179 ( ἐπι-χρῑοντες), Il. 23.186, S. Tr. 675, etc.; χρῐει only in late Poets, as AP 6.275 ( Noss.): in fut. and all other tenses ῑ without exception, whence the proper accent. is χρῖσαι, κεχρῖσθαι, χρῖσμα, etc.:—

children.definition: touch the surface of a body slightly, esp. of the human body, graze, hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: rub, anoint with scented unguents or oil, as was done after bathing, freq. in Hom., λόεον καὶ χρῖον ἐλαίῳ Od. 4.252; ἔχρισεν λίπʼ ἐλαίῳ 3.466; λοέσσαι τε χρῖσαί τε 19.320; of a dead body, χρῖεν ἐλαίῳ Il. 23.186; anoint a suppliant, Berl.Sitzb. 1927.170 ( Cyrene); πέπλον χ. rub or infect with poison, S. Tr. 675, cf. 689, 832 (lyr.): metaph., ἱμέρῳ χρίσασʼ οἰστόν E. Med. 634 (lyr.); οὐ μέλανι, ἀλλὰ θανάτῳ χ. τὸν κάλαμον Plu. VOrat. 2.841e:— Med., anoint oneself, Od. 6.96; κάλλεϊ ἀμβροσίῳ οἵῳ . . Κυθέρεια χρίεται 18.194, cf. Hes. Op. 523; ἐλαίῳ Gal. 6.417; ἐκ φαρμάκου Luc. Asin. 13: c. acc. rei, ἰοὺς χρίεσθαι anoint (i. e. poison) oneʼs arrows, Od. 1.262:— Pass., χρίεσθαι ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου Hdt. 3.124; βακκάριδι κεχριμένος Magnes l.c.; συκαμίνῳ τὰς γνάθους κεχριμέναι Eub. 98.3: metaph., Σοφοκλέους τοῦ μέλιτι κεχριμένου Ar. Fr. 581.

data.quote: οὐ μέλανι, ἀλλὰ θανάτῳ χ. τὸν κάλαμον

children.definition: LXX, anoint in token of consecration, χ. τινὰ εἰς βασιλέα 4 Ki. 9.3; εἰς ἄρχοντα 1 Ki. 10.1; εἰς προφήτην 3 Ki. 19.16; also χ. τινὰ τοῦ βασιλεύειν Jd. 9.15: c. dupl. acc., χ. τινὰ ἔλαιον Ep.Hebr. 1.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: wash with colour, coat, αἰγέαι κεχριμέναι ἐρευθεδάνῳ Hdt. 4.189; πίσσῃ ib. 195, cf. Inscr.Délos 442 A 188 (ii B. C.); ἀσφάλτῳ X. Cyr. 7.5.22 ( Pass.); στοάν Supp.Epigr. 4.268 ( Panamara, ii A. D.):— Med., τὸ σῶμα μίλτῳ χρίονται smear their bodies, Hdt. 4.191.

children.label: III
children.definition: wound on the surface, puncture, prick, sting, of the gadfly in A. Pr. 566, 597, 880 (all lyr.):— Pass., ὀξυστόμῳ μύωπι χρισθεῖσʼ ib. 675.
colour, οὖρα, διαχώρημα, Ruf. Fr. 79.

definition: χροιά, Ep. and Ion. χροιή, Il. 14.164, Thgn. 1017 (in Call. Lav. Pall. 28 χροϊά ( χροίην codd.)), Att. χροιά and χρόα, the latter always in Pl. (v. infr.), also in Phld. D. 3.9, Sign. 5, al. (v. χρώς):—

children.definition: skin, esp. of the human body, hence the body itself, παραδραθέειν φιλότητι ᾑ χροιῇ Il. l.c.; κατὰ χροιὴν ῥέει ἱδρώς Thgn. l.c.; ὄζειν . . τῆς χρόας ἔφασκεν ἡδύ μου Ar. Pl. 1020; τὰ ἐξανθεῦντα ἐς τὴν χροιὴν ( skin, surface) ἢ χροιῇ ( colour, signf. II) ἢ οἰδήμασι Hp. de Arte 9: cf. χρώς.

data.quote: ὄζειν . . τῆς χρόας ἔφασκεν ἡδύ μου

children.definition: i.e. surface, Pythagorean term, Arist. Sens. 439a31, Placit. 1.15.2, Theol.Ar. 18 (pl.); χ. ἐπίπεδος ib. 10; so perh. in Epicur. Fr. 81, Phld. Sign. 5, al.
appearance to the eye, of heavenly bodies, Id. D. 3.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: superficial appearance of a thing, its colour, Thgn. 451, A. Pr. 493, E. Cyc. 517 (lyr.); παντοδάπαισι μεμειχμένα χροίαισιν Sapph. 20, cf. Numen. ap. Ath. 7.282a; τοιοῦτον (sc. ἐρυθρόν) εἶναι τῇ χροιᾷ τὸ μέλι Porph. Antr. 16; ἔστιν . . χρόα ἀπορροὴ σχημάτων ὄψει σύμμετρος καὶ αἰσθητός Pl. Men. 76d; νόμῳ χροιή . . ἐτεῇ δʼ ἄτομα καὶ κενόν Democr. 125, cf. Anaxag. 4, Arist. Sens. 440a8; ἐκ τριῶν τὰς χρόας ἅπασας μεμεγμένας, τοῦ φωτός, καὶ διʼ ὧν φαίνεται τὸ φῶς, καὶ τῶν ὑποκειμένων χρωμάτων Id. Col. 793b33.

data.quote: ἔστιν . . χρόα ἀπορροὴ σχημάτων ὄψει σύμμετρος καὶ αἰσθητός
νόμῳ χροιή . . ἐτεῇ δʼ ἄτομα καὶ κενόν
ἐκ τριῶν τὰς χρόας ἅπασας μεμεγμένας, τοῦ φωτός, καὶ διʼ ὧν φαίνεται τὸ φῶς, καὶ τῶν ὑποκειμένων χρωμάτων

children.definition: colour of the skin, complexion, χροιῆς ἄνθος ἀμειβομένης Sol. 27.6; χροιᾶς ἀμείψεις ἄνθος A. Pr. 23; χροιὰν ἀλλάξασα E. Med. 1168; λευκὴν χ. ἐκ παρασκευῆς ἔχεις Id. Ba. 457, cf. Ar. Nu. 1012 (anap.); χρόᾳ ἀδήλῳ τῶν δεδραμένων πέρι with colour that gives no hint of what has passed, E. Or. 1318; χρόαν . . τὴν σὴν ἥλιος . . αἰγυπτιώσει Pl.Com(?). p.615K. (post Fr. 55); χρόας κάλλος Pl. Smp. 196a; ἐρίζοι καὶ γάλακι χροιήν Call. Hec. Fr. 260.57 Pf. [updated ref.].

children.label: III
children.definition: nuance of a scale, Plu. Mus. 2.1143e.—On the accent, v. Hdn.Gr. 1.301, al.

touch the surface of a body, and generally, touch, Ἥβας χροΐζει λέχος E. Heracl. 915 (lyr.), cf. Pi. Fr. 139.6 ( Med.):— Med., touch anotherʼs skin with oneʼs own, lie with, τινι, of a woman, Theocr. 10.18 (in Dor. fut. χροϊξεῖται).

children.label: II
children.definition: colour, stain, χ. ἐπʼ ὀλίγον ἀγχούσῃ Dsc. 2.80; poet. aor. Pass. χροιισθεῖσαι Nic. Fr. 74.26, cf. Gal. 17(2).275.
coloratus, Gloss.
coloratura, Gloss.
crashing sound, χ. γενύων, in a pugilistic contest, Il. 23.688. (From the same Root as χρεμ-ετίζω, χρέμ-πτομαι.)

definition: χρόμη, ἡ, and χρόμος, ὁ, = foreg.: also

children.definition: the neighing of horses, Hsch.

definition: χρόμις, ιος, ὁ ( ἡ in Ael. NA 9.7), a sea-

children.definition: fish like σκίαινα, perh. Umbrina cirrhosa, Anan. 5.1 ( χρόμιος), Epich. 58 ( χρόμιος or -ίας codd. Ath.), Arist. HA 534a9 (v.l. χρέμις), Numen. ap. Ath. 7.295b; cf. χρέμυς.

children.label: I
children.definition: spend time, περὶ Αἴγυπτον Hdt. 3.61.

last, continue, τὸ μὲν καλῶς ἔχον ὅπως χρονίζον εὖ μενεῖ βουλευτέον A. Ag. 847; ἐν τῇ ὑστέρᾳ Arist. HA 523a23; χρονίζωσι ib. 537a7; οὐ χ. τὸ ἀλγοῦν συνεχῶς ἐν τῇ σαρκί Epicur. Sent. 4, cf. Diog. Oen.58.

data.quote: τὸ μὲν καλῶς ἔχον ὅπως χρονίζον εὖ μενεῖ βουλευτέον
οὐ χ. τὸ ἀλγοῦν συνεχῶς ἐν τῇ σαρκί

children.definition: χ. δρῶν persevere in doing, Pl. Phdr. 255b.

take time, tarry, linger, A. Ag. 1356, Ch. 64 (lyr.), Th. 6.49, 8.16; κεχρονικότες, opp. ὑπόγυιοι τῇ ὀργῇ ὄντες, Arist. Rh. 1380b5; κεχρονικὼς ἐν Ῥώμῃ Plb. 33.16.6; χρονίσαι κατὰ τὸ βαλανεῖον Gal. 6.417; ἡ ναῦς καὶ τὸν χρόνον τοῦτον ὃν ἐπιστέλλω σοι χρονίζει Hp. Ep. 14: c. inf., delay to do, χ. καταβῆναι LXX Ex. 32.1 (also χ. τοῦ ποιῆσαί τι ib. Ge. 34.19), Ev.Luc. 12.45.

data.quote: ἡ ναῦς καὶ τὸν χρόνον τοῦτον ὃν ἐπιστέλλω σοι χρονίζει

children.definition: to be or become chronic, Hp. Aph. 3.28.
to be or become old, to have age, Ath. 1.33a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be prolonged or delayed, τῶνδε πίστις οὐκ ὄκνῳ χρονίζεται A. Th. 54, cf. Ch. 957 (lyr.); πολέμου χρονισθέντος And. 3.27; [ τὴν εὔνοιαν] χρονιζομένην . . φιλίαν γενέσθαι Arist. EN 1167a11; χ. ἐν τῷ σώματι continue, Id. Pr. 907b22; τὰ κεχρονισμένα νοσήματα Gal. 18(2).31.
grow up, χρονισθεὶς δʼ ἀπέδειξεν ἔθος A. Ag. 727 (lyr.).
to be located in time, made temporal, Simp. in Ph. 716.11, Dam. Pr. 405.
of or concerning time, temporal, opp. τοπικός, Plot. 3.7.9; χ. ποίησις creation in time, Jul. Or. 4.146b. Adv. -κῶς ib. 145d, Prisc.Lyd. 36.2, Dam. Pr. 404.

children.label: II
children.definition: chronological, κανόνες Plu. Sol. 27: τὰ χ. (sc. βιβλία) annals or chronology, Id. Them. 27; αἱ χρονικαί (sc. γραφαί) D.H. 1.8; χ. σύνταξις D.S. 13.103.

children.label: III
children.definition: χ. ἐπιρρήματα adverbs of time, A.D. Pron. 15.24, cf. Sch. Il. Oxy. 221i5; temporal, i.e. quantitative, παράγγελμα A.D. Pron. 58.22; of the temporal augment, χ. αὐξήσεις Eust. 72.45. Adv. -κῶς in respect of time, διαφέρειν A.D. Synt. 209.23.
become chronic, οἷσι ἂν χρονιωθῇ Hp. Art. 50.

definition: χρόνιος, α, ον, also ος, ον E. Ion 470 (lyr.), Andr. 84, Th. 6.31:—

children.definition: after a long time, late, ἐλθὼν χρόνιος Od. 17.112; χρονία μὲν ἥκεις Cratin. 222, cf. Ar. Th. 912; χ. φανείς S. Ph. 1446 (anap.); χρόνιος (v.l. χρόνιον) εἰσιδὼν φίλον E. Or. 475; τροπαίᾳ χρονίᾳ A. Th. 706 (lyr.); χρόνιοι ξυνιόντες Th. 1.141. Adv. -ίως after a long time, Sammelb. 4314.2 (iii B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: long-delaying, tardy, Δίκα E. Fr. 223 (lyr.); χ. τὰ τῶν θεῶν Id. Ion 1615 (troch.).

for a long time, a long while, χρόνιόν τινα ἐκβεβληκότες, ἤλαυνε, S. Ph. 600, OC 441; μή . . χρόνιοι μέλλετε πράσσειν Id. Ph. 1449 (anap.); χρόνιος ὤν, ἀπών, E. Or. 485, IA 1099; χρόνιός εἴμʼ ἀπʼ ἀνθρώπων βορᾶς Id. Cyc. 249.

long-continued, ἀρετὰ χρονία τελέθει Pi. P. 3.115; ἄπλοιαι A. Ag. 149 (lyr.); χρόνια λέκτρʼ ἔχων having been long married, E. Ph. 14; χ. ἐτῶν ἐνιαυτοί Ar. Ra. 347 (lyr.); στόλος . . χ. ἐσόμενος, χρόνιος στρατεία, Th. 6.31; δεσμὰ χ. Pl. Lg. 855b; of plants, perennial, opp. ἐπέτειος, Thphr. HP 1.1.9.

chronic, νοσήματα Hp. Aph. 2.39, Coac. 203; [ πόνοι] Epicur. Fr. 447; νόσοι D.H. 1.37, Gal. 6.356; ἰσχιάς Dsc. 1.10; [ βῆχες] Paul.Aeg. 3.28 ( Comp.). Adv. -ίως Philum. ap. Orib. 8.45 tit.: Comp. -ιωτέρως Hp. Coac. 197.
χ. ζῴδια, f.l. for Κρονικά, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.133.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -ίως Arist. GC 328a35, Thphr. Sud. 22; neut. pl. χρόνια as Adv., E. Or. 152 (lyr.): Comp. -ώτερον Pi. N. 4.6.—Rare in Prose, and only (as it seems) in signf. I.3 and 5.
long duration, Thphr. HP 9.14.2, Sor. 2.28, Theol.Ar. 23.
Dim. of χρόνος, a short time, LXX 2 Ma. 11.1; dub. cj. for Κρονίσκοι in Gal. Libr.Propr. 12.
tarrying in a place, Plb. 1.56.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: delaying, coming late, D.H. 6.52.

children.label: III
children.definition: a becoming chronic, Sor. 2.84, Orib. Fr. 55.
one must spend time, ἔν τινι Arist. Rh. 1417b30.
tarrying, tardy, δίκης τέλος Orac. ap. Ael. VH 3.43.
compile annals, Tz. H. 12.718.
chronological record, annals, Plb. 5.33.5 (pl.); αἱ χ. καὶ ἡ Ἀτθίς Anon.Argentinensis p.77 Keil.

children.label: II
children.definition: χρονοκρατορίαι, Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 278.24, Paul.Al. S. 1.

children.label: III
children.definition: method of reckoning, Ptol. Phas. p.10H.
chronicler, annalist, Str. 1.2.9 (pl.), Luc. Alex. 6 (v.l. χορογράφος), Agath. 4.30.
to be dominant for a specified period, Vett.Val. 186.4; also χρονοκρᾰτ-ορέω, ib. 276.10: hence χρονοκρᾰτ-ορία, ἡ, ib. 165.11.
heavenly body dominant for a specified period, Ptol. Tetr. 209.
instrument for measuring time, Procl. Hyp. 4.71 (pl.); ἐξ ὑδρολογίου -ου ib. 79.

time, Hom. (v. infr.), etc.: dist. fr. καιρός, D. 59.35, cf. Ammon. Diff. p.79 V.; τῶν δὲ πεπραγμένων ἀποίητον οὐδʼ ἂν χ. δύναιτο θέμεν τέλος Pi. O. 2.17; μυρίος χ. Id. I. 5(4).28, S. OC 618; μακρὸς κἀναρίθμητος χ. Id. Aj. 646; ὁ πᾶς χ. Pi. P. 1.46, cf. A. Eu. 484; πρόπας χ. ib. 898; ἐς τὸ πᾶν χρόνου ib. 670; but in Prose, τοῦ χ. τὸν πλεῖστον Th. 1.30, cf. Isoc. 9.41; τὸν πρῶτον τοῦ χ. X. Lac. 1.5; τὸν διʼ αἰῶνος χ. A. Ag. 554; χρόνου πολλοῦ δέονται take a long time, X. Smp. 2.4, etc.; δότε τι τῷ χ. Antipho 5.86.

data.quote: τῶν δὲ πεπραγμένων ἀποίητον οὐδʼ ἂν χ. δύναιτο θέμεν τέλος

children.label: b
children.definition: time in the abstract, ἀμερὴς χ. Timo 76; τριμερής S.E. M. 10.197, cf. Plu. Symp. 2.153b; defined by Zeno Stoic. 1.26, Apollod. ib. 3.260.

a definite time, period, δεκέτης, τρίμηνος, S. Ph. 715 (lyr.), Tr. 164; χ. βίου, ἥβης χ., E. Alc. 670, El. 20; πολὺν ἀριθμὸν χρόνου γεγονότες Aeschin. 1.49: pl., of points or periods of time, τοῖς χ. ἀκριβῶς with chronological accuracy, Th. 1.97; τοῖς χ. by the dates, Isoc. 11.36; μετενεγκόντα τοὺς χ. altering the dates, D. 18.225; μακρῶν καὶ πολλῶν χρόνων Pl. Lg. 798b; τεσσαράκοντα χρόνους ἐνιαυτῶν IG 5(1).728.7 ( Sparta), cf. 14.1747.3 ( Rome); χρόνων μῆκος (dub., leg. χρόνου) Chor. 35.51 p.403 F.-R.

children.label: b
children.definition: date, term of payment due, Leg.Gort. 1.10, al.

children.label: c
children.definition: year, Ἑλληνικά 1.233 ( Rhamnus, i B. C.), PLond. 2.417.14 (iv A. D.), App.Anth. 6.154.1 (leg. εἷς ἔτι), Ps.- Ptol. Centil. 24, cf. EM 254.13.

children.label: d
children.definition: equatorial degree, Ptol. Tetr. 44, Paul.Al. A. 2, al., Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(1).240.

children.label: a
children.definition: χρόνον for a while, for a long or short time, Od. 4.599, 6.295, Hdt. 1.175, 7.223, etc.; πολὺν χρόνον for a long time, Od. 11.161; δηρὸν χ. Il. 14.206; οὐκ ὀλίγον χ. 19.157; τοῦτον τὸν χ. Hdt. 1.75; ἐς τὸν αἰὲν χ. for ever, E. Or. 207 (lyr.); οὐ πολὺς χ. ἐξ οὗ . . Pl. R. 452c; παλαιὸς ἀφʼ οὗ χρόνος S. Aj. 600 (lyr.); ἦν χρόνος ἐν ᾧ . . , or ὅτε . . , Linus ap. D.L. Prooem. 4, Critias 25.1 D.; ἕνα χ. once for all, Il. 15.511.

children.label: b
children.definition: χρόνου περιιόντος as time came round, Hdt. 4.155; so χ. ἐπιγενομένου, διεξελθόντος, προβαίνοντος, Id. 1.28, 2.52, 3.53; χρόνου γενομένου after a time, D.S. 20.109; ὀλίγου χρόνου in a short time, Hdt. 3.134; πολλοῦ . . οὐχ ἑόρακά πω χρόνου Ar. Pl. 98; οὐ μακροῦ χ., τοῦ λοιποῦ χ., S. El. 478 (lyr.), 817; βαιοῦ κοὐχὶ μυρίου χ. Id. OC 397; ποίου χρόνου; A. Ag. 278; πόσου χ.; after how long? Ar. Ach. 83.

children.label: c
children.definition: χρόνῳ in process of time, Xenoph. 18, Hdt. 1.80, 176, al.: freq. in Trag., as A. Ag. 126, 463, Ch. 650 (all lyr.); also χρόνῳ κοτέ Hdt. 9.62; τῷ χ. ποτέ Ar. Nu. 865; χρόνῳ, χρόνοις ὕστερον, long after, Th. 1.8, Lys. 3.39; οὐ χρόνῳ immediately, Ps.Democr.Alch.p.49B.: also c. Art., τῷ χ. Ar. Nu. 66, 1242.

children.label: d
children.definition: ὁ ἄλλος χ., in Att., of past time, D. 20.16, ὁ λοιπὸς χ., of future, v. λοιπός 3; so χ. ἐφέρπων, ἐπαντέλλων, μέλλων, Pi. O. 6.97, 8.28, 10(11).7; also κατὰ χ. ἱκνούμενον or κατὰ χ. <τὸν> ἱ. at a later (or the fitting) time, Ant.Lib. 27.4 (cf. ἱκνέομαι III.2).
ἀνὰ χρόνον in course of time, after a time, Hdt. 1.173, 2.151, 5.27, al.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀφʼ οὗ χρόνου from such time as . . , X. Cyr. 1.2.13.

children.label: c
children.definition: διὰ χρόνου after a time, after an interval, S. Ph. 758, Ar. Lys. 904, Pl. 1055, Th. 2.94; διὰ χρόνου πολλοῦ Hdt. 3.27; διὰ π. χ. Ar. V. 1476; διὰ μακρῶν χρόνων Pl. Ti. 22d: but χρόνος . . διὰ χρόνου προὔβαινέ μοι means one space of time after another, day after day, S. Ph. 285.

children.label: d
children.definition: ἐκ πολλοῦ τευ χ. a long time since, long ago, Hdt. 2.58.

children.label: e
children.definition: ἐν χρόνῳ, like χρόνῳ, in course of time, at length, A. Eu. 1000 (lyr.); for a long time, Pl. Phdr. 278d; ἐν πολλῷ χρόνῳ ib. 228a; ἐν χρόνοισι perh. formerly, [ Emp.] Sphaer. 108 (leg. Κάρπιμος).

children.label: f
children.definition: ἐντὸς χρόνου within a certain time, Hdt. 8.104.

children.label: g
children.definition: ἐπὶ χρόνον for a time, for a while, Il. 2.299, Od. 14.193, Hdt. 1.116; πολλὸν ἐπὶ χ. Od. 12.407; χρόνον ἐπὶ μακρόν Hdt. 1.81; παυρίδιον or παῦρον ἐπὶ χ., Hes. Op. 133, 326.

children.label: h
children.definition: ἐς χρόνον hereafter, Hdt. 3.72, 9.89.

children.label: i
children.definition: μετὰ χρόνον after a time, Id. 2.52, etc.; μέχρι τοῦ αὐτοῦ χ. up to the same time, Th. 1.13.

children.label: k
children.definition: πρὸ τοῦ καθήκοντος χ. Aeschin. 3.126; so τοῦ χρόνου πρόσθεν S. Ant. 461.

children.label: l
children.definition: σὺν (ξὺν) χρόνῳ, like χρόνῳ or διὰ χρόνου, A. Ag. 1378, Eu. 555 (lyr.).

children.label: m
children.definition: ὑπὸ χρόνου by lapse of time, Th. 1.21: but ὑπὸ αὐτὸν τὸν χ. about the same time, Hdt. 7.165, cf. Th. 1.100 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: lifetime, age, ὁ μακρὸς ἀνθρώπων χρόνος S. Ph. 306; χρόνῳ παλαιοί Id. OC 112; χρόνῳ μείων ib. 374; τοσόσδε τῷ χ. so far gone in years, Pl. Ax. 365b; χρόνῳ βραδύς S. OC 875.

children.label: III
children.definition: season or portion of the year, περιγράψαι τοῦ ἔτους χρόνον X. Mem. 1.4.12.

children.label: IV
children.definition: delay, οὐδʼ ἐποίησαν (fort. ἐνεποίησαν) χ. οὐδένα D. 19.163; χρόνον δʼ αἱ νύκτες ἔχοντι linger, Theoc. 21.25; χρόνους ἐμποιεῖν to interpose delays, D. 23.93.
tense of a verb, D.H. Th. 24, A.D. Adv. 123.17, D.T. 638.3.
time or quantity of a syllable, Longin. 39.4, A.D. Synt. 130.4, al.: βραχὺς χ. a short syllable, ib. 309.23; of the augment, ib. 237.10.

time, διαιρεῖται ὁ χ. ὑπὸ τῶν ῥυθμιζομένων Aristox. Rhyth. p.79 W., etc.; ὁ πρῶτος [χ.] time-unit, ibid., Aristid.Quint. 1.14, etc.; χρόνος κενός ib. 18: freq. in pl., λέξις εἰς χρόνους τεθεῖσα διαφέροντας Aristox. Rhyth. p.77 W., cf. Anon.Rhythm. Oxy. 9ii6; [ μέτρα] προχωρεῖ ἕως λ χρόνων Aristid.Quint. 1.23.

data.quote: διαιρεῖται ὁ χ. ὑπὸ τῶν ῥυθμιζομένων

children.definition: waste time, loiter, Arist. Rh. 1406a37, Leonid. ap. Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.225b, Act.Ap. 20.16, Men.Prot. p.21 D.:— Med., UPZ 39.29 (ii B. C.).
χ. τὸν πόλεμον protract the war, Plu. Cat.Mi. 53, Eun. Hist. p.242 D.
Hsch.
make temporal, [ ἡ ψυχὴ] ἑαυτὴν ἐχρόνωσε Plot. 3.7.11.

definition: χροτιή, ἡ, late poet. form for χρώς, AP 15.35 ( Theoph.).
χρούστη, ἡ, = Lat. crusta, Ann.Epigr. 1905 No. 172 ( Thessalonica).

children.definition: golden eagle, Ael. NA 2.39.
with golden aegis, epith. of Athena, B. Fr. 11, cf. IG 12(5).611 ( Ceos). (Oxyt. in codd., but proparox. acc. to the rule given in EM 518.54.)
adorn with gold, Hsch. ( Pass.).

definition: χρυσαϊκόν, τό, name of a coin, dub. l. in Inscr.Délos 1442 B 51 (ii B. C.).

children.definition: with golden rays or beams, Hdn.Gr. 1.18; in EM 518.39, -άκτις.

definition: χρυσαλάκατος, ον, Dor. for χρυσηλ- (q. v.).

children.definition: chrysalis, Arist. HA 551a19, GA 758b31, Thphr. HP 2.4.4, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: cockchafer, Eust. 1329.29.
golden sand, Olymp.Alch. p.98 B.; = balluca, Gloss.

definition: χρυσαμοιβός, ὁ, expld. by Hsch. as

children.definition: ὁ χ. Ἄρης σωμάτων he who traffics in menʼs bodies, or who ransoms the dead by gold, A. Ag. 437 (lyr.).

with fillet or frontlet of gold, epith. of horses, Il. 5.358, 363, al. (never in Od.); Ὧραι h.Hom. 6.5, 12; Μοῦσαι Hes. Th. 916, cf. Pi. P. 3.89; Λάχεσις Id. O. 7.64; Οὐρανία B. 5.13; also χ. χαλινός Pi. O. 13.65.

definition: χρυσανθεμίς, ίδος, ἡ, = sq. 4, Ps.- Dsc. 4.58.

children.definition: Dsc. 4.57 (also χρυσάνθεμος, ἡ, Cyran. 44, Gloss.).
garden ranunculus, Ranunculus asiaticus, Gp. 2.6.30.
with flower of gold, ἔρνος Trag.Adesp. in Gött.Nachr. 1922 p.27; κρόκος AP 12.256 ( Mel.).

children.label: II
children.definition: χρυσανθές, τό, = ἑλίχρυσον, Nic. Fr. 74.69.
yellow dye, PHolm. 22.2.

definition: χρυσάνθινα, τά, games celebrated at Sardis, IG 2(2).3169.23 (iii A. D.).

children.definition: ‘gold-man’, symbol in Alchemy, Zos.Alch. p.207B.; cf. μολυβδάνθρωπος.
reflecting golden light, πέταλα E. Ion 890 (lyr.).
gold-coloured, γαυνάκης Stud.Pal. 20.67.12 (ii/iii A. D.): Lat. crissantinum, = phlomi flores, Gloss.

with sword of gold, epith. of Apollo, Il. 5.509, 15.256, Pi. P. 5.104; also of Demeter, h.Cer. 4; of Artemis, Orac. ap. Hdt. 8.77; of Orpheus, Pi. Fr. 139.9; so χρυσᾱορεύς, έως, of Zeus at Stratonicea, Str. 14.2.25, cf. OGI 234.24 ( Delph., iii B. C.); also χρυσᾱόριος, CIG 2720,2721 ( Stratonicea): hence χρῡσᾱορεῖς, οἱ, of a league formed by his worshippers, τὸ χρυσαορέων ἔθνος OGI l.c. 12, cf. 111.8 ( Egypt, ii B. C.); called τὸ χρυσαορικὸν σύστημα, Str. l.c.; cf. St.Byz. s.v. χρῡσᾱορίς.
pecunia auri, Gloss.
alloy of gold and silver, Maria ap. Zos.Alch. p.169B.
tribute of gold and silver, Zos. 2.38, PLips. 64.30 (iv. A.D.).
with or in car of gold, Ἀθάνα B. 12.194; Μήνα Pi. O. 3.19; also of heroes, Id. P. 5.9, I. 6(5).19.

children.label: II
children.definition: οἱ χ., of a body of the Macedonian royal guard, Poll. 1.175.
with shield of gold, Ἄρης B. 19.11; Θήβα Pi. I. 1.1; Παλλάς E. Ph. 1372; οἱ χ., a corps in the Macedonian army, Poll. 1.175.
golden goblet with bottom shaped like a knuckle-bone, Sapph. 170 (pl.).
golden Attic wine, Edict.Diocl. 2.14, Alex.Trall. 1.17, al.; -κόν, τό, Paul.Aeg. 3.50.
golden lustre, Eust. 695.4.
shine like gold, LXX Jb. 37.22.

gold-gleaming, κρόκος S. OC 685 (lyr.); δόμος Ar. Av. 1710, cf. Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.82; τὸ τῆς δειρῆς χ., of a peacock, Lib. Descr. 24.6: metaph., φρόνησις Ph. 1.57: neut. as Adv., χρυσαυγὲς μειδιᾶν Him. Or. 13.7.
Lib. Descr. 30.13.

definition: χρυσάφιον [ᾱ], τό, Dim. of χρυσός, Hdn.Gr. 1.368, Eust. 492.36.

children.definition: a kind of fish, perh. gilt head, Marc.Sid. 12.
with spear of gold, Orph. H. 52.11 codd. ( θυρσεγχής Herm.).
gold-mine, Plb. 34.10.10: pl. χρυσεῖα gold-mines, X. HG 4.8.37, Plb. 3.57.3, etc.: gen. pl. written χρυσέων, PSI 6.601.10 (iii B. C.).

definition: χρύσειος [ῡ], η, ον, Ep. for χρύσεος (q. v.).

children.definition: one who picks gold-dust from river-sand, gold-washer, Lat. aurilegulus, Gloss.
of gold, ivory, and electrum, overlaid therewith, ἀσπίς Epigr. ap. Plu. Tim. 31.
of gold and ivory, overlaid therewith, Philoch. 97, Sch. Ar. Eq. 1166.
with beak of gold, of a ship, App. Praef. 10.
inlaid with gold, BGU 781 iv 1 (i A. D.).
gold-inlaid, σπάθη Philem. 70; cf. Mart. 2.43, 6.94.

children.label: II
children.definition: set in gold, σφραγίς IG ΙΙ(2) 161 B 49, 203 B 67 ( Delos, iii B. C.); σμάραγδος Plu. Luc. 3.
with golden tresses, Διὸς ἔρνος E. Ph. 191 (lyr.), Philox. 8.
built or formed of gold, A. Ch. 617 (lyr., but Herm. χρυσεοκμήτοισι, gold-wrought).
gold-pronged, τρίαινα Lyr. in Mitteil. aus d. Papyrussamml. d. Nationalbibliothek in Wien 1(1932).138.
Paul.Sil. Ambo 159.
Simon. 26B, Pae.Delph. 3.
with disk of gold, φέγγος, of the sun, E. Ph. 176 (lyr.).
E. El. 724 (lyr.), Hyps.Fr. 3(1)ii 22 (lyr.), cf. Orph. A. 1018.
AP 9.524.23:— fem. χρῡσεο-μίτρα, Melinno ap. Stob. 3.7.12.
E. Fr. 159 (lyr.).
h.Mart. 1, Call. Lav.Pall. 43.
with woof of gold, gold-inwoven, φάρεα E. Or. 840 (lyr.); χ. γραφίς a line or thread of gold inwrought, AP 5.275.2 ( Agath.).
inwoven with gold, ταινίαι B. 16.106.
flowing with gold, ὄλβος Supp.Epigr. 7.14.23 ( Susa, Hymn to Apollo, i A. D.).

definition: χρύσεος, η, ον, also ος, ον in AP 5.30 ( Antip.Thess.), Att. contr. χρυσοῦς, ῆ, οῦν IG 1(2).358.4, etc.; Ep. χρύσειος, η, ον: Hom. and Hes. use both χρύσεος and -ειος, χρυσῇ is dub. in Il. 5.425; Lyr. used χρύσεος, α, ον, and this form sts. occurs in Trag. dialogue and even in Prose, as X. Ages. 5.5 codd., Plu. Luc. 37, Apollod. 2.5.10, Ant.Lib. 36.1; Aeol. χρύσιος Sapph. 1.8, al. (but χρύσεα Theoc. 29.37); Boeot. χρούσιος SIG 337.8 (iv B. C.): ( χρυσός):—

children.definition: golden, freq. in Ep., esp. of what belonged to gods, χρυσέῳ ἐν δαπέδῳ, χρυσέοις δεπάεσσι, χρύσειον ἐπὶ θρόνον, etc., Il. 4.2, 3, 8.442, al.; χ. τάλαντα the golden scales of Zeus, 22.209; χ. ἰτύς, ζυγόν, of Heraʼs chariot, 5.724, 730; ἱμάσθλη χ., of Zeus and Poseidon, 8.44 = 13.26; ζώνη χ., of Calypso and Circe, Od. 5.232 = 10.545, etc.; δόμος Sapph. l.c.; of possessions of mortals, Il. 4.133, 5.425, al.: sts. enriched or adorned with gold, χ. σκῆπτρον 1.15, cf. 246; μάχαιρα 18.598; θύραι Od. 7.88; κλῖναι, κρητῆρες, Hdt. 9.82, 80; ἕστηκε . . Ἀλέξανδρος ὁ χ., of a statue, Id. 8.121; χρυσοῦς στάθητι Luc. Pseudol. 15.
χρύσεια μέταλλα gold-mines, Th. 4.105 (the only instance of χρύσειος in Att., cf. χρυσεῖον).

χρυσοῦς (sc. στατήρ), ὁ, a gold coin, = στατήρ, IG 7.303.98, al. ( Oropus, iii B. C.), IPE 12.32 A13 ( Olbia, iii B. C.), LXX Ge. 24.22, Plu. Per. 25 (in Pap., not a coin, but the equivalent of 20 silver drachmae, PCair.Zen. 28.11 (iii B. C.), etc.); χρυσοῖ ἐπίσημοι Plb. 4.56.3, cf. Poll. 9.53, 59, Hsch.
χρύσεον, τό, gold plaque, SIG 1122.7 (Selinus, V B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: gold-coloured, golden-yellow, ἔθειραι Il. 8.42, 13.24; χ. νέφη ib. 523, etc.; ἀέρος κόμαι Pi. Pae. 6.137; τῶν τὰ χρυσᾶ the yolks of eggs, Ath. 9.376d.

children.label: III
children.definition: golden, χρυσέη Ἀφροδίτη Il. 3.64, Od. 8.337; Μοῖσα Pi. I. 8(7).5; σθένος ἀελίου χ. Id. P. 4.144; ὦ χ. θύγατερ Διός S. OT 188 (lyr.); Ἐλπίς ib. 158 (lyr.); τιμή Id. Ant. 699; ὦ χρυσοῖ θεοί Ar. Ra. 483; χ. ὑγίεια Pi. P. 3.73; λογισμοῦ ἀγωγή Pl. Lg. 645a; ἦθος Antiph. 212.5; τὸ χ. ὀρνίθων γένος Id. 175; χ. γένος ἀνθρώπων, of the Golden Age, Hes. Op. 109, cf. Pl. R. 468e, Phdr. 235e, Cra. 397e.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἐγὼ δὲ ὁ χ. but I, fine fellow that I am . . , Luc. Laps. 1; Πλάτωνα χρυσοῦν (sc. Ἐπίκουρος ἐκάλει) D.L. 10.8, cf. Menodot. ap. Gal. Subf.Emp. 63.

wealthy, Palaeph. 31.4 (s. v. l.). [ χρῡσέη, χρῡσέην, χρῡσέου, χρῡσέῳ, etc., in Hom. must be pronounced as disyll., as is fully proved by such passages as Il. 1.15, 374: but Lyric Poets sts. used ῠ in χρύσεος, Pi. P. 3.73, 4.4, 144, al., B. 9.6, 15.2; so also Trag., but only in Lyr., not in Iambics or Anapaestics, S. OT 157, 188, Ant. 103, E. Med. 632, 978, IA 1051, IT 1253, Tr. 856, Ba. 372, Heracl. 916, HF 351, 396, El. 192; sts. also Epigrammatists, AP 6.292.2 ( Hedyl.), 7.233.1 ( Apollonid.), 13.18.4 ( Parmeno), APl. 16.96.8.]

definition: χρυσεοσάμβαλος, ον, v.l. for sq. in cod. H (Jerusalem palimpsest) of E. Or. 1468 (lyr.), cf. Hermes 64.424.

children.definition: with sandals of gold, ἴχνος χ. the step of golden sandals, E. l.c., IA 1042 (lyr.).
with golden sceptre, epith. of Zeus, B. 8.100.

definition: χρυσεοστέφανος, ον, f.l. for χρυσοστέφανος (q. v.).

children.definition: decked with gold, δόμοι A. Pers. 159 (troch.).
= foreg., πέπλων χ. φάρος E. HF 414 (lyr.).
with golden feet or wings, αὖραι Orph. A. 340.
with golden lustre, Orph. Fr. 236.4.
made of or with gold, ἱμάτιον Tz. H. 3.980.
making or producing gold, Lyc. 1352.
goldsmithʼs art, Eustr. in EN 296.10.
gold-melter, Lat. auricoctor, Gloss.
of golden eloquence, Epigr. ap. Geel Catal.Mss.Lugd.Bat. p.18 No.54.

with distaff of gold, not (as Sch.) with arrow of gold, epith. of Artemis in Il. 20.70, al., cf. B. 10.38, S. Tr. 637 (lyr.); of Amphitrite, the Nereids, and Leto, Pi. O. 6.104, N. 5.36, 6.36; of the Χάριτες, B. 8.1.
of beaten gold, A. Th. 644, S. OT 1268, E. Ph. 62, Ar. Pl. 9, Plu. Demetr. 53; ἄνδρες Luc. Sat. 8; Παρία πέτρα E. ap. Satyr. Vit.Eur.Oxy. 1176 Fr. 38ii24.
gold-electrum, gold-amber, Plin. HN 37.127, Aët. 2.35.
with reins of gold, epith. of Ares, Od. 8.285; of Artemis, Il. 6.205; of Demeter, Pi. Fr. 37; Dor. χρυσάνιος [ᾱ], of Aphrodite, S. OC 693 (lyr.).
furnished or decked with gold, golden, οἶκοι E. Ion 157 (lyr.); Ἄρκτος στρέφουσʼ οὐραῖα χρυσήρη πόλῳ ib. 1154; ναῶν θριγκοί Id. IT 129 (lyr.).
priced in gold coin, δείξεις D.L. 4.38.
Dim. of χρυσίον, a small piece of gold, used in contempt, ἀργυρίδιον καὶ χ. τὸν πλοῦτον ἀποκαλοῦντες Isoc. 13.4, cf. D. 27.15; a small sum of money, Plu. Cleom. 38.
Dim. of χρυσίς I, IG 1(2).369.10 (pl.).
to be golden or like gold, Dsc. 1.15, Crito ap. Gal. 12.446, Ps.-Callisth. 3.21, Hdn. 5.6.8, Ath. 7.322a; τὸ χρυσίζον τοῦ ᾠοῦ the yolk, Gp. 14.7.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: abound in gold, Arist. Mir. 833b8.
made in cash: χρυσικά, τά, cash payments, POxy. 136.13 (vi A. D.); χ. στέφανοι PTeb. 60.102 (ii B. C.), al.

children.label: II
children.definition: μέταλλα Eupolem. ap. Alex.Polyh. Fr. 18M.
χρύσεος, λυχνεῖα χ. Cumont Fouilles de Doura-Europos 372 No.13: as Subst., χρύσινος, ὁ, = χρυσοῦς I.3, Alciphr. 3.3, al., IG 7.26 ( Megara, v/vi A. D.), Lyd. Mag. 3.27, al., Olymp.Hist. p. 462 D.
Dim. of χρυσός, a piece of gold, generally, gold, Hdt. 3.95, 97, Pl. Euthd. 288e, R. 336e, al.
anything made of gold, gold plate, ornaments of gold, etc., ἄσημον Th. 2.13: pl., D. 27.10, 48.55, Men. Sam. 167, 1 Ep.Pet. 3.3, Plu. Tim. 15.

gold coin, money, E. Cyc. 161; οὔτʼ ἀργύριον οὔτε χρυσίον Ar. Eq. 472, cf. Pl. 808, Ra. 720 (troch.), etc.; χ. Ἀττικόν IG 2(2).1687.16; λῆρος πάντα πρὸς τὸ χ. Antiph. 232.1; ἐγὼ δʼ ὑπέλαβον χρησίμους εἶναι θεοὺς τἀργύριον καὶ τὸ χ. Men. 537.4 : but στατῆρας χρυσίου Eup. 112; χρυσία pieces of gold, Pl. R. 336e.

data.quote: ἐγὼ δʼ ὑπέλαβον χρησίμους εἶναι θεοὺς τἀργύριον καὶ τὸ χ.

children.definition: gold thread, Hp. Art. 32.

children.label: II
children.definition: my little treasure! Ar. Lys. 930, cf. Ap 11.232 (Callias Arg.).
Hsch.

definition: χρυσιοπλύσιον, τό, f.l. for χρυσοπλύσιον (q. v.).

children.definition: of, belonging to Chrysippus, διαλεκτική D.L. 7.180; τὰ X. his writings, Arr. Epict. 2.16.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: Chrysippius, a plant named from its discoverer, Plin. HN 26.93.
a vessel of gold, piece of gold plate, Hermipp. 37 (troch.), Pherecr. 128, Ar. Ach. 74, Pax 425, IG 1(2).268.111, al.; χρυσίδων βότρυες Lib. Ep. 22.3; an Att. word, Ath. 11.502a.

children.label: II
children.definition: gold-broidered dress, Luc. Nigr. 11: pl., gold-embroidered shoes, Id. D Deor. 6[2].2.

definition: χρυσίτης [ῑ], ου, ὁ, mostly in fem. χρυσῖτις, ιδος,

children.definition: like gold, containing gold, ψάμμος χρυσῖτις Hdt. 3.102, Str. 3.2.8; λίθος IG 2(2).1424 a.254; χ. σποδός a yellow powder used for the eyes, Hp. Mul. 1.103; χ. γῆ Gal. 12.184; χρυσῖτις alone, a form of λιθάργυρος, Dsc. 5.87.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἡ χ. gold-dust or ore, Plu. Cupid. 2.526b.
touchstone, lapis Lydius, Poll. 7.102.
gold-embroidered, Plu. Demetr. 41; χ. ἄνακτες Simm. 25.

definition: χρυσοβέλεμνος, ον, with shafts, arrows of gold, AP 9.623 ( Cyrus), Orac. ap. Lyd. Mens. 3.10. -->

children.definition: beryl with a tinge of gold colour, Plin. HN 37.76.
golden-tressed, Olymp.Alch. p.95B.
with soil of gold, i.e. containing gold, γῆς λέπας E. Rh. 921.
with soil of gold: τὸ χρυσόγεων the land of gold-ore, Philostr. VA 6.1:— χρῡσόγειος, ον, Suid.
Hsch., Suid.
golden-tongued, Tz. H. 10.234.
black turnip, Bongardia Chrysogonum, Dsc. 4.56.

born or begotten of gold, γενεά, i.e. the Persians, because (by the legend) they were descended from Perseus, who was begotten of Zeus in the form of a shower of gold, A. Pers. 79 (lyr., Sch., -νόμου cod.M); of Perseus, Orph. L. 551.
gold-embroidered, ἐμβάδες Callix. 2.
a writing with letters of gold. Aristeas 176, PMag.Leid.X. 34B.
decked with rich work of gold, Ar. Ec. 972 (lyr.), E. IA 219 (lyr.).
with ring of gold, ἀνήρ Ep.Jac. 2.2.
set in a gold ring, Hsch.
receiver of gold, Epic. in BKT 5(1)p. 120 (vi A. D.).

definition: χρυσόδετος, ον, also α, ον Alc. 33: ( δέω(A)):—

children.definition: bound with gold, set in gold, σφρηγίς Hdt. 3.41.

overlaid or enriched with gold, ἐλεφαντίναν λάβαν τῷ ξίφεος χρυσοδέταν Alc. l.c.; χ. κέρας, of a lyre, S. Fr. 244 (lyr.); χ. ἕρκεσι γυναικῶν, of the golden necklace with which Eriphyle was bribed, Id. El. 838 (lyr.); περόναι χ. E. Ph. 805 (lyr.): metaph., χ. σώματος ἀλκήν in golden armour, Id. Rh. 382 (anap.).
with golden eddies, Πακτωλός B. 3.44.
with golden hair, Archil. 121; voc. χρυσοέθειρε IG 12(5).893.3 (Tenos, restored); fem. -έθειρᾰ in Max. 95.
like gold, γῆ Pl. Phd. 110c; χρῶμα X. Cyr. 7.1.2, cf. Thphr. HP 6.3.5; μέλι Arist. HA 627a2; κόμη Plu. Amat. 2.771b; of a kind of jaundice, Hp. ap. Herod.Med(?). in Rh.Mus. 49.554.
with robe of gold, ἄγαλμα IG 4.558.14 ( Argos, ii B. C.), cf. Eust. 693.48.
twined with gold, Paul.Sil. Ambo 255.
with yoke of gold, h.Hom. 31.15, X. Cyr. 8.3.12.

definition: χρυσοζύμιον [ζῡ], or χρῡσο-ζώμιον, τό, in Alchemy,

children.definition: ferment of gold, Zos.Alch. pp. 160B. ( -ζύμ-), 247B. ( -ζώμ-).
with girdle of gold, Hes. Fr. 278.4.
with nails or studs of gold, Eust. 95.6.
golden-veined, λᾶε Orph. L. 292.
with throne of gold, epith. of Hera, Artemis and Eos, Il. 1.611, al.; of Cyrene, Pi. P. 4.260; of Isis, Hymn.Is. 7:—poet. word (v. Ar. Av. 950 (lyr.)), used by Jul. Caes. 307d.
with breastplate of gold, Iamb. post Polem.p.49 Hinck, Tz. H. 1.993.
chafer (cf. χρυσομηλολόνθιον), Sch. Ar. Nu. 761; -κάνθαροι, = Lat. bulli (dub. sens.), Gloss.; also χρῡσο-κανθαρίς, Jo.Sic. in AB 1432.
crisocantes (or -is), expld. as peristola or periscola, Gloss.
with head of gold, E. HF 375 (lyr.).
with golden fruit: as Subst., ivy, = κισσός, Ps.- Dsc. 2.179, Plin. HN 16.147.
travelling on a golden path, PMag.Berol. 2.91.

definition: χρυσόκερως, ωτος, ὁ, ἡ, and -ως, -ων, gen. -ω (also Dor. acc. in SIG 398.24 ( Cos, iii B. C.)):—

children.definition: with horns of gold, ἔλαφος Pi. O. 3.29, E. Hel. 382 (lyr., Elmsl. χρυσοκέρατα); as epith. of Pan, Cratin. 321 (lyr.); of the moon, AP 5.15 ( Marc.Arg.).

children.label: II
children.definition: with gilded horns, like a victim ready to be sacrificed, τρίττοιαν βόαρχον -κερων IG 1(2).76.37, cf. Aeschin. 3.164, Pl. Alc. 2.149c, SIG l.c., Porph. Abst. 2.15.
with golden head, epith. of a fish, Phryn.Com. 50.
with golden lyre, prob. in Tim. Pers. 215 ( χρυσεο- Pap.), cf. Hsch. s.v. χρυσάωρ; also χρῡσο-κίθᾰρος, Suid. s.v. χρυσάορον.
of a pale golden hue, Porph. in Ptol. 199.
washed with gold, i.e. gilded, θηρικλείων -κλύστων ζεῦγος Ister 38; φιάλη IG ΙΙ(2).161 B 13 ( Delos, iii B. C.); ποτήριον Phleg. Fr. 36.1 J., cf. Nicom.Com. 4 ( -κλαῦστα (sic) codd. Ath.).
gold shell, i.e. rolled gold, Ps.-Democr. p.44B.
with golden seeds or grains, Ps.- Apul. Herb. 130.
gold-solder, malachite, basic copper carbonate, Arist. Mir. 834b20, Thphr. Lap. 26.40, Dsc. 5.74,89, Plin. HN 33.86.

children.label: II
children.definition: a dish of linseed and honey, Alcm. 74B.
soldered or inlaid with gold, ἐκπώματα S. Fr. 378; κώπη E. Fr. 587; also χρῡσο-κόλλητος δίφρος Id. Ph. 2, cf. Antiph. 106.2, 237, Luc. Ind. 29; ἅρματα Jul. Or. 2.50d; cf. χρυσοδακτύλιος.
have golden hair, Philostr. Ep. 55.
immortelle, Helichrysum orientale, Dsc. 4.55, Plin. HN 21.50, 148.

definition: χρυσοκόμης, ου, Dor. χρῡσο-κόμας, α, ὁ,

children.definition: golden-haired, epith. of Dionysus, Hes. Th. 947; of Eros, Anacr. 14, E. IA 548 (lyr.); of Apollo, Tyrt. 3.4, B. 4.2, E. Supp. 975 (lyr.), Ar. Av. 217 (anap.); ὁ X., abs. for Apollo, Pi. O. 6.41, 7.32, E. Tr. 254 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: with golden ornaments in the hair, Luc. Gall. 13.
golden-haired, AP 6.264 ( Mnasalc.); of the plumage of birds, χ. πτέρα Hdt. 2.73.
‘gold-coral’, name of several metals, Ps.-Democr. p.44B.
with golden clusters, κισσός Dsc. Eup. 1.69.
decorator with gold, Vett.Val.3.24, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).136 (v. l.).
tinkling with gold, σπατάλη cj. in AP 5.270 ( Maced.).
with haft of gold, ἐγχειρίδιον Men. 20.
glow-worm, Phryn. PS p.126B.

children.label: II
children.definition: Plin. HN 37.156.
gold thread, gold wire, Paul.Aeg. 6.92.
decked with gold ear-rings, οὔατα, as Pors. in Epigr. ap. Ath. 8.343f ( Juba), for χρυσοβόλοις.
speak of gold, Luc. Gall. 6.
gathering gold, Gloss.
with spear of gold, Παλλάς E. Ion 9, cf. Ar. Th. 318 (lyr.).

definition: χρύσολον, τό, dub. sens. in Zos.Alch. p.247 B. (s. v. l.).

children.definition: with golden scales, gloss. on sq., Hsch.
with golden crest, B. Scol. Oxy. 2081 (e) Fr. 5.7; δράκοντες Hsch.; fem. χρυσολόφᾱ in Ar. Lys. 344 (lyr.) as epith. of Athena.

definition: χρυσολύρης [λῠ], ου, Dor. χρυσο-λύρας, α, ὁ,

children.definition: with lyre of gold, of Apollo, Pi. Pae. 5.41, Ar. Th. 315 (lyr.), Supp.Epigr. 4.467.20 ( Branchidae, iii A. D.), Orph. H. 34.3 (voc. -λύρη); of Orpheus, Arist. Pepl. 48, AP 7.617.
with golden wool or fleece, κῶας Pherecyd. 105J.; ἀρνὸς τέρας E. Or. 998 (lyr.): metaph., πρόβατον χ., of a rich fool, Diog. ap. D.L. 6.47.
mad after gold, σπατάλη AP 5.301.2 ( Agath.): hence χρυσο-μᾰνέω, Suid.; χρυσο-μᾰνία, ἡ, Tz. H. 3.301 (pl.).

definition: χρυσομηλολόνθιον, τό, Dim. as if from *χρυσομηλολόνθη,

children.definition: a little golden beetle or cockchafer, as a term of endearment, Ar. V. 1341.
Plin. HN 15.37, Alex.Trall. 1.16.
goldfinch, Fringilla carduelis, Arist. HA 592b30.

definition: χρυσομίτρης, ου, Dor. χρυσο-μίτρας, α, ὁ,

children.definition: with girdle or headband of gold, epith. of Dionysus, S. OT 209 (lyr.); pecul. fem. -μίτρη, of Phoebe, Opp. C. 2.2.
gold-bound, πίνακες Hippoloch. ap. Ath. 4.130b.
in the likeness of gold, of Zeus descending to Danaë, S. Fr. [1127.2].
with golden or gilded boss, φιάλη ἀργυρᾶ χ. IG 1(2).313.65, 314.72, 2(2).1544.29, cf. Chron.Lind. B. 48, Poll. 6.98.
gold thread, gold wire, Paul.Aeg. 6.92.

definition: χρυσονήστρια, ἡ, fem. of sq., Lat. aurinetrix, Gloss.

children.definition: spinner of gold thread, Vett.Val. 3.24 (pl.).
feeding in gold, very rich, v.l. for χρυσόγονος (q. v.).
PBaden 54.4 (v A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: -νόμος, ὁ, distributor of gold, χ. τῶν λαμπαδιστῶν SIG 1068.11 ( Patmos, iii/ii B. C.).
with golden back or surface; χ. ἡνία a rein studded with gold, S. Aj. 847.
with sword of gold, gloss on χρυσάορος, Cyr., Lex.Havn. in Schmidt Hsch. s.v. χρυσάορον.
gold-wood, = θάψος, Sch. Ar. V. 1404; = σκυθάριον, Sch. Theoc. 2.88.
built of gold, δώματα IG 4.620.14 ( Argos).
with border or hem of gold, Plu. Demetr. 41.

definition: χρυσόπαστος, ον, also α, ον Alc. Fr. 90 Lobel: ( πάσσω):—

children.definition: shot with gold, κυνία l.c.; χ. τιήρης a turban of gold tissue, Hdt. 8.120; τὰ χ. ἕσθλα (Wilamowitz for ἐσθλά) A. Ag. 776 (lyr.); χ. κόσμος D. 50.34; ταῖς ξυστίσιν ταῖς χ. Eub. 134; μίτρα Duris 14J.; ἐσθής Luc. Ind. 8; opp. χρυσήλατος, Iamb.post Polem. p.50 Hinck.
sprung of a golden father, epith. of Perseus (cf. χρυσόγονος), Lyc. 838: also
gold-sandalled, epith. of Hera, Od. 11.604, Hes. Th. 454; of Eos, Sapph. 18.
with robe of gold, κούρα Anacr. 76; Μναμοσύνα Pi. I. 6(5).75; Ἥρη B. 18.22.
covered with gold plaques, Lat. bracteolatus, χιτών Lyd. Mag. 2.4.
with helm of gold, of Ares, A. Th. 106 (lyr.); χ. στάχυς σπαρτῶν, of the Sparti at Thebes, E. Ph. 939.
brocaded with gold, χιτών Cyr.
with golden arms, Ἀώς B. 5.40.
Gloss.
golden-haired, h.Ap. 205, Tim. Pers. 138.
with golden armour, Tz. H. 10.435.
gold-wash, placer, where gold is washed from the river-sand, Str. 3.2.8 (pl.); wrongly χρυσιοπλ- Id. 5.1.8.
the making of gold, Syn.Alch. p.61B, Zos.Alch. p.220B.
gold-embroidered, Callix. 2.

definition: χρυσοποίκιλτος, ον, = foreg., IG ΙΙ(2).287 B 72 ( Delos, iii B. C.), Inscr.Délos 380.63 (ii B. C.), D.S. 18.26.

children.definition: goldsmith, Luc. Cont. 12.
with fleece of gold, Nonn. D. 10.102.
golden city, of Hierapolis, Epigr.Gr. 1074.

children.label: II
children.definition: Aristaenet. 1.10, Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 7.4.
gold-footed, φορεῖα Plb. 30.25.18; κλίνη Heraclid.Cum. 2.

definition: χρυσοπράσιος [ᾰ] λίθος, ὁ, = sq., PHolm. 11.10; -ίου (perh. neut.) ποίησις ib. 5.

children.definition: chrysoprase, a precious stone of golden-green colour, Apoc. 21.20, cf. Plin. HN 37.113.
looking like gold, Tz. H. 5.389 ( Comp.).
golden-faced, epith. of the sun, PMag.Par. 2.133.
with gilded poop, Plu. Ant. 26, App. Praef. 10.
with gilded prow, ἀκάτιον Philostr. Im. 1.12.
Gloss. ap. Steph. Thes. et Ducange; χ. πάντα ποιεῖ (sc. ὁ ἐτήσιος λίθος) Maria ap. Olymp. Alch.p.93B., cf. Zos.Alch. p.120B.
with wings of gold, of Iris, Il. 8.398, 11.185, h.Cer. 314; Ἔρως Ar. Av. 1738 (lyr.); παῖδες Ἀφροδίτης Aristaenet. 2.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: χρυσόπτερον, τό, a gem similar to χρυσόπρασος, Xenocr. Lap. 90, Plin. HN 37.109.
Cyran. 44.
= foreg., Μοῦσαι Him. Or. 14.37.
dealer in gold, Sch. Ar. Pl. 884.
golden ewer, Hsch.

definition: χρυσόραπις, ὁ, poet. for χρυσόρραπις, Pi. P. 4.178.

children.definition: χρυσορρόης, τμῶλος E. Ba. 154 (lyr.): of Zeus descending in gold, Hedyl. ap. Ath. 8.345a.
with golden roof or ceiling, Philox. 14, Ph. 1.666, Luc. Cyn. 9; also χρῡσ-ώροφος, σκηνή Plu. Alex. fort. 2.329d.
with golden wand, Hdn. Epim. 154 (with single ρ).
a golden branch plucked off, Poet. ap. Hsch.
with wand of gold, epith. of Hermes, Od. 5.87, 10.277, h.Merc. 539; cf. χρυσόραπις.
of golden speech, Cyr.
streaming with gold, Νεῖλος Supp.Epigr. 8.549.17 (Egy pt, Hymn to Isis), Ath. 5.203c; cf. χρυσορόης.
gold-streaming, A. Pr. 805; νάματα Supp.Epigr. 4.467.2 ( Didyma, iii A. D.); cf. χρυσόρυτος.
gold-digger, Gloss.
S. Ant. 950 (lyr.).

gold, τιμῆς Il. 18.475, etc.; coupled with other precious things, e.g. χαλκός, σίδηρος, 6.48; ἐσθής, Od. 5.38; χρυσὸν κέρασιν περιχεύας (of a victim) Il. 10.294 = Od. 3.384, cf. 437; ὡς δʼ ὅτε τις χρυσὸν περιχεύεται ἀργύρῳ 6.232; χ. δαμασίφρων Pi. O. 13.78; κοῖλος ἄργυρος καὶ χ. silver and gold plate, Theopomp.Hist. 283a, cf. Luc. Nav. 20; λευκὸς χ. white gold, i.e. gold alloyed with silver, opp. χ. ἄπεφθος refined gold, Hdt. 1.50; χ. ἑψόμενος Pi. N. 4.82; χρυσὸν καθαίρειν Pl. Plt. 303d; βασανίζειν ἐν πυρί Id. R. 413e.

data.quote: ὡς δʼ ὅτε τις χρυσὸν περιχεύεται ἀργύρῳ

children.definition: gold, to express anything made of gold, e. g. golden armour or raiment, χρυσὸν . . ἔδυνε περὶ χροΐ, of Zeus, Il. 8.43; of Poseidon, 13.25; τὸ ἐμὸν σῶμα μήτε ἐν χ. θῆτε . . X. Cyr. 8.7.25; ἀραρότως σύνδεσμα χρυσὸς (a gold crown) εἶχε E. Med. 1193; ἐν χρυσῷ πίνειν Luc. Merc.Cond. 26.

data.quote: τὸ ἐμὸν σῶμα μήτε ἐν χ. θῆτε . .

children.definition: anything dear or precious, ταῦτα μὲν . . κρείσσονα χρυσοῦ . . φωνεῖς A. Ch. 372 (anap.); ὁ χ. ἧσσον κτῆμα τοῦ κλάειν ἂν ἦν S. Fr. 557; ὡς χρυσὸς αὐτῷ τἀμὰ . . κακὰ δόξει ποτʼ εἶναι E. Tr. 432, cf. D.H. Rh. 9.4; cf. Pi. O. 1.1, 3.42, Plu. Sert. 5: metaph. also, χρυσὸς ἐπῶν golden words, Ar. Pl. 268; χρυσῷ πάττειν τινά Id. Nu. 912 (anap.); ὗσαι χρυσόν τινι Pi. O. 7.50. [ῡ] in χρυσός and all derivs., though Lyric Poets sts. made υ short in the Adj. χρύσεος (q.v.); once we have χρῠσός, Pi. N. 7.78.] (Borrowed from Semitic, cf. Hebr. chārūts, Assyr. ḫurāšu ‘gold’, Aram. hara ‘yellow’.)

data.quote: ὁ χ. ἧσσον κτῆμα τοῦ κλάειν ἂν ἦν
ὡς χρυσὸς αὐτῷ τἀμὰ . . κακὰ δόξει ποτʼ εἶναι

children.definition: goddess of the lower world wearing golden sandals and drinking blood, epith. of Hecate, Tab. Defix. in Rh.Mus. 55.250 ( -ατμο- lapis).
golden-sandalled, Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.11.
gold-sapphire, Alex.Trall. 2.1.
embroidered with gold, χιτών, of the Roman tunica palmata, D.H. 3.61, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Top. 262.1.
Dsc. 4.88 ( χρυσί- codd.).
PMag.Leid.V. 13.30.
sowing gold, Nonn. D. 10.145.
worth its weight in gold, ἰχθύων ποικιλία Lyd. Mag. 3.62.
with roof of gold, Him. Or. 18.3.

definition: χρυσοστέπτωρ, ορος, ὁ, ἡ, = sq., Man. 4.39.

children.definition: gold-crowned, Φοίβη Hes. Th. 136; κόρα E. Ion 1085 (lyr., χρυσεο- codd.); epith. of Hebe, Hes. Th. 17, Pi. O. 6.57; of Aphrodite, h.Hom. 6.1, Sapph 9; χ. ἄεθλα in which the prize was a crown of gold, Pi. O. 8.1.
of a golden crown, S. Ichn. 45, cf. PMag.Par. 1.2271; winner of a golden crown, PLond. 3.1243.4 (iii A. D.).
woven with gold, χιτῶνες Lyd. Mag. 3.64.
of golden mouth, i.e. dropping words of gold, epith. of orators, as Dio Chrysostom, Men.Rh.p.390S., cf. Suid. s.v. Ἰωάννης Ἀντιοχεύς.
made of twisted gold, ἀγκύλαι S. OT 203 (lyr.).
with heaps of gold, Tz. H. 12.332.
goldsmith, AP 6.92 ( Phil.), Luc. Lex. 9.

definition: χρυσότερος, α, ον, a Comp. formed from χρυσός (3),

children.definition: more golden, χρύσω χρυσοτέρα Sapph. 122; αὐτῆς χρυσοτέρη κύπριδος IG 14.1892.
wrought of gold, A. Th. 660, Fr. 184, E. Ph. 220 (lyr.), Eub. 20.4, dub. in E. Med. 984 (lyr., fort. legit Sch.).
with golden armour, E. Rh. 340.
laying golden eggs, ὄρνις Aesop. 343.
with bow of gold, of Apollo, Pi. O. 14.10, Isyll. 48.
embossed with gold, LXX Ex. 25.17(18); also χρῡσο-τόρνευτος, κρατήρ Ps.-Callisth. 3.28.

definition: χρυσοτριαίνης, ου, ὁ, = sq., cj. in Arion l. 2.

children.definition: with trident of gold, of Poseidon, Arion l. 2, Ar. Eq. 559 (lyr.), IG 1(2).706.
wrought of gold, κρᾶνος E. El. 470 (lyr.); φιάλη Critias 2.8 D.
with ears or handles of gold, τρίπους Hom. Fr. 17.
PFlor. 11.5 (vi A. D.).
gold-mine, Str. 4.6.7.
to be a χρυσουργός, Poll. 7.97.
goldsmith, LXX Wi. 15.9, Poll. l.c.

definition: χρυσοῦς, ῆ, οῦν, Att. contr. for χρύσεος (q.v.).

children.definition: interwoven with gold, χιτῶνες Callix. 2, Hdn. 5.3.6, cf. Chares 4J.; τήβεννα Ptol.Euerg. 3J.; μίτραι D.S. 5.46.
= sq., πτέρυγες Anacr. 25.

definition: χρυσοφαής, ές, Boeot. χρουσο- Corinn. Supp. 1.20:—

children.definition: gold-shining, κάλπιδες l.c.; Ἅλιος E. Hec. 636 (lyr.); Ἔρως Id. Hipp. 1275 (lyr.); στέφανος Epigr. ap. Plu. Flam. 12; also χρυσοφάη θεράπαιναν Ἀφροδίτας Sapph. 57A.
with trappings of gold, E. Tr. 520 (lyr., cj. for χρυσεο-), Plb. 30.25.6, D.S. 31.18, App. Pun. 32.
shining like gold, Dsc. 5.100, Corn. ND 17: hence Subst. χρῡσο-φάνεια, ἡ, Eust. 991.22.
S. Ichn. 156.
with sword of gold, Sch.D Il. 5.509.
gold-beaming, σέλας A. Ag. 288.

wear golden ornaments or apparel, Hdt. 1.82, Euph. 38, Sotad. 9.4, Arist. Oec. 1349a24, Chor. 32.70 p.360F.-R.; διά τινα ἀρχὴν ἢ ἱερωσύνην Artem. 2.9, cf. 1.77; esp. of priests, δεδόχθαι τοὺς ἱερεῖς -φορεῖν τοῖς θεοῖς SIG 704 E 31 ( Delph., ii B. C.); οἱ -φοροῦντες τῇ θεῷ ἱερεῖς BMus.Inscr. 4.481*.437 ( Ephes., ii A. D.); also [ ἰχθῦς] χρυσοφορέων wearing a gold ornament, Luc. Syr.D. 45; wear a gold ring, App. Pun. 104.

children.label: II
children.definition: pay gold as a tax, D.S. 4.83.

children.label: III
children.definition: carry gold, of streams, App. Mith. 103.
borne about by gold, Man. 5.309.
wearing of golden ornaments, Str. 17.3.7: pl., D.Chr. 2.51, Vett.Val. 3.17.
right to wear gold ornaments, SIG 704 H 26 ( Delph., ii B. C.); χ. μετὰ πορφύρας IG 4.606.16 ( Argos).
= Lat. jus anuli aurei, IG 5(1).1432.37 ( Messene, i B. C. /i A. D., cf. l.12), 22.4193.14 (i A. D.).
wearing gold, golden ornaments or apparel, Μῆδοι Simon. 90; παρθένοι Lycophronid. 1, cf. Hdt. 4.104; δειρή E. Hec. 152 (anap.).

children.label: b
children.definition: Ὁμόνοια, BMus.Inscr. 4.481*.471 ( Ephes., ii A. D.).
χρυσοφορέω 1), συνέδριον χρυσοφόρων Ephes. 2 No.83c; χ. στρατηγός BCH 28.81 ( Tralles); χ. alone, CIG 2929 (ibid.).
carrying gold, ἡμίονος App. Mith. 82.
producing gold, περὶ χ. γῆς, title of work by Teucer Cyzic. ap. Suid. s.v. Τεῦκρος.

children.label: II
children.definition: χρυσοφόρον, τό, = ἤλεκτρον I, Dsc. 1.83.
with a golden spot over each eye, gilt-head, Sparus aurata, Epich. 51, Eup. 150, Archipp. 18, Arist. HA 598a10, PSI 7.862.6 (iii B. C.), Ptol.Euerg. 1J.; written χρύσοφος in Cyran. 44, Gloss.
gold-keeper, of gryphons, Hdt. 4.13, 27; σωρευτὰς χρημάτων καὶ χ. Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).150; treasurer, θεοῦ E. Ion 54.
keeping money, θύλακος Plu. Arist. 24.
golden-haired, of Apollo, Pi. P. 2.16; Dor. nom. χρῡσοχαίτᾱς, Limen. 4; of Eros, Anacreont. 41.12.
with gold-studded bridle, ἵππος Hdt. 9.20, X. Cyr. 1.3.3, etc.; χ. πάταγον ψαλίων Ar. Pax 155 (anap.).
aurochalcum (sic), Gloss.
with gold on the hands, i.e. with gold rings, Luc. Tim. 20.
with golden lyre, Παιάν Epigr.Gr. 1023 ( Nubia).
in coat of gold, gold-robed, θήβα Pi. Fr. 195; Λυδοί Pisand. ap. Lyd. Mag. 3.64; with rind of gold, ἐλάη AP 6.102 ( Phil.).
the shop of a χρυσοχόος, Test. ap. D. 21.22, Plb. 26.1.2, Zeno Stoic. 1.58.
follow the trade of goldsmith, Ar. Pl. 164, X. Oec. 18.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: smelt ore in order to extract gold from it: hence prov. of those who fail in any speculation, as the Athenians in their attempts to extract gold from their silver-ores, Pl. R. 450b, cf. Din. Fr. 6.13, Harp.

definition: χρυσοχόης, ου, Dor. χρῡσοχό-ᾱς, α, ὁ,

children.definition: Dialex. 7.3 (in acc. pl. -ας).

of or for a goldsmith or gold-smelter, τὸ χ. πῦρ Arist. Spir. 485a34; ἐργάζεσθαι χ. τέχνην follow the trade of a goldsmith, Test. ap. D. 21.22, cf. Poll. 7.102; ἄχυρα χ. goldsmithʼs dross, PHolm. 5.7, cf. PLeid.X. 33 B.

definition: χρυσοχοκή, ἡ, tax paid by goldsmiths, PPetr. 2p.141 (iii B. C.). -->

children.definition: one who melts or casts gold; of one who gilds the horns of a sacrificial victim, Od. 3.425.

goldsmith, Ar. Lys. 408, D. 21.16, Plu. QConv. 2.658d; usually uncontracted in Att., IG 1(2).374.103, 2(2).1558.56, but χρῡσοχοῦς ib. 1(2).347.40, and so later, PStrassb. 92.4 (iii B. C.), Baillet Inscr. Gr. et Lat.des tombeaux des rois 1076, Ostr.Bodl. i 304 (ii B. C.).
gold-coloured, AP 9.525.
Gloss. ( crisobsella cod.).

make golden, gild, IG 1(2).374.29, D.S. 1.23, Luc. Ind. 15, Dialex. 2.13, IGRom. 4.1431.16 ( Smyrna), Aët. 1.106; χρυσίῳ χ. τι LXX l.c., al.:— Pass., χ. παχέϊ κάρτα χρυσῷ Hdt. 2.132; Παλλαδίων χρυσουμένων Ar. Ach. 547; τῶν . . κρανίων κεχρυσωμέων Pl. Euthd. 299e; perh. of gilding the horns of victims, Supp.Epigr. 6.629, 630 ( Pisidia).
Crustuminus, Crustumerian pear (cf. Plin. HN 23.115), PLond. 3.964.17 (iii A. D.).
receiver or collector of taxes in gold, Stud.Pal. 8.1111.5 (vi A. D.), Gloss., etc.; in papyri also χρυσουποδέκτης, e. g. PFlor. 11.5 (vi A. D.).
that which is made of gold, wrought gold, E. Ion 1030, 1430; χρυσώματα gold plate, Lys. Fr. 56, OGI 214.26 ( Didyma, iii B. C.), Plb. 30.25.16.
plate-chest, Callix. 2.
treasure, PLips. 102.7 (iv A. D.).
buy or change gold, Isoc. 17.40, IG 2(2).1493 ( Phil.Wochenschr. 48.783).
financial officer in Egypt, PBremen 83 iii4 (iv A. D.), PLips. 62i2, al. (iv A. D.), etc.
bought for gold, of slaves, Callistr.Hist. 10.
Ar. Th. 321 (lyr.); of fish, χρυσώπιδες ἰχθύες ἐλλοί Titanomach. Fr. 4 (with masc. Subst.).
with golden eyes or face, beaming like gold, of the sun, E. El. 740 (lyr.), cf. Corn. ND 32; αἰθήρ S. Fr. [1128].
gold-coloured, Plu. Sull. 6; μάργαρος Ael. NA 15.8 ( Comp.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Plu. Sollert. 2.977f.

definition: χρυσώρυφος, ον, perh. an error for χρυσωρύχος, ἔργα, i.e.

children.definition: goldmines, IG Rom. 4.608 ( Phrygia).
gold-mine, Str. 3.2.8; also χρῡσωρῠχ-ιον, τό, Agatharch. 24.
book on gold-mining, Olymp.Alch. p.87B.
mine for gold, Ael. NA 4.27 codd. ( χρυσοχοεῖν Gesner).
gold-extractor, alchemist, Ὧρος ὁ χ. Olymp.Alch. p.103B.
digging for gold, μύρμηκες Str. 2.1.9; ἔργα Supp.Epigr. 6.166 ( Phrygia, iv A. D.): as Subst., gold-miner, Zos.Alch. p.240B.; cf. χρυσώρυφος.
gilding, Callix. 1, Plu. Publ. 15, Nic. 3, PLeid.X. 49B., Aët. 1.106.
gilder, IG 2(2).1635.37, Plu. Glor.Ath. 2.348e.
gilt, Phalaec. ap. Ath. 10.440d, restd. in IG 1(2).359.3.
female gilder, Tab.Defix. 69.4 (iii B. C.).
gold-coloured, shining like gold, θύρσος E. Ba. 553 (lyr.).

definition: χρυτταῖος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month at Lamia in Thessaly, IG 9(2).71.5, al. (ii B. C.).

χρῴζω, E. Ph. 1625, Alex. 141.9, Arist. Mir. 834a8, later χρώννῡμι, χρωννύω (qq.v.): fut. χρώσω Hsch.: aor. ἔχρωσα Arist. Mete. 371a24, Luc. Im. 7, etc.: pf. κέχρωκα ( ἐπι-) Plu. Pyth. 2.395d:— Pass., fut. χρωσθήσομαι Gal. 1.278, 9.394: aor. ἐχρώσθην Pl. Tht. 156e, etc.: pf. κέχρωσμαι Hp. Epid. 7.17, E. Med. 497, etc.: plpf. ἐκέχρωστο Alciphr. Fr. 6.17:—

children.definition: touch the surface of a body, and generally, touch, γόνατα μὴ χρῴζειν ἐμά E. Ph. 1625.

tinge, stain, ἔχρωσε μέν, ἔκαυσε δʼ οὔ Arist. Mete. 371a24, etc.; τὸ καλὸν χρῶμα δευσοποιῷ χρῴζομεν Alex. l.c.; πόσον αἷμα τὴν γῆν ἔχρωσεν; Lib. Or. 42.41; εὖ χ. gives a good complexion, Orib. Syn. 5.23:— Pass., Arist. Col. 793b23, Mete. 375a6, Zos.Alch. p.171B.; ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου Luc. Anach. 25; κεστρεὺς χρωσθείς browned in frying, Antiph. 217.11; ὑπόξανθος τοῖς φύλλοις ἐκέχρωστο αὐγή Alciphr. l.c.; of the moon, χρωσθεῖσα φύσιν πολυκαμπέα Alex.Eph. ap. Theo Sm. p.140H.; of the tongue, Gal. 9.394; τὰ μέλανα (sc. διαχωρήματα) ὑπὸ μελαίνης χολῆς . . χρῴζεται Id. 18(2).142.
taint, defile, αἵματι παλάμαν APl. 16.138, cf. Porph. Antr. 11:— Pass., metaph., μάτην κεχρώσμεθα κακοῦ πρὸς ἀνδρός E. Med. 497; of air, to be infected, μιάσμασιν Hp. Flat. 6.
paint, ἔχρωσα . . κατηφεῖ χρώματι τὰ νάματα Him. Ecl. 12.7.
skin, esp. of the human body, κάθαρσις διὰ τοῦ χρώματος Hp. Insomn. 89 (sed χρωτός recte cod. θ).

children.label: II
children.definition: colour, esp. of the skin or body, complexion, Hdt. 2.32, 3.101, Hp. Aph. 4.40, etc.; χρῶμα ἀλλάξαι E. Ph. 1246, cf. Men. Epit. 466; μεθιστάναι τοῦ χρώματος Ar. Eq. 399 (lyr.); τὸ χ. διακεκναισμένος Id. Nu. 120; παντοδαπὰ ἠφίει χρώματα changed colour continually, Pl. Ly. 222b; χ. διαμένον an unchanging colour (of the face), Nicol.Com. 1.28; so of animals, x. Cyn. 4.7.

colour, Gorg. ap. S.E. M. 7.85; defined by Zeno Stoic. 1.26; χρώματα βάπτειν use pigments for dyeing, Pl. R. 429e; ἐκ τῶν χρωμάτων καὶ σχημάτων θεωρεῖν, i.e. look to the outside only, ib. 601a; διὰ τῶν χ. ἀπεικάζειν X. Mem. 3.10.1; χρώμασι καὶ σχήμασι μιμεῖσθαι Arist. Po. 1447a18; περὶ χρωμάτων, title of treatise by Arist.; ἐναλείφειν τοῖς χ. Id. GA 743b24; χρωμάτων κρᾶσις Luc. Zeux. 5; χρώματος ἔντριψις, of cosmetics, X. Cyr. 1.3.2; τοῖς ἐγχρίστοις εἰς τοὺς ὀφθαλμοὺς χρώμασιν Arist. GA 747a10; of medicines, φάρμακα χρώμασι καὶ ὀσμαῖς πεποικιλμένα Pl. Cra. 394a.

data.quote: τοῖς ἐγχρίστοις εἰς τοὺς ὀφθαλμοὺς χρώμασιν

children.label: III
children.definition: turmeric, Curcuma longa, used in dyeing, Thphr. Od. 31.

children.label: IV
children.definition: complexion, character of style in writing, χρώματα [λέξεως] (of τὸ στριφνόν, τὸ τυκνόν, etc.) D.H. Amm. 2.2; ποιητικῆς χρώματα Phld. Mus. p.84K., cf. Hermog. Id. 1.12.

ornaments, embellishments, ἀλλοτρίοις χ. καὶ κόσμοις Pl. Phdr. 239d, cf. Grg. 465b; also of style or language, D.H. Comp. 20; of Music, γυμνωθέντα . . τῶν τῆς μουσικῆς χρωμάτων τὰ τῶν τοιητῶν Pl. R. 601b.

data.quote: γυμνωθέντα . . τῶν τῆς μουσικῆς χρωμάτων τὰ τῶν τοιητῶν

children.definition: modification of the simplest music: τὰ μέλη μεταβολαῖς καὶ χρώμασιν ὡς εὖ κέκραται Antiph. 209.4; χρώματα εὔχροα ἐκιθάρισε Philoch. 66:but esp.

data.quote: τὰ μέλη μεταβολαῖς καὶ χρώμασιν ὡς εὖ κέκραται

children.label: b
children.definition: chromatic scale or music, οὔτε χρῶμα δειλοὺς οὔτε ἁρμονία ἀνδρείους ποιεῖ Anon. in PHib. 1.13.22, cf. Cleonid. Harm. 3, Bacch. Harm. 23, etc.: χ. μαλακόν, ἡμιόλιον, τονιαῖον, Cleonid. Harm. 7.

data.quote: οὔτε χρῶμα δειλοὺς οὔτε ἁρμονία ἀνδρείους ποιεῖ

children.definition: complexion, colourable pretence, Hermog. Stat. 1, 3 (pl.), Arg. D. 19 § 12.

children.label: VI
children.definition: complexion of heavenly bodies, Phld. D. 3.9, Vett.Val. 107.26.
colour, tinge, Arist. PA 664b16, GA 747a10, Thphr. Od. 31; τί τινι Alex. 188.4:— Pass., to be of such and such a colour, Hp. Coac. 380; χ. παντοδαπὰς χρόας Arist. Mete. 342b4.
χ. τῇ πρεπούσῃ ὑποκρίσει (of Demosthenes) D.H. Dem. 22, cf. Phld. Po. 2.43.
of, relating to colour:—but only found,

children.label: II
children.definition: offering a colourable pretext ( χρῶμα IV.4), τὸ χ., as name of a form of rebuttal, Aps. p.273H. (v.l. χρωμάτιον).

chromatic (cf. χρῶμα IV. 3), μελῳδία D.H. Comp. 19; μέλος, opp. διάτονον, ἐναρμόνιον, Alciphr. 1.18, cf. Aristox(?). Oxy. 667.1; τὸ -κὸν [γένος] the chromatic genus, Plu. QConv. 2.744c, cf. Phld. Mus. p.63K., Ph. 1.321.
coloured, ἀβόλλαι, λάκκος, Peripl.M.Rubr. 6, cf. Sotion p.183W.
pigment, paint, AP. 11.423 (pl., Hellad.).
colouring, dyeing, μύρων Dsc. 1.71 (pl.), Sch. Ar. Nu. 516.
laying on of colour or paint, Philostr. Ep. 40.
dealer in colours, Gloss.
dyeing, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.177.
dyer, Rhetor. ib. 8(4).137.
mixture of colours, changing of complexion, Ptol. Tetr. 182 (pl., = αἰσχημοσύναι acc. to Sch. ad loc.( 152)).
i.e. apply χρῶμα IV.2), τῇ λέξει Luc. Hist.Conscr. 48:— Pass., Steph. in Hp. 1.165; χρωννύω, = χρῴζω, Alex.Aphr. in de An. 45.16, Lib. Decl. 7.7.

definition: χρώς, ὁ, gen. χρωτός, dat. χρωτί, acc. χρῶτα ( Att. χρώ only in Choerob. in Theod. 1.248H.): Ep. and Ion. gen. χροός, dat. χροΐ, acc. χρόα (also in Lesbian, Sapph. Supp. 10.6, al.), as always in Hom.and Hes., exc. gen. χρωτός in Il. 10.575, acc. χρῶτα Od. 18.172, 179, Hes. Op. 556; Emp. uses χρωτός, 76.3 (but χροΐ 100.17); Pi. uses χρωτί, χρῶτα, P. 1.55, I. 4(3).23(41); these forms are freq. in Trag., but Ion. dat. χροΐ occurs in S. Tr. 605, and χροός, χροΐ, χρόα are freq. in E., Hec. 548, Med. 1175, Ph. 264, al. :—dat. χρῷ occurs in the phrase ἐν χρῷ v. infr. I.2 and in Sapph. 2.10.—rare in Com.and Att. Prose.

children.label: I
children.definition: skin or flesh, οὔ σφι λίθος χρὼς οὐδὲ σίδηρος Il. 4.510; καὶ γάρ θην τούτῳ τρωτὸς χρώς 21.568; χρῶτʼ ἀπονιψαμένη Od. 18.172; ἀκρότατον δʼ ἄρʼ ὀϊστὸς ἐπέγραψε χρόα Il. 4.139; ταμέειν χρόα νηλέϊ χαλκῷ 13.501; λιλαιοένη χροὸς ἆσαι, of a spear, 21.168; κακὰ χροΐ εἵματʼ ἔχοντα Od. 14.506; χρῷ πῦρ ὐπαδεδρόμακεν Sapph. 2.10; μύροις χρῶτα λιπαίνων Anaxil. 18.1 (anap.): esp. flesh, opp. bone, φθινύθει δʼ ἀμφʼ ὀστεόφι χρώς Od. 16.145; οὐδέ τί οἱ χρὼς σήπεται Il. 24.414, cf. 19.33 (which usage is said by Gal. to have been Ionic, 18(2).435, with reference to Hp. Fract. 9); τὸ δέρμα τοῦ χρωτός LXX Le. 13.11, etc.; τοῦ χρωτὸς ἥδιστον ἀπέπνει Aristox. Fr.Hist. 84: generally, oneʼs body, frame, Pi. P. 1.55, A. Fr. 192.6 (anap.); χριμφθῆναι χροΐ Id. Supp. 790 (lyr.); στεῖλαί νυν ἀμφὶ χρωτὶ . . πέπλους E. Ba. 821, cf. S. Tr. 605: pl., διὰ τί . . οἱ χρῶτες ὄζουσι; Arist. Pr. 877b21; also κατεδήσαντο . . τοὺς ὑγιεῖς χρῶτας, ὡς τραυματίαι D.H. 9.50.

data.quote: οὔ σφι λίθος χρὼς οὐδὲ σίδηρος
καὶ γάρ θην τούτῳ τρωτὸς χρώς
ἀκρότατον δʼ ἄρʼ ὀϊστὸς ἐπέγραψε χρόα
κατεδήσαντο . . τοὺς ὑγιεῖς χρῶτας, ὡς τραυματίαι

children.definition: ἐν χροΐ, or ἐν χρῷ, close to the skin, ἐν χροΐ κείρειν to shave close, Hdt. 4.175; ἐν χρῷ κεκαρμένοι X. HG 1.7.8; ἐν χρῷ κουριῶντας Pherecr. 30:—metaph., to the quick, ξυρεῖ γὰρ ἐν χρῷ τοῦτο S. Aj. 786; ἐν χρῷ παραπλεῖν sail past so as to shave or graze, Th. 2.84; τὴν μάχην συνάψαι ἐν χρῷ to fight at close quarters, Plu. Thes. 27; ἡ ἐν χρῷ συνουσία close acquaintance, Luc. Ind. 3: c. gen., ἐν χρῷ τινος close to, hard by a person or thing, τοῦ θώρακος (v.l. σώματος) Plu. Alex. fort. 2.345a; τῆς γῆς Fac.lun. ib. 925b, Luc. Herm. 5: abs., ἐν χρῷ near at hand, Id. Hist.Conscr. 24, al.; cf. EM 313.53, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: the colour of the skin, complexion, μελαίνετο δὲ χρόα καλόν Il. 5.354; τρέπεται χ. his colour changes, i. e. he turns pale, 13.279, cf. 17.733; ὠχρήσαντα χρόα Od. 11.529; χρόα . . ἀμείβειν Parm. 8.41; μεθίστη χρωτὸς . . φύσιν E. Alc. 174; μεταλλακτῆρα πουλύπουν χροός Ion Trag. 36; τί χρὼς τέτραπται; (paratrag.) Ar. Lys. 127; φεῦγε δʼ ἀπὸ χρώς Theocr. 23.13; rare in Att. Prose, ἐπὶ τῷ χρωτὶ μέγα φρονεῖν X. Smp. 4.54, cf. Oec. 10.5: in Ion. Prose, of the colour of a finger, χροΐ δῆλα Pherecyd.Syr. ap. D.L. 1.118 (v.l. χρωΐ, cf. Vorsokr. 5i.44).
colour, ἀμείβων χρῶτα πορφυρᾷ βαφῇ A. Pers. 317; τὸν χρῶτα [μεταβάλλει] ὁ χαμαιλέων Arist. Mir. 832b14; χρὼς αἵματος Orph. L. 660.
colouring, tinting, Dsc. 5.112, Poll. 7.169, PLeid.X. 15B.; χ. λαμβάνειν Epicur. Ep. 2p.51U.
that which colours or dyes: χ. μόλυβος a lead- pencil, AP 6.68 ( Jul.).

definition: χρωτίδιον, τό, Dim. of χρώς, Cratin. 302 (troch.).

children.definition: colour, χ. τὸν οἶνον give it colour and flavour, Plu. QConv. 2.693c:— Med., χ. τὴν φύσιν τινί tinge oneʼs nature with . . , Ar. Nu. 516 (lyr.).
to be used in vulgar language, Eust. 421.19.
vulgar language, coarseness, Phot. Bibl. p.56.
poured out in streams, abundant, LXX Ex. 1.7; στέφανοι, i.e. χύδην πεπλεγμένοι, Ath. 15.686a. Adv. -ως pell-mell, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.68.

children.label: II
children.definition: common, ordinary, φοίνικες Dsc. 5.31, cf. Plin. HN 13.46; λίθος Plu. Profect. 2.85f; ἔλαιον Hippiatr. 69.

children.label: b
children.definition: χ. πλῆθος Str. 1.2.8; ὁ χ. Porph. Abst. 4.18; οἱ χ. Str. 3.1.5, Ph.Bybl. 5, Porph. Chr. 63; opp. οἱ σοφοί, Phld. Po. 5.23, cf. Rh. 2.157S., al.: Comp. οἱ χυδαιότεροι (misspelt χυδεώτεροι) Sch. E. Hipp. 948.
common, vulgar, coarse, λαλιά Plb. 14.7.8; χυδαῖα καὶ φαῦλα Phld. Mus. p.95K.
vulgarity, Jul. Gal. 43b, 238b.
make vulgar, debase, in Pass., Aq. Is. 33.9.
in common speech, Eust. 50.14.
χ. γαῖα IG 7.580 ( Tanagra).

definition: χύδην [ῠ], Dor. χύδαν Call. Fr. 1.11P., Adv., ( χέω)

children.definition: as if poured out, in floods or heaps: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: without order or system, promiscuously, indiscriminately, καταπάττειν χ. wholesale (opp. κοτυλίζειν, to sell by retail), Pherecr. 168; χ. βεβλῆσθαι Pl. Phdr. 264b; στεφάνων χ. πεπλεγμένων Alex. 52; πάντα χ. ἔστω AP 10.100 ( Antiphan.); τὰ χ. μαθήματα . . ἐν τῇ παιδείᾳ γενόμενα Pl. R. 537c; φορτικῶς καὶ χ. ὅ τι ἂν ἐπέλθῃ λέγουσιν Isoc. 12.24, cf. Ep. 9.5; νομίμων χ. ὡς εἰπεῖν κειμένων Arist. Pol. 1324b5; ἐναλείφειν τοῖς καλλίστοις φαρμάκοις χ. Id. Po. 1450b2.

data.quote: τὰ χ. μαθήματα . . ἐν τῇ παιδείᾳ γενόμενα
φορτικῶς καὶ χ. ὅ τι ἂν ἐπέλθῃ λέγουσιν

children.label: II
children.definition: in unfettered language, i.e. in prose, opp. ἐν ποιήμασι, Pl. Lg. 811d; τὰ χ., opp. τὰ μέτρα, Arist. Rh. 1409b7.

children.label: III
children.definition: abundantly, AP 9.316 ( Leon.), Hp. Ep. 3; [ἁ] χύδαν . . λύπα overflowing grief, Call. l.c.; spreading, of poison, AP 9.233 ( Eryc.).
Dim. of χυλός, a little juice, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.96; ὁ Φάλερνος χ. σταφυλίου M.Ant. 6.13.
extract the juice from a plant by infusion or decoction, Dsc. Praef. 9:— Pass., σπέρμα χυλισθέν Thphr. HP 9.9.4, cf. Dsc. 2.182, etc.
